analyzed: de ni gong ma las kyang dpag tu med cing bgrang ba las 'das pa'o //

original: de nyid kyang cis she na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang cis she na /

analyzed: de nyid kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i smon lam grub pa tshad med do //

analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi yon tan gyi khyad par la tshad med do //

analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig @119b brgya stong gi yab dang yum lta bu'o //

analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong la gdams ngag ston pa'o //

analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtam gyi skyes bur gyur pa'o //

analyzed: 'jam dpal ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bstod cing bsngags pa'o zhes pa la sogs rgya cher 'byung ngo //

analyzed: dus tshod der khye'u thos sgrogs zhes bya bas chos thams cad med par go nas kun la med par bstan te /

original: de ltar sde gnyis su chad nas rtsod pa byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sde gnyis su chad nas rtsod pa byung ngo //

original: de'i rnam smin gyis gnyis ka dmyal bar skyes so //
analyzed: de'i rnam smin gyis gnyis ka dmyal bar skyes so //
translated: As a result of that, both of them were born in hell.

analyzed: de gnyis kyi 'khor rnams kyang lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba za bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa de nas thar nas mthar 'dab chags byar skyes so //

translated: Moreover, the one with much learning was thrown into a pit of fire by a friend for twenty-one days. Because of his much learning, he was born as the lord of the hells for forty-two days. Because of his learning, he said, If you can bear it, it is suitable.

original: nas / des bskyur bas bsam pa bzang pos zhag bdun lon nas tshe 'phos nas khyim bdag gi bu sbyin pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: nas / des bskyur bas bsam pa bzang pos zhag bdun lon nas tshe 'phos nas khyim bdag gi bu sbyin pa zhes bya bar gyur to //

analyzed: khye'u thos sgrogs ni grogs so cig dang gnyis dmyal dpon gyi shing rta 'dren pa la grogs pos ma nus nas /
translated: The boy Śroṇakoṭiviṃśa was pulling the chariot of the lord of the dead together with a companion. The companion was unable to do it,

original: des sh'akya thub pa la 'jam gang phul nas sems bskyed nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus khyim bdag gi bu de tshe snga ma dran pa'i shes pa byung nas spyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'o //

translated: Thus,

original: bya rgod phung po'i ra li sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'dus nas so //
analyzed: bya rgod phung po'i ra li sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'dus nas so //
translated: in the Vulture Peak, an inconceivable number of buddhas and bodhisattvas, such as Vajrapani, gathered.

original: de'i dus su lha'i bu rin chen gyis zhu ba'i bsam pa mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de'i dus su lha'i bu rin chen gyis zhu ba'i bsam pa mkhyen nas /
translated: At that time, the god son Ratna, knowing the intention of the request,

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di rnams yon tan dang byin rlabs dang / ji ltar sgrub bar zhu bar 'dod pas gsung 'tshal zhes zhus pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal 'di rnams yon tan dang byin rlabs dang / ji ltar sgrub bar zhu bar 'dod pas gsung 'tshal zhes zhus pas /
translated: said, Noble Manjushri, since you wish to request the qualities, blessings, and how to practice of these, please speak.

original: 'jam dpal na re nga rang la yon tan brjod na bdag la bdag gis bstod par mchi bas lha dbang mi'i ston pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas gsung 'tshal zhes zhus so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal na re nga rang la yon tan brjod na bdag la bdag gis bstod par mchi bas lha dbang mi'i ston pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas gsung 'tshal zhes zhus so //
translated: Manjushri said, If I were to describe my own qualities, it would be like praising myself, so please request the speech of the teacher of humans, the blessed Shakyamuni, the lord of gods.

original: ston pas cang mi gsung ba'i dus su byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje khro bo lnga brgya dang thabs cig tu zhus so //
analyzed: ston pas cang mi gsung ba'i dus su byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje khro bo lnga brgya dang thabs cig tu zhus so //
translated: When the Teacher was silent, the Bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi requested [the tantra] together with five hundred wrathful ones.

original: der ston bas 'jam dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba le'u khri drug stong rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud bka' stsal to //
analyzed: der ston bas 'jam dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba le'u khri drug stong rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud bka' stsal to //
translated: There, the Teacher taught the Net of Illusory Manifestations of Mañjuśrī, a chapter of sixty thousand [verses], the Tantra of Great Yoga.

original: de'i rjes la zab pa dang rgya che ba'i rdo rje'i glur blangs pa'i don dgrol ba'i phyir mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di rdo rje'i tshig tu gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i rjes la zab pa dang rgya che ba'i rdo rje'i glur blangs pa'i don dgrol ba'i phyir mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di rdo rje'i tshig tu gsungs so //
translated: After that, in order to explain the meaning of the profound and vast vajra songs, this Praise to the Names [of Mañjuśrī] was spoken in vajra words.

original: de nas zhes pa ni de ma thag pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni de ma thag pa la sbyor ro //
translated: Then is connected to the immediate [context].

original: de yang sgyu 'phrul dra bar dkyil 'khor dang lha dang / dbang dang rab gnas la sogs pa'i rim pa kun bstan nas /
analyzed: de yang sgyu 'phrul dra bar dkyil 'khor dang lha dang / dbang dang rab gnas la sogs pa'i rim pa kun bstan nas /
translated: Moreover, having taught all the stages of the maṇḍala, deities, empowerments, consecration, and so forth in the Net of Illusory Manifestations,

original: rje btsun gyi rang bzhin dang mdzad pa'i phrin las dang yon tan bstan pa'i phyir de nas so //
analyzed: rje btsun gyi rang bzhin dang mdzad pa'i phrin las dang yon tan bstan pa'i phyir de nas so //
translated: in order to teach the nature, activities, and qualities of the venerable one, [it says] then.

original: 'di la tshigs bcad sum brgya bcu gnyis kyis bstan pa 'di skabs bcu bzhir bstan pa de dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / snod kyi lo rgyus kyi don dang dris las phan yon 'thad pa dang bcas pa bstan par @121a * //
analyzed: 'di la tshigs bcad sum brgya bcu gnyis kyis bstan pa 'di skabs bcu bzhir bstan pa de dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / snod kyi lo rgyus kyi don dang dris las phan yon 'thad pa dang bcas pa bstan par @121a * //
translated: In order to not contradict that, the meaning of the history of the vessel and the benefits of the reply will be explained.

original: bya'o ; / de la dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang nas zhu ba po dang 'khor rnams bstan te /
analyzed: bya'o ; / de la dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang nas zhu ba po dang 'khor rnams bstan te /
translated: The teacher is glorious Vajradhara, and the retinue is the questioner.

original: de yang sngon ston pa sh'akya thub pa 'khor phyag na rdo rje la sogs ba bzhugs pa'i dus su sems can rnams kyi lo tog med /
analyzed: de yang sngon ston pa sh'akya thub pa 'khor phyag na rdo rje la sogs ba bzhugs pa'i dus su sems can rnams kyi lo tog med /
translated: When the teacher Shakyamuni was residing with his retinue, such as Vajrapani, sentient beings had no crops.

original: tshe thung nad mang po byung nas sdug bsngal ba'i dus su ston pas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: tshe thung nad mang po byung nas sdug bsngal ba'i dus su ston pas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: When they had many illnesses and short lives, the teacher entered equipoise in samadhi.

original: klu'i rgyal po so ga ma med kyis gnod pa byas par gzigs nas thugs ka nas 'od zer gyis bskul bas klu'i rgyal po'i lus zhum nas /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po so ga ma med kyis gnod pa byas par gzigs nas thugs ka nas 'od zer gyis bskul bas klu'i rgyal po'i lus zhum nas /
translated: He saw that the naga king Svastika was causing harm, and he emanated light rays from his heart.

original: kye ma nga la gnod pa byed cing stobs 'gyed pa ni su yin zer nas bzhin la sogs pa bsgyur /
analyzed: kye ma nga la gnod pa byed cing stobs 'gyed pa ni su yin zer nas bzhin la sogs pa bsgyur /
translated: He said, Who is it that is harming me and challenging my power? and he changed his face and so forth.

original: khros pa'i sgra sgrogs shing nam mkha' la song nas sprin nag po'i gseb nas thog dang ser ba dbab par 'dod nas zhe sdang drag po skyes te /
analyzed: khros pa'i sgra sgrogs shing nam mkha' la song nas sprin nag po'i gseb nas thog dang ser ba dbab par 'dod nas zhe sdang drag po skyes te /
translated: He went into the sky and, from within a black cloud, he wanted to send down lightning and hail. He gave rise to intense anger.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba'i bdag po bka' bsgos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba'i bdag po bka' bsgos te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān commanded the Lord of Secrets:

original: gsang ba'i bdag po klu'i rgyal po 'di thul zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po klu'i rgyal po 'di thul zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Lord of Secrets, subdue this nāga king!

original: de nas gsang ba'i bdag pos rdo rje nam mkha' la gsor zhing rig pa brjod pas klu'i gnas dang khyim kun du me 'bar ro //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i bdag pos rdo rje nam mkha' la gsor zhing rig pa brjod pas klu'i gnas dang khyim kun du me 'bar ro //
translated: Then the Lord of Secrets brandished his vajra in the sky and recited the vidyā. Fire blazed everywhere in the nāga's abode and home.

original: der klu na re khyed dang nga gnyis stobs dgye yis zer nas da lta nyid du brlag bar bya'o zer nas khros pa'i nga ro sgrogs so //
analyzed: der klu na re khyed dang nga gnyis stobs dgye yis zer nas da lta nyid du brlag bar bya'o zer nas khros pa'i nga ro sgrogs so //
translated: The nāga said, You and I will compete in power. Now I will destroy you! and he roared with an angry voice.

original: de nas gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje lan gsum du gsor nas ri khyim la bsnun pas me 'bar bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rjes rdo rje lan gsum du gsor nas ri khyim la bsnun pas me 'bar bar gyur te /
translated: Then the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapani, brandished his vajra three times and struck the mountain with it, causing it to burst into flames.

original: der klu'i rgyal po khyab 'jug rang gi gnas su bros so //
analyzed: der klu'i rgyal po khyab 'jug rang gi gnas su bros so //
translated: Thereupon the naga king Vishnu fled to his own abode.

original: der byon nas khyab 'jug btul lo //🔽der sa blar ma h'a de ba'i sar bros pas yang btul lo //
analyzed: der byon nas khyab 'jug btul lo // der sa blar ma h'a de ba'i sar bros pas yang btul lo //
translated: He went there and subdued Vishnu.🔽He fled to the top of the earth, to the abode of Mahadeva, but was again subdued.

original: der sa steng lha tshangs pa'i gnas su bros pas yang btul lo //
analyzed: der sa steng lha tshangs pa'i gnas su bros pas yang btul lo //
translated: He fled to the abode of Brahma, the god of the earth, but was again subdued.

original: der thugs ma thub nas srog snying phul dam bcas so //
analyzed: der thugs ma thub nas srog snying phul dam bcas so //
translated: Thereupon, unable to bear it, he offered his life-force and made a vow.

original: des na gdul dka' sogs so //
analyzed: des na gdul dka' sogs so //
translated: Therefore, he is called Subduer of the Difficult to Tame and so forth.

original: 'khor gyis kyang gtso bo bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor gyis kyang gtso bo bzhin no //
translated: The retinue is also like the principal one.

original: ston pa gang la zhus she na de bzhin gshegs pa sogs so //
analyzed: ston pa gang la zhus she na de bzhin gshegs pa sogs so //
translated: If it is asked to whom the teacher made the request, it was to the Tathagata and so forth.

original: dgos pa ci yod na khyab bdag sogs rang don gzhan don no //
analyzed: dgos pa ci yod na khyab bdag sogs rang don gzhan don no //
translated: If it is asked for what purpose, it was for his own purpose and the purpose of others, such as the all-pervading lord and so forth.

original: ston pa'i mtshan dang yon tan zhe na /
analyzed: ston pa'i mtshan dang yon tan zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what are the name and qualities of the teacher,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sogs pas bstan no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sogs pas bstan no //
translated: it is taught by perfect buddha and so forth.

original: 'gro ba'i bla ma la sogs pa yon tan dang gzhan don bstan no //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bla ma la sogs pa yon tan dang gzhan don bstan no //
translated: The qualities and benefit for others are taught by guru of migrating beings and so forth.

original: de yang chos kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang chos kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the definition of the Dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das @121b 'jam dpal ye shes zhes pa brjod bya don gyi 'jam dpal ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin du bstan no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @121b 'jam dpal ye shes zhes pa brjod bya don gyi 'jam dpal ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin du bstan no //
translated: The Blessed One, Mañjuśrījñāna, is the subject, and it is taught to be the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses of Mañjuśrījñāna.

original: ming ni nas rab zhi ba'i bar gyis rjod byed tshig gi 'jam dpal thun mong ma yin pa bstan no //
analyzed: ming ni nas rab zhi ba'i bar gyis rjod byed tshig gi 'jam dpal thun mong ma yin pa bstan no //
translated: The name is taught to be the uncommon Mañjuśrī of the expression, from “Mañjuśrī” to “fully pacified.”

original: de gang gi yul yin na thog ma nas yang nas yang du gsungs pa zhes pas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi yul du bstan no //
analyzed: de gang gi yul yin na thog ma nas yang nas yang du gsungs pa zhes pas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi yul du bstan no //
translated: If it is asked to whom is that a domain, it is taught to be the domain of the buddhas of the three times, from “at the beginning” to “again and again.”

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what is the definition of the Dharma,

original: rgyud chen la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud chen la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is the great tantra, and so on.

original: dgos pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen la sogs so //
analyzed: dgos pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen la sogs so //
translated: The purpose is Mahāvajradhara, and so on.

original: ston pas shod cig par gdams pa sdud pa pos kyang dam bcas pa mgon po nas gsang 'dzin par ro //
analyzed: ston pas shod cig par gdams pa sdud pa pos kyang dam bcas pa mgon po nas gsang 'dzin par ro //
translated: The compiler’s promise to explain is “the protector” to “the holder of secrets.”

original: de yang sngon rgyal po yul 'khor skyong gdung chad du nye ba na rgyal po de'i spyi bo nas sha'i wa ba cig skyes de la mya ngan byas pas sha de bog pa las nam mkha' las sgra byung ste /
analyzed: de yang sngon rgyal po yul 'khor skyong gdung chad du nye ba na rgyal po de'i spyi bo nas sha'i wa ba cig skyes de la mya ngan byas pas sha de bog pa las nam mkha' las sgra byung ste /
translated: When he grieved over it, the flesh fell off. A voice from the sky said,

original: rgyal po chen bo rin po che'i mchod rten cig rtsigs la de'i bum pa'i nang du rin po che'i mchod rten gyi za ma tog stong rtsa gnyis kyi nang du sha dum bu re tshud la mchod pa chen po gyis shig //
analyzed: rgyal po chen bo rin po che'i mchod rten cig rtsigs la de'i bum pa'i nang du rin po che'i mchod rten gyi za ma tog stong rtsa gnyis kyi nang du sha dum bu re tshud la mchod pa chen po gyis shig //
translated: “Great king, build a precious stūpa. Inside its vase, place a precious stūpa. Inside the two thousand compartments, place a piece of flesh. Make a great offering.🔽A prince will appear who is especially exalted.”

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyal bu 'byung ngo zer nas de bzhin du byas pa las /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyal bu 'byung ngo zer nas de bzhin du byas pa las /
translated: He did as he was told.

original: dus tshod cig tu rgyal bu stong rtsa gnyis mtshan dang bcas pa byung ngo //
analyzed: dus tshod cig tu rgyal bu stong rtsa gnyis mtshan dang bcas pa byung ngo //
translated: At a certain time, twenty-one thousand princes with the marks appeared.

original: de rnams bskal pa bzang po'i sangs rgyas stong rtsa gnyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar zhal gyis bzhes so //
analyzed: de rnams bskal pa bzang po'i sangs rgyas stong rtsa gnyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: They promised to turn the wheel of the dharma as the twenty-one thousand buddhas of the fortunate eon.

original: de rnams kyi nang gi chen po lha tshangs bas nu bo tsho'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i zhu ba dbul bar byas /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang gi chen po lha tshangs bas nu bo tsho'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i zhu ba dbul bar byas /
translated: Among them, the eldest, the god Brahma, made a request to his younger brothers to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: tha chungs phyag na rdo rjes gsang sngags kyi sdud pa po bya bar byas te dam bca' byas pas gsang 'dzin no //
analyzed: tha chungs phyag na rdo rjes gsang sngags kyi sdud pa po bya bar byas te dam bca' byas pas gsang 'dzin no //
translated: The youngest, Vajrapani, acted as the compiler of the secret mantra and made a vow, so he became the keeper of the secrets.

original: nges par 'byung nas spyan sngar 'dug gis chos spyod pa'i tshul bstan /
analyzed: nges par 'byung nas spyan sngar 'dug gis chos spyod pa'i tshul bstan /
translated: After they had definitely left, they sat in front of the Buddha and demonstrated the way of practicing the Dharma.

original: zhus nas gnang ba'i tshul ni de nas bcom ldan 'das nas yid kyis nyon gyis bstan no //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi byung tshul ni gong gi khye'u thos sgrogs rdza mkhan snang byed kyi bur gyur //
analyzed: zhus nas gnang ba'i tshul ni de nas bcom ldan 'das nas yid kyis nyon gyis bstan no // bcom ldan 'das kyi byung tshul ni gong gi khye'u thos sgrogs rdza mkhan snang byed kyi bur gyur //
translated: The way of requesting and granting is then taught by the Bhagavan with the words Listen with your mind.

original: sh'akya thub pa chen po la 'jam gang phul nas sems bskyed nas rim par sa bcu thob nas /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa chen po la 'jam gang phul nas sems bskyed nas rim par sa bcu thob nas /
translated: The story of the Bhagavan is as follows: In the past, when the great Shakyamuni offered a garland to the Buddha, he generated the mind of enlightenment and gradually attained the ten grounds.

original: dam pa tog dkar du gyur nas lha rnams la chos ston cing bzhugs pa las nam mkha' nas sgra byung ste /
analyzed: dam pa tog dkar du gyur nas lha rnams la chos ston cing bzhugs pa las nam mkha' nas sgra byung ste /
translated: Having become the sublime one called White Peak, he was dwelling teaching the Dharma to the gods. From the sky, a voice sounded:

original: skyes bu chen po bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Great being, Bhagavan,

original: sems can kun la phan don du //🔽mi yi yul du gshegs su @122a * //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan don du // mi yi yul du gshegs su @122a * //
translated: For the sake of benefiting all sentient beings,🔽I request you to come to the human realm.

original: gsol // mi yi yul du gshegs nas kyang //
analyzed: gsol // mi yi yul du gshegs nas kyang //
translated: Having come to the human realm,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor du gsol //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor du gsol //
translated: I request you to turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: zhes bskul te /
analyzed: zhes bskul te /
translated: Thus he implored.

original: dga' ldan lha mi pham mgon po la dbu rgyan bskon nas ri rab kyi steng du byon nas gzigs ba bzhi la gzigs te /
analyzed: dga' ldan lha mi pham mgon po la dbu rgyan bskon nas ri rab kyi steng du byon nas gzigs ba bzhi la gzigs te /
translated: Then, in Tushita, the gods crowned Ajita, the protector, and he went to the top of Mount Meru and looked down on the four directions.

original: yab dang yum dang rigs dang grong khyer la gzigs nas mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyis 'gro ba'i ngon mdzad par dgongs te /
analyzed: yab dang yum dang rigs dang grong khyer la gzigs nas mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyis 'gro ba'i ngon mdzad par dgongs te /
translated: He looked at his father, mother, family, and city and thought about benefiting beings through the twelve deeds.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lnga /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lnga /
translated: The five mundane deeds:

original: 'das pa'i lnga /
analyzed: 'das pa'i lnga /
translated: The five transcendent deeds:

original: bla na med pa'i mdzad pa gnyis te bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mdzad pa gnyis te bcu gnyis so //
translated: The two unsurpassed deeds: these are the twelve.

original: yum gyi lhums su zhugs /
analyzed: yum gyi lhums su zhugs /
translated: He entered his mother’s womb.

original: byi ba lo'i dpyid zla ra ba'i nya'i nang par bltams /
analyzed: byi ba lo'i dpyid zla ra ba'i nya'i nang par bltams /
translated: On the morning of the full moon of the first spring month of the rat year, he was born.

original: gzhon nu rol rtsed mdzad /
analyzed: gzhon nu rol rtsed mdzad /
translated: He engaged in youthful sports.

original: sh'akya lag na be con can gyi bu mo khab tu bzhes rgyal srid la mnga' mdzad sras bltams /
analyzed: sh'akya lag na be con can gyi bu mo khab tu bzhes rgyal srid la mnga' mdzad sras bltams /
translated: He took a wife, the daughter of Shakya Club-Bearer, and ruled the kingdom. He had a son.

original: rgyal bu 'khor ba la skyo ba skyes nas rab tu byung /
analyzed: rgyal bu 'khor ba la skyo ba skyes nas rab tu byung /
translated: The prince became disgusted with the world and went forth.

original: lho phyogs gyad kyi yul chu bo nee ranydza na'i 'gram du dka' thub lo bdun mdzad /
analyzed: lho phyogs gyad kyi yul chu bo nee ranydza na'i 'gram du dka' thub lo bdun mdzad /
translated: He practiced austerities for seven years on the bank of the Nairañjanā River in the land of the Magadha people in the south.

original: srod la bdud btul /
analyzed: srod la bdud btul /
translated: In the evening he subdued Māra.

original: tho rangs mngon par sangs rgyas /
analyzed: tho rangs mngon par sangs rgyas /
translated: At dawn he attained full enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi shing plaksha la gzigs /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing plaksha la gzigs /
translated: He looked at the bodhi tree, the plaksa tree.

original: dam pa'i chos btsun par bya ba'i phyir zhag bdun du cang mi gsung bar bzhugs /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos btsun par bya ba'i phyir zhag bdun du cang mi gsung bar bzhugs /
translated: In order to make the holy Dharma respected, he sat in silence for seven days.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor /
translated: He turned the wheel of the holy Dharma.

original: der bka'i 'khor lo rim pa gsum bskor ba ni nyid kyi zhal nas zhes so //
analyzed: der bka'i 'khor lo rim pa gsum bskor ba ni nyid kyi zhal nas zhes so //
translated: The three stages of the wheel of the doctrine were turned by him, as it is said.

original: chos gsung ba'i snga ltas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gsung ba'i snga ltas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the signs of the imminent Dharma.

original: snying rje la sogs bsdus pa'i yon tan dang mtshan gyi yon tan dang / spro ba bskyed pa dang nyon cig par gdams pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs bsdus pa'i yon tan dang mtshan gyi yon tan dang / spro ba bskyed pa dang nyon cig par gdams pa'o //
translated: The qualities of compassion and so forth, the qualities of the name, the encouragement, and the advice to listen.

original: rgyud 'byung ba'i phyed dgongs pa la bzhag nas rigs drug la gzigs so //
analyzed: rgyud 'byung ba'i phyed dgongs pa la bzhag nas rigs drug la gzigs so //
translated: Having set the half of the origin of the tantra in the intention, he looked at the six families.

original: de yang rigs spyi dang / bye brag tu rigs dang / ye shes dang / gdul bya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / lha dang / mtshan dang / phrin las dang / gang la gang 'dul la cher gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rigs spyi dang / bye brag tu rigs dang / ye shes dang / gdul bya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / lha dang / mtshan dang / phrin las dang / gang la gang 'dul la cher gzigs pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, he saw the general class, the specific class, the pristine consciousness, the disciples, the maṇḍala, the deity, the name, the activity, and the taming of each.

original: de nas dgongs pa las bzhengs nas tshig gi bdag pos tsheg par bdun ma'i tshigs su bcad nas gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas dgongs pa las bzhengs nas tshig gi bdag pos tsheg par bdun ma'i tshigs su bcad nas gsungs so //
translated: Then, having arisen from his intention, the lord of speech spoke in seven-syllabled verses.

original: de'i don gsang sngags rgyal po drug sku dang ye shes drug go //
analyzed: de'i don gsang sngags rgyal po drug sku dang ye shes drug go //
translated: The meaning of that is the six kings of secret mantra, the six kāyas, and the six pristine consciousnesses.

original: de ltar gnas sam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gnas sam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether it is like that,

original: gnyis su med par byung ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med par byung ste /
translated: it arises as nondual.

original: gnyis med ye shes rang rig pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis med ye shes rang rig pa ste /
translated: Nondual pristine consciousness is self-awareness.

original: de yang sems dngos por grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang sems dngos por grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the mind is not an established entity.

original: mi skye chos can zhes ni sems skye ba med pa @122b stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi skye chos can zhes ni sems skye ba med pa @122b stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is said, “The phenomena that do not arise are empty.”

original: stong pa nyid de tshad mar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de tshad mar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether that emptiness is not a valid cognition,

original: mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa ste /
translated: it is said, “The phenomena that do not arise are empty.”

original: sems skye ba med pa nyid rig pa sna tshogs su gsal ba /
analyzed: sems skye ba med pa nyid rig pa sna tshogs su gsal ba /
translated: The mind that does not arise is the clarity of the various vidyā.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: It is naturally luminous.

original: de gang gis rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gis rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: By what is it realized?

original: yi ge bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon te /
analyzed: yi ge bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon te /
translated: It is indicated by the twelve syllables.

original: aa a'a ni gdod nas ma skyes pa /
analyzed: aa a'a ni gdod nas ma skyes pa /
translated: A and ā are primordially unborn.

original: ai a'i ni de la ye shes chen po 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: ai a'i ni de la ye shes chen po 'pho ba'o //
translated: I and ī are the transference of great pristine consciousness into that.

original: au a'u ni byang chub sems bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: au a'u ni byang chub sems bde ba chen po'o //
translated: U and ū are the bodhicitta of great bliss.

original: ae aee ni chos thams cad bsam brjod dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ae aee ni chos thams cad bsam brjod dang bral ba'o //
translated: E and ai are all phenomena free from thought and expression.

original: ao aoo ni sems kyi sprul pa sna tshogs su shar ba'o //🔽aam ni skye 'gag med pa'o //
analyzed: ao aoo ni sems kyi sprul pa sna tshogs su shar ba'o // aam ni skye 'gag med pa'o //
translated: O and au are the various emanations of the mind.🔽Aṃ is without arising and ceasing.

original: aa: ni skye med las 'das so //
analyzed: aa: ni skye med las 'das so //
translated: Aḥ is beyond nonarising.

original: snang ba chos can 'di nyid sna tshogs su snang ste /
analyzed: snang ba chos can 'di nyid sna tshogs su snang ste /
translated: This apparent subject appears as a variety.

original: de nyid rgyu rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: Since it arises from causes and conditions, it is empty.

original: stong pa gtan med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa gtan med pa ma yin te /
translated: Emptiness is not utterly nonexistent.

original: nyams su myong ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: Since it is endowed with experience,

original: de dbyer med pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: de dbyer med pa ni ye shes so //
translated: that indivisibility is pristine consciousness.

original: de yang sgro 'dogs gcod pa'i dus su tshad ma spyi'i mtshan nyid bcad pa'i yul la skyes bu mi slu ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang sgro 'dogs gcod pa'i dus su tshad ma spyi'i mtshan nyid bcad pa'i yul la skyes bu mi slu ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, at the time of eliminating superimpositions, the definition of valid cognition is that it is undeceiving with respect to the object.

original: de lam du khyer ba mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba nyid do //
analyzed: de lam du khyer ba mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba nyid do //
translated: The definition of direct perception is that it is free from conceptuality and non-mistaken.

original: 'di sgrub pa ni dgag sgrub dang bral ba'i sgro ma btags pa'i shes pas grub bo //
analyzed: 'di sgrub pa ni dgag sgrub dang bral ba'i sgro ma btags pa'i shes pas grub bo //
translated: This is established by a consciousness that is free from superimposition and free from affirmation and negation.

original: don gnyis med kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: don gnyis med kyi ye shes te /
translated: It is the wisdom of non-dual reality.

original: sems can dang sangs rgyas la khyad med de sems can las ma rig pas bsgribs so //
analyzed: sems can dang sangs rgyas la khyad med de sems can las ma rig pas bsgribs so //
translated: There is no difference between sentient beings and buddhas, except that sentient beings are obscured by ignorance.

original: sth'i to nas barti nam gyis dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi thugs ka na sku dang ye shes kyi tshul gyis bzhugs par bstan no //
analyzed: sth'i to nas barti nam gyis dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi thugs ka na sku dang ye shes kyi tshul gyis bzhugs par bstan no //
translated: From the Sthiti, the Vartika teaches that it abides in the hearts of the buddhas of the three times in the manner of the kayas and wisdoms.

original: sku dang po buddha dang 'khor lo dang / ye shes sems dpa' dang / zla ba dang aa'o //
analyzed: sku dang po buddha dang 'khor lo dang / ye shes sems dpa' dang / zla ba dang aa'o //
translated: The first kaya is Buddha, the wheel, the wisdom being, the moon, and A.

original: de nyams su len na /
analyzed: de nyams su len na /
translated: If one practices that,

original: aom badzra t'ikshna nas ya te na ma: sku drug dang dkyil 'khor drug dang / de la brten nas dbang dang rab gnas dang sbyin sreg dang tsha tsha dang bzlas pa dang sgom pa'i tshul gyis nyams su blang ngo //
analyzed: aom badzra t'ikshna nas ya te na ma: sku drug dang dkyil 'khor drug dang / de la brten nas dbang dang rab gnas dang sbyin sreg dang tsha tsha dang bzlas pa dang sgom pa'i tshul gyis nyams su blang ngo //
translated: The six bodies and the six mandalas are practiced by means of the methods of empowerment, consecration, fire-offering, building stupas, recitation, and meditation.

original: de la aa ra pa tsa na'i don 'di ltar nas tshul gyi mchog gis bstan te /
analyzed: de la aa ra pa tsa na'i don 'di ltar nas tshul gyi mchog gis bstan te /
translated: The meaning of arapaka is taught by the supreme method as follows:

original: 'dir lha dang sbyar ba yang yin la da res chos nyid byang chub sems de aa yis mtshon te skye med las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir lha dang sbyar ba yang yin la da res chos nyid byang chub sems de aa yis mtshon te skye med las byung ba'o //
translated: Here, it is also applied to the deity. The ultimate reality, bodhicitta, is indicated by the letter A, arising from the unborn.

original: skye med de la dbye ba dgag bya'i sgo nas phye na rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi ste khong nas gsal bar byed kyis bstan no //
analyzed: skye med de la dbye ba dgag bya'i sgo nas phye na rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi ste khong nas gsal bar byed kyis bstan no //
translated: That unborn reality, when divided from the perspective of the negatee, is the four doors of liberation, which are taught to be clarified from within.

original: de ltar rtogs na dug lnga ye shes lngar gyur pa ni @123a * //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs na dug lnga ye shes lngar gyur pa ni @123a * //
translated: When realized in that way, the five poisons become the five wisdoms,

original: mchod pa nas sel bar byed kyis bstan te /
analyzed: mchod pa nas sel bar byed kyis bstan te /
translated: which is taught by the remover.

original: 'di la gdul bya'i dbang du lo rgyus re re dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di la gdul bya'i dbang du lo rgyus re re dag 'byung ste /
translated: Here, for each disciple, a history arises.

original: ri rab kyi steng na lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba /🔽rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs dang grong khyer blta na sdug dang chung ma dang 'khor la sogs pa la chags pa de rje btsun gyis de gzigs nas 'jam dpal 'od dpag tu med pa'i lha tshogs kyi snang ba bstan nas /
analyzed: ri rab kyi steng na lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba / rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs dang grong khyer blta na sdug dang chung ma dang 'khor la sogs pa la chags pa de rje btsun gyis de gzigs nas 'jam dpal 'od dpag tu med pa'i lha tshogs kyi snang ba bstan nas /
translated: On top of Mount Meru, there is the lord of the gods called Indra.🔽The Jetsun saw that he was attached to the palace of Victory, the city of Sudarśana, his wife and retinue, and so forth.

original: de'i 'dod chags log ste so sor rtog pa'i ye shes skyes te mchod pa nas dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags log ste so sor rtog pa'i ye shes skyes te mchod pa nas dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: After the Jetsun revealed the appearance of the assembly of deities of Mañjuśrī Amitābha, Indra’s desire was reversed, and the wisdom of discrimination arose.

original: la la dag dbang phyug dang au ma gnyis la yang zer ro //
analyzed: la la dag dbang phyug dang au ma gnyis la yang zer ro //
translated: Some say that this refers to Śiva and Umā.

original: zhe sdang zhes pa ni sngon drang srong cig nags khrod cig na bsgoms pa las lta ba log nas zhe sdang skye steng shi'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang zhes pa ni sngon drang srong cig nags khrod cig na bsgoms pa las lta ba log nas zhe sdang skye steng shi'o //
translated: “Aversion” refers to a time in the past when a ṛṣi was meditating in a forest. His view became distorted and aversion arose.

original: der shar phyogs kyi 'byung po dge ba'i bu gtogs 'dod can zhes bya bar skyes nas yang 'byung po'i lus 'dis ci bya mi lus 'dod pas mi'i mngal skyug bro nas /
analyzed: der shar phyogs kyi 'byung po dge ba'i bu gtogs 'dod can zhes bya bar skyes nas yang 'byung po'i lus 'dis ci bya mi lus 'dod pas mi'i mngal skyug bro nas /
translated: He was born as a bhūta called Pañcika, the son of Virūpākṣa, in the east. He thought, “What is the use of this bhūta body? I want a human body.” He desired a human womb, but he was disgusted by it.

original: bram ze'i bu su tra zhes bya ba mgo nas sprugs pas sha rus zangs kyis song ba'i sbubs su song nas mi dang 'grogs ma shes nas dur khrod du ro mang po zos pas ru trar song nas grong khyer gsum phung bar byas /
analyzed: bram ze'i bu su tra zhes bya ba mgo nas sprugs pas sha rus zangs kyis song ba'i sbubs su song nas mi dang 'grogs ma shes nas dur khrod du ro mang po zos pas ru trar song nas grong khyer gsum phung bar byas /
translated: The son of a brahman called Sūtra was shaken from his head and his flesh and bones entered a copper tube. He did not know how to associate with people. He ate many corpses in the charnel ground and became Rudra. He destroyed three cities.

original: de tshe 'phos pas lha ma h'a de bar gyur te 'jig rten na mthu che ba ri rab glad la bskor ba /
analyzed: de tshe 'phos pas lha ma h'a de bar gyur te 'jig rten na mthu che ba ri rab glad la bskor ba /
translated: When he died, he became the god Mahādeva. He had great power in the world. He circled Mount Meru on his head.

original: rgya mtsho hub kyis 'thung ba /
analyzed: rgya mtsho hub kyis 'thung ba /
translated: He drank the ocean in a gulp.

original: lha mo au ma dang gnyis rtag tu 'khyud pa ri rab kyi byang shar mtshams na thod pa dgu brtsegs kyi nang na 'khor dpag tu med pa dang bcas pa dus kun du tshe 'phrog mi nad phyugs nad mang po gtong /
analyzed: lha mo au ma dang gnyis rtag tu 'khyud pa ri rab kyi byang shar mtshams na thod pa dgu brtsegs kyi nang na 'khor dpag tu med pa dang bcas pa dus kun du tshe 'phrog mi nad phyugs nad mang po gtong /
translated: He and the goddess Umā were always embracing. In the northeast corner of Mount Meru, in a nine-story skull, he had an infinite retinue. He always took away life. He sent many human diseases and animal diseases.

original: drag po nyi shu rtsa bzhis 'dzam bu'i gling nyi shu rtsa bzhir spyan drangs nas log pa'i tshogs 'khor byed pa de rje btsun gyis gzigs nas zhe sdang mi bskyod pa'i khro bo'i lha tshogs sprul te btul bas der thul te zhabs 'og mnan pa las grol ba
analyzed: drag po nyi shu rtsa bzhis 'dzam bu'i gling nyi shu rtsa bzhir spyan drangs nas log pa'i tshogs 'khor byed pa de rje btsun gyis gzigs nas zhe sdang mi bskyod pa'i khro bo'i lha tshogs sprul te btul bas der thul te zhabs 'og mnan pa las grol ba
translated: They were subdued and liberated from being trampled underfoot.

original: ni 'og nas kyang bstan no //
analyzed: ni 'og nas kyang bstan no //
translated: This is also taught below.

original: la la khyab 'jug 'dul ba'i phyir bstan te /
analyzed: la la khyab 'jug 'dul ba'i phyir bstan te /
translated: Some are taught for the sake of subduing Viṣṇu.

original: 'og nas ha la ha la'i skabs nas ston no //
analyzed: 'og nas ha la ha la'i skabs nas ston no //
translated: This is taught below in the section on Halāhala.🔽The third is delusion, the mind, and so on. In the past, there was a god called Brahmā who was said to have great power and to have controlled everyone.

original: gsum pa gti mug blo ste la sogs pa ni sngon lha tshangs pa zhes bya ba dbang che zhes kun la dbang sgyur zhing yang las rgyu 'bras mi shes nas gti mug ste /
analyzed: gsum pa gti mug blo ste la sogs pa ni sngon lha tshangs pa zhes bya ba dbang che zhes kun la dbang sgyur zhing yang las rgyu 'bras mi shes nas gti mug ste /
translated: Since he did not know the cause and effect of karma, he was deluded.

original: de gdul ba'i phyir gti mug rnam par snang mdzad kyi lha @123b tshogs bstan te /
analyzed: de gdul ba'i phyir gti mug rnam par snang mdzad kyi lha @123b tshogs bstan te /
translated: In order to subdue him, the assembly of the delusion-vajra deities of Vairocana were taught.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes skyes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes skyes so //
translated: The pristine consciousness of the pure dharmadhātu arose.

original: bzhi pa / mchod pa chen po khro ba che //
analyzed: bzhi pa / mchod pa chen po khro ba che //
translated: The fourth is the great offering, the great wrath.

original: zhes pa ni lha tshogs bdag ces pa ma h'a de ba la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha tshogs bdag ces pa ma h'a de ba la /
translated: The passage beginning “The god Maheśvara” describes the following.

original: chung ma gsum yod pa'i 'bring mo klu mo yid 'ong dga' ma la bu bzang sdug la 'od chags pa kun gyis blta yang mi bra ba gcig yod pa de seng ge'i khri la lag na rin po che thogs nas yod pa la /
analyzed: chung ma gsum yod pa'i 'bring mo klu mo yid 'ong dga' ma la bu bzang sdug la 'od chags pa kun gyis blta yang mi bra ba gcig yod pa de seng ge'i khri la lag na rin po che thogs nas yod pa la /
translated: Maheśvara had three wives. The middle one was a nāga woman named Rambhā. They had a son who was good looking, beautiful, and radiant. Everyone wanted to see him, but no one dared. He sat on a lion throne holding a jewel in his hand.

original: de au mas zas zhim po khyer nas bltar 'ongs pas sgo bcad /
analyzed: de au mas zas zhim po khyer nas bltar 'ongs pas sgo bcad /
translated: His mother came to see him, bringing delicious food. She found the door locked.

original: tshogs bdag na re nga'i byad legs mo 'di mos mthong na da la mo chags pa skye /
analyzed: tshogs bdag na re nga'i byad legs mo 'di mos mthong na da la mo chags pa skye /
translated: Maheśvara thought, “If she sees my beautiful son, she will become attached to him.

original: mo dmod ba che bas snyam nas glang po che cig gi sna bcad nas tshogs bdag gi sna la glan pas der au mas mthong nas nga dga' nas zas khyer nas blta ba la mi sdug pa byed pa khyod la dus rtag tu glang snar shog cig /
analyzed: mo dmod ba che bas snyam nas glang po che cig gi sna bcad nas tshogs bdag gi sna la glan pas der au mas mthong nas nga dga' nas zas khyer nas blta ba la mi sdug pa byed pa khyod la dus rtag tu glang snar shog cig /
translated: She is a powerful sorceress.” He cut off the trunk of an elephant and attached it to his nose. His mother saw him and said, “You are ugly. You lock the door when I come to see you bringing delicious food because you are happy. You will always have an elephant’s trunk.

original: lag gi rin po che la phug tu song cig / seng ge'i khri byi lar song cig zer nas /
analyzed: lag gi rin po che la phug tu song cig / seng ge'i khri byi lar song cig zer nas /
translated: Your jewel will go into your anus. Your lion throne will become a cat.”

original: de ltar song nas shin tu ngo cha nas /
analyzed: de ltar song nas shin tu ngo cha nas /
translated: Having gone there, he was very much ashamed.

original: su byung ba la rdeg / khro bo de gdul ba'i phyir khro bo don yod grub pa'i lha tshogs bstan /
analyzed: su byung ba la rdeg / khro bo de gdul ba'i phyir khro bo don yod grub pa'i lha tshogs bstan /
translated: In order to subdue that wrathful one, he displayed the assembly of deities of Amoghasiddhi, the wrathful one.

original: der bya ba grub pa'i ye shes skyes so //
analyzed: der bya ba grub pa'i ye shes skyes so //
translated: There, the gnosis of successful action arose.

original: la la dag gza' brgyad dang klu gdug pa can gdul ba'i phyir zer ro //
analyzed: la la dag gza' brgyad dang klu gdug pa can gdul ba'i phyir zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is in order to subdue the eight planets and the malevolent nagas.

original: lnga ni mchod pa chen po nas sel bar byed ces pa ni lha nor lha gdul ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lnga ni mchod pa chen po nas sel bar byed ces pa ni lha nor lha gdul ba'i phyir te /
translated: The five beginning with “great offering” up to “dispelling” are for the sake of subduing the gods of wealth.🔽In the past, when the gods and demigods fought, the gods were not victorious.

original: sngon lha dang lha ma yin 'thab pas lhas ma thub nas brgya byin gyis rmi lam brtags pas ri rab kyi zom na dang srong mthu bo che cig yod pa la /
analyzed: sngon lha dang lha ma yin 'thab pas lhas ma thub nas brgya byin gyis rmi lam brtags pas ri rab kyi zom na dang srong mthu bo che cig yod pa la /
translated: Shakra examined his dreams and saw that on the summit of Mount Meru there was a powerful sage with three children, a son and two daughters.

original: de lha mo cig gis bslus nas de la bu tsha ming sring gsum yod //
analyzed: de lha mo cig gis bslus nas de la bu tsha ming sring gsum yod //
translated: One of the daughters deceived him, and he had three children, a son and two daughters.

original: de las gnyis kyis lha ma yin thub ste 'ong par rmis /
analyzed: de las gnyis kyis lha ma yin thub ste 'ong par rmis /
translated: Two of them were able to subdue the demigods and came.

original: der kun gyis gros byas nas lha'i mdangs las sprul pa'i au ma zhes bya ba mdzes pa cig drung du btang bas drang srong na re khyed gang nas 'ongs gar 'gro zer /
analyzed: der kun gyis gros byas nas lha'i mdangs las sprul pa'i au ma zhes bya ba mdzes pa cig drung du btang bas drang srong na re khyed gang nas 'ongs gar 'gro zer /
translated: They all discussed the matter and sent a beautiful woman named Uma, who was an emanation of the radiance of the gods, to his presence. The sage asked, “Where have you come from? Where are you going?”

original: nga khyed kyi byan mo la 'ongs byas pas lo gsum chags pa spyad pas ma phrel  nas /
analyzed: nga khyed kyi byan mo la 'ongs byas pas lo gsum chags pa spyad pas ma phrel  nas /
translated: “I have come to be your wife,” she said. They enjoyed each other for three years, but he did not ejaculate.

original: shar lho'i me lhas me'i 'khor lo cig bar du sbar bas phrel  lo //
analyzed: shar lho'i me lhas me'i 'khor lo cig bar du sbar bas phrel  lo //
translated: The fire god in the southeast set a ring of fire between them, and they were separated.

original: ming sring gsum gyi chen po mgon po nag pos g-yas su drangs /
analyzed: ming sring gsum gyi chen po mgon po nag pos g-yas su drangs /
translated: The eldest of the three siblings, Mahakala, led the way to the right.

original: dpal lha mos g-yon du drangs nas lha ma yin phung bar byas /
analyzed: dpal lha mos g-yon du drangs nas lha ma yin phung bar byas /
translated: Shri Devi led the way to the left, and they destroyed the asuras.

original: tha chungs nor lha a'arya dzambha la yin te /
analyzed: tha chungs nor lha a'arya dzambha la yin te /
translated: The youngest was the wealth god, Agya Jambhala.

original: kho la nor bu rin po che ne'u le'i rkyal bu gang yod pas /🔽ma rig pa @124a * //
analyzed: kho la nor bu rin po che ne'u le'i rkyal bu gang yod pas / ma rig pa @124a * //
translated: He had a bag of jewels.

original: nga rgyal gyi ser snang chags so //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi ser snang chags so //
translated: He was stingy with his ignorance.

original: de 'dul ba'i phyir rin chen 'byung ldan lha tshogs kun sprul pas /
analyzed: de 'dul ba'i phyir rin chen 'byung ldan lha tshogs kun sprul pas /
translated: In order to subdue him, all the deities of Ratnasambhava emanated.

original: ser sna log ste mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes skyes so //
analyzed: ser sna log ste mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes skyes so //
translated: The wisdom of equality arises from the reversal of miserliness.

original: 'o na byang sems rdo rje la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na byang sems rdo rje la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of the vajra of bodhicitta?

original: de yang nyon mongs pa lnga 'dul ba lha gzhon nu gdong drug gi skabs su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa lnga 'dul ba lha gzhon nu gdong drug gi skabs su 'byung ngo //
translated: That also occurs in the context of the six-faced celestial youth who tames the five afflictions.

original: de ltar ye shes lnga po nyams ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes lnga po nyams ci zhe na /
translated: What are the experiences of those five wisdoms?

original: 'dod pa nas mgu ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa nas mgu ba'i bar du'o //
translated: They are from desire to satisfaction.

original: de yang sngon 'phags pa 'jam dpal bram ze dri med du bzhugs pa sangs rgyas rnga sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po la gdams ngag zhu ba'i dus su /
analyzed: de yang sngon 'phags pa 'jam dpal bram ze dri med du bzhugs pa sangs rgyas rnga sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po la gdams ngag zhu ba'i dus su /
translated: In the past, when Ārya Mañjuśrī was living as the brahman Vimalamitra, he requested instructions from Buddha Dundubhisvararāja.

original: yon med nas nor tshol du 'ongs pas k'arsh'a pa na gser zho gnyis tsam rnyed pas lam ma chod nas brag phug stong pa cig tu nyal bas /
analyzed: yon med nas nor tshol du 'ongs pas k'arsh'a pa na gser zho gnyis tsam rnyed pas lam ma chod nas brag phug stong pa cig tu nyal bas /
translated: Since he had no wealth, he came to search for money. He found two kārṣā coins and did not have enough for the road. He slept in an empty cave.

original: rkun mo gsum byung nas khyod mi bsad kyis nor blang zer nas nga la med byas pas ma nyan rnyed pa'i gser byin pas /
analyzed: rkun mo gsum byung nas khyod mi bsad kyis nor blang zer nas nga la med byas pas ma nyan rnyed pa'i gser byin pas /
translated: Three thieves came and said, “We will kill you and take your wealth.” Since he said he had nothing, they did not listen. He gave them the gold he had found.

original: da rung blang zer mi ster na mig 'byin zer /
analyzed: da rung blang zer mi ster na mig 'byin zer /
translated: They said, “Give us more!” When he did not give it, they said, “We will gouge out your eyes.”

original: da da la med byas pas mig phyung ngo //
analyzed: da da la med byas pas mig phyung ngo //
translated: Because he said, I have no present, his eyes were gouged out.

original: der byang chub sems dang ma bral lo //
analyzed: der byang chub sems dang ma bral lo //
translated: At that time, he was not separated from the thought of awakening.

original: dus der yul gyi lha ma yin rnams na re bya ba mi rigs pa de ltar byed pa zer nas bsad snyam nas brdung du phyin pas de shin tu ma dad sa dang kha dog dang ldan par 'dug nas lus bong che zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dus der yul gyi lha ma yin rnams na re bya ba mi rigs pa de ltar byed pa zer nas bsad snyam nas brdung du phyin pas de shin tu ma dad sa dang kha dog dang ldan par 'dug nas lus bong che zhes pa'o //
translated: At that time, the asuras of the realm said, This is an improper action. We will kill him. Thinking this, they went to beat him. He was very faithful and had a good complexion and a large body.

original: de'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: ming nas gsal ba che ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: ming nas gsal ba che ba'i bar ro //
translated: From his name was renowned up to great.

original: de yang 'phags ba 'jam dpal gyi zhing khams dang sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan ston te ming yang che zhing rgya che ba ni /
analyzed: de yang 'phags ba 'jam dpal gyi zhing khams dang sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan ston te ming yang che zhing rgya che ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it shows the realm and the name of the Buddha of the noble Manjushri. The name is also great and vast.

original: mtshan sangs rgyas kun du gzigs zhes bya ba chos nyid kun la gzigs pa dang gdul bya kun la gzigs so //
analyzed: mtshan sangs rgyas kun du gzigs zhes bya ba chos nyid kun la gzigs pa dang gdul bya kun la gzigs so //
translated: The name is Buddha Samantakushata, meaning all-seeing. He sees all dharmas and all disciples.

original: de yang yangs pa ni zhing khams te /
analyzed: de yang yangs pa ni zhing khams te /
translated: Moreover, vast refers to the realm.

original: smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa zhing dag pa la rdul med par bsags pa zhes bya ba rin po che'i rgyu las grub ste /
analyzed: smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa zhing dag pa la rdul med par bsags pa zhes bya ba rin po che'i rgyu las grub ste /
translated: The field of the perfection of aspirations is called “Accumulation of the Stainless” and is made of precious substances.

original: byang chub kyi shing gi 'od kyi me tog kha bye zum pa las nyin mtshan gyi ming med pa zhing de'i steng gi bar snang las rol mo'i sgra byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang 'jam dpal mtshan brjod pa'i sgra rgyun mi 'chad pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing gi 'od kyi me tog kha bye zum pa las nyin mtshan gyi ming med pa zhing de'i steng gi bar snang las rol mo'i sgra byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang 'jam dpal mtshan brjod pa'i sgra rgyun mi 'chad pa /
translated: The light of the tree of enlightenment opens and closes like a flower, so there is no concept of day and night. From the sky above that field, the sound of music and the canon of the bodhisattvas and the sound of the recitation of the Maṇi mantra are heard without interruption.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang bud med kyi ming mi grag / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sha stag bzhugs pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang bud med kyi ming mi grag / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sha stag bzhugs pa /
translated: There is no mention of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, or women, and it is filled only with buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sdug bsngal gyi ming mi grag pa che la yangs te ni snang ba @124b mtha' yas kyi zhing khams ni til gyi dong gang nas gcig phyung ba tsam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ming mi grag pa che la yangs te ni snang ba @124b mtha' yas kyi zhing khams ni til gyi dong gang nas gcig phyung ba tsam mo //
translated: The name “suffering” is not even known there. It is vast and expansive, but the buddhafield of Amitābha is like the space of a mustard seed.

original: zhing khams de ni til gyi dong tsam mo //
analyzed: zhing khams de ni til gyi dong tsam mo //
translated: That buddhafield is like the space of a mustard seed.

original: phyi ma rnams ni gzhung dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyi ma rnams ni gzhung dang sbyar ro //
translated: The following [fields] are to be applied to the text.

original: de ltar rtog pa spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conduct of conceptual thoughts?

original: mkhas pa chen po la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: mkhas pa chen po la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the great scholars and others.

original: 'di la sngon rdze btsun 'jam dpal rgyal po'i pho brang rin chen na rgyal po'i mchod gnas byed cing bzhugs pa la 'khor rnams kyis phra ma bcug ste /
analyzed: 'di la sngon rdze btsun 'jam dpal rgyal po'i pho brang rin chen na rgyal po'i mchod gnas byed cing bzhugs pa la 'khor rnams kyis phra ma bcug ste /
translated: In the past, when the venerable Manjushri was staying in the palace of a king, serving as the king's object of veneration, the king's retinue sowed discord,

original: 'jam dpal jo bo la dpya yin 'dug byas pas rgyal po bsam ngan skyes nas gros byas pa mchod gnas kyis mkhyen nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal jo bo la dpya yin 'dug byas pas rgyal po bsam ngan skyes nas gros byas pa mchod gnas kyis mkhyen nas /
translated: saying, Manjushri is the king's rival. The king gave rise to evil thoughts and consulted with his ministers. The object of veneration knew this and said,

original: r'a dza la gcugs la ma nyan ma bsad nga la de lta bu'i skyon med na byas pas rgyal po ma nyan nas /
analyzed: r'a dza la gcugs la ma nyan ma bsad nga la de lta bu'i skyon med na byas pas rgyal po ma nyan nas /
translated: If I am not guilty of such things as having an affair with the queen, not listening to the king, or killing him, then let it be. The king did not listen.

original: der rgyal pos phag tu mi mang po gsod du btang bas der 'jam dpal gyis rang 'dra bas yul thams cad gang bar byas pas gsod ngo ma shes nas /
analyzed: der rgyal pos phag tu mi mang po gsod du btang bas der 'jam dpal gyis rang 'dra bas yul thams cad gang bar byas pas gsod ngo ma shes nas /
translated: The king sent many people to kill Manjushri in secret. Manjushri filled the entire country with his own replicas, so they did not know which one to kill.

original: der 'gyod pa skyes nas zhu ba phul pas ma gnang nas /
analyzed: der 'gyod pa skyes nas zhu ba phul pas ma gnang nas /
translated: They felt remorse and made a request, but he did not grant it.

original: der yul gzhan zhig tu phyin nas kun nang pa sangs rgyas pa'i bstan pa la btsud de dkyus dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: der yul gzhan zhig tu phyin nas kun nang pa sangs rgyas pa'i bstan pa la btsud de dkyus dang sbyar ro //
translated: Having gone to another country, he introduced everyone to the doctrine of the Buddha and brought them to the level of the ordinary person.

original: de rnams nyid grol lam zhe na mi grol te /
analyzed: de rnams nyid grol lam zhe na mi grol te /
translated: If it is asked whether they were liberated, they were not liberated.

original: rkyen pha rol phyin pa bcu dgos par ston to //
analyzed: rkyen pha rol phyin pa bcu dgos par ston to //
translated: It is explained that the condition is the need for the ten perfections.

original: 'di rnams la gong bzhin du lo rgyus re re ston to //
analyzed: 'di rnams la gong bzhin du lo rgyus re re ston to //
translated: Each of these is explained with a story, as above.

original: sbyin bdag chen po sngon khyim bdag dang pa'i bus sangs rgyas pa'i lha la gdams ngag zhus sbyin pa rdzogs par bya bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: sbyin bdag chen po sngon khyim bdag dang pa'i bus sangs rgyas pa'i lha la gdams ngag zhus sbyin pa rdzogs par bya bar 'dod nas /
translated: The great benefactor was previously the son of a householder. He requested instructions from the deity of the Buddha and, wishing to perfect generosity,

original: rdzas med nas rgya mtsho nas nor bu rin po che blangs nas der sbyin pa btang sa thun mongs du sbyin pa sum cu rtsa gnyis rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: rdzas med nas rgya mtsho nas nor bu rin po che blangs nas der sbyin pa btang sa thun mongs du sbyin pa sum cu rtsa gnyis rdzogs par byas /
translated: he took a precious jewel from the ocean because he had no possessions and gave it as a gift. He perfected the thirty-two common gifts.

original: ma dag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis spangs /
analyzed: ma dag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis spangs /
translated: He abandoned the thirty-two impure [gifts].

original: mi zad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: mi zad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun rdzogs par byas so //
translated: He perfected the twenty-seven inexhaustible [gifts].

original: de nas rgyal po rin chen du gyur nas yul du chos ston pa med nas der btsal bas sangs rgyas ri rab 'od bzhugs pa thos nas de la tshul khrims kyi gdams ngag zhus te /🔽spyir tshul khrims drug cu rtsa lnga rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po rin chen du gyur nas yul du chos ston pa med nas der btsal bas sangs rgyas ri rab 'od bzhugs pa thos nas de la tshul khrims kyi gdams ngag zhus te / spyir tshul khrims drug cu rtsa lnga rdzogs par byas /
translated: Then, having become a brahman, he became a king.🔽Then, having become a king, he became a brahman.🔽Then, having become a brahman, he became a king.

analyzed: mi zad pa'i tshul khrims nyi shu rtsa gcig rdzogs par byas so // zad pa'i tshul khrims brgyad spangs so //

original: de nas rgyal po mu khyud kyi bur skyes nas sangs rgyas rnga sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po la zhus nas spyi'i lnga dang khyad par brtson 'grus gsum rdzogs par byas te zhib tu 'og nas ston ;
analyzed: de nas rgyal po mu khyud kyi bur skyes nas sangs rgyas rnga sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po la zhus nas spyi'i lnga dang khyad par brtson 'grus gsum rdzogs par byas te zhib tu 'og nas ston ;
translated: Then, after being born as the son of King Cakravartin, he requested the teachings from Buddha Dundubhisvararāja and completed the five perfections in general and the three specific perfections of diligence.

original: de nas rgyal bu don yod du gyur pa'i dus su sangs rgyas stobs kyi rgyal po la bsam gtan rdzogs par zhus te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu don yod du gyur pa'i dus su sangs rgyas stobs kyi rgyal po la bsam gtan rdzogs par zhus te /
translated: Then, when he became Prince Amogha, he requested the perfection of concentration from Buddha Balarāja

original: khyad par gyi bsam gtan mnyam pa nyid bzhi rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bsam gtan mnyam pa nyid bzhi rdzogs par byas so //
translated: and completed the four specific concentrations of equanimity.

original: de nas rgyal po grags par gyur pa'i dus su sangs rgyas don yod rgyal po la spyi'i shes rab brgyad cu rtsa bzhi /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po grags par gyur pa'i dus su sangs rgyas don yod rgyal po la spyi'i shes rab brgyad cu rtsa bzhi /
translated: Then, when he became King Yaśas, he requested the eighty-four general perfections of wisdom

original: tshul sbyin shes rab sum cu rtsa gnyis rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: tshul sbyin shes rab sum cu rtsa gnyis rdzogs par byas so //
translated: and the thirty-two specific perfections of wisdom of giving discipline from Buddha Amogharāja.

original: stobs bcu yang rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: stobs bcu yang rdzogs par byas so //
translated: He also completed the ten powers.

original: de nas rgyal po nam mkhar gyur pa'i dus su sangs rgyas 'brug sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po la smon lam bcu gnyis dang / thabs brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas so ;
analyzed: de nas rgyal po nam mkhar gyur pa'i dus su sangs rgyas 'brug sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po la smon lam bcu gnyis dang / thabs brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas so ;
translated: Then, when the king became Namkha, he made twelve aspirations and completed the eight methods to the Buddha Drugsang Yangyib.

original: / de nas drang srong rgyas par gyur pa'i dus su sangs rgyas dri ma med par grags pa la ye shes rdzogs par byas te ye shes skye ba'i rkyen bdun //
analyzed: / de nas drang srong rgyas par gyur pa'i dus su sangs rgyas dri ma med par grags pa la ye shes rdzogs par byas te ye shes skye ba'i rkyen bdun //
translated: Then, when the sage became Gyaspar, he completed wisdom to the Buddha Drimé Drakpa and completed the seven conditions for the arising of wisdom.

original: rgyu lnga bcu rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: rgyu lnga bcu rdzogs par byas so //
translated: He completed the five causes.

original: de ltar sbyin bdag chen po nas ye shes rgya mtsho'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin bdag chen po nas ye shes rgya mtsho'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, it is applied from the Great Benefactor up to the Ocean of Wisdom.

original: grogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: grogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is a friend?

original: byams chen nas tshad thabs zhes pa tshad med pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: byams chen nas tshad thabs zhes pa tshad med pa bzhi ston te /
translated: “Great love” and so on teach the four immeasurables.

original: 'di la sngon rje btsun yul lumbi ni'i rgyal po legs byin zhes bya ba tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms pa la /
analyzed: 'di la sngon rje btsun yul lumbi ni'i rgyal po legs byin zhes bya ba tshad med pa bzhi bsgoms pa la /
translated: In this regard, previously, the venerable one was King Lekjin of the country of Lumbini, who meditated on the four immeasurables.

original: yul der mkha' 'gro ma bdun gyis mi thams cad za bar byed pa la /
analyzed: yul der mkha' 'gro ma bdun gyis mi thams cad za bar byed pa la /
translated: In that country, seven dakinis ate all the people.

original: rje btsun gyis byams snying rje bsgoms pas ma mos sems can za ba'i sems dang bral nas /
analyzed: rje btsun gyis byams snying rje bsgoms pas ma mos sems can za ba'i sems dang bral nas /
translated: The Jetsun meditated on love and compassion, and the demoness's mind was freed from the thought of eating sentient beings.🔽Then she said, I will meditate on love and compassion and will not eat you.🔽 Then the Jetsun bound her to samaya, gave her a torma, and made her a protector of the teachings.

original: ded cag kyang byams dang snying rje bsgom ste bzar med zer ba la der dam la btags te gtor ma byin nas bstan pa bsrung bar byas pas ma mo bdun dang zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: ded cag kyang byams dang snying rje bsgom ste bzar med zer ba la der dam la btags te gtor ma byin nas bstan pa bsrung bar byas pas ma mo bdun dang zhes pa yin no //
translated: This is the story of the Seven Demonesses.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of meditating in that way?

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po nas 'jigs par byed pa'i bar gyis rje btsun gyis gdul bya zhe sdang can 'dul ba'i phyir drag po'i skur bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po nas 'jigs par byed pa'i bar gyis rje btsun gyis gdul bya zhe sdang can 'dul ba'i phyir drag po'i skur bstan pa'o //
translated: From great magical power up to terrifying, the Jetsun displayed a wrathful form in order to tame those to be tamed who had the affliction of anger.

original: de yang sngon lho phyogs gyad yul na mu stegs ral pa can lnga brgya yod de /
analyzed: de yang sngon lho phyogs gyad yul na mu stegs ral pa can lnga brgya yod de /
translated: In the past, in the land of the southern barbarians, there were five hundred non-Buddhist ascetics with matted hair.

original: de rnams kyis thams cad log lta las bsgyur nas chad lta la bkod do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis thams cad log lta las bsgyur nas chad lta la bkod do //
translated: They converted everyone to wrong views and established them in nihilism.

original: nang pa sangs rgyas @125b pa'i bstan pa yang nyams dmas pa'i dus su yul de na sangs rgyas pa'i chos la mos pa cig yod pas des rmi lam btab ste /
analyzed: nang pa sangs rgyas @125b pa'i bstan pa yang nyams dmas pa'i dus su yul de na sangs rgyas pa'i chos la mos pa cig yod pas des rmi lam btab ste /
translated: At that time, the Buddhist teachings were in decline. In that land, there was a person who had faith in the Buddhist teachings. He had a dream.🔽“If the Buddhist teachings are true, then I will see them in my dream.”

original: sangs rgyas pa'i chos bden na rmi lam du mthong bar shog cig / de ltar byung na yon bdag byas la yang dag pa'i lta ba lad gong snyam pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i chos bden na rmi lam du mthong bar shog cig / de ltar byung na yon bdag byas la yang dag pa'i lta ba lad gong snyam pa la /
translated: “If that happens, I will be your patron and will raise up the correct view.”

original: rmi lam du ston pa sku gser btso ma'i kha dog 'dra ba lta bas chog mi shes pa'i sku gcig byung nas /
analyzed: rmi lam du ston pa sku gser btso ma'i kha dog 'dra ba lta bas chog mi shes pa'i sku gcig byung nas /
translated: In his dream, a teacher appeared, whose body was the color of refined gold and whose body was so beautiful that one could never look at it enough.

original: khyod kyis yon bdag gis shig zla ba gnyis nas nga yong gi gsungs nas /
analyzed: khyod kyis yon bdag gis shig zla ba gnyis nas nga yong gi gsungs nas /
translated: “You should be my patron. In two months I will come.”

original: der gnyid sad nas shin tu dga' nas btsun mo la bzlas pas /
analyzed: der gnyid sad nas shin tu dga' nas btsun mo la bzlas pas /
translated: When he awoke, he was very happy and told his queen.🔽The leader of the non-Buddhists, Matrceta, said, “This is not anyone else. It is the Buddhist Manjusri, the Lion of Speech, who is in the city of Sravasti.”

original: mu stegs kyi dpon mo ma trang ga na re 'di su yang min sangs rgyas pa'i 'jam dpal smra ba'i seng ge bya ba cig grong khyer yangs pa can na yod zer gyis de kha yin pas /
analyzed: mu stegs kyi dpon mo ma trang ga na re 'di su yang min sangs rgyas pa'i 'jam dpal smra ba'i seng ge bya ba cig grong khyer yangs pa can na yod zer gyis de kha yin pas /
translated: “That must be him.”

original: 'dir 'ong na lam gyi mdo bcad /
analyzed: 'dir 'ong na lam gyi mdo bcad /
translated: If he comes here, we will block the road.

original: nags tshal la dga' bas nags tshal breg  / dgon pa shig / gtsug lag khang shig /'phrang du gyad rnams kyis bsrung /
analyzed: nags tshal la dga' bas nags tshal breg  / dgon pa shig / gtsug lag khang shig /'phrang du gyad rnams kyis bsrung /
translated: We will cut down the forest because he likes forests, destroy the monasteries, and guard the passes with wrestlers.🔽If he has magic powers, we will practice the Great Lord of the Gods and cause lightning and hail to fall.

original: kho la rdzu 'phrul yod na lha dbang phyug chen po bsgrubs la byung ba dang thog dang ser ba dbab par gros byas so //
analyzed: kho la rdzu 'phrul yod na lha dbang phyug chen po bsgrubs la byung ba dang thog dang ser ba dbab par gros byas so //
translated: They discussed this.

original: der byon pas rdzu 'phrul gyis 'phrang bcad pa ni steng du mnyam por song /
analyzed: der byon pas rdzu 'phrul gyis 'phrang bcad pa ni steng du mnyam por song /
translated: When he arrived, the road was blocked by magic, but they went up together.

original: lung pa rtsi shid nags tshal gyis gang ngo //
analyzed: lung pa rtsi shid nags tshal gyis gang ngo //
translated: The valley was filled with plants and forests.

original: der nam mkha' la dge slong dge 'dun dpag tu med pa byon nas ral pa can sogs byams pa'i sems bskyed nas bdag med kyi lta ba la btsud do //
analyzed: der nam mkha' la dge slong dge 'dun dpag tu med pa byon nas ral pa can sogs byams pa'i sems bskyed nas bdag med kyi lta ba la btsud do //
translated: There, an infinite number of monks appeared in the sky. They caused the matted-hair ascetics and others to generate loving kindness and enter into the view of selflessness.

original: khros pa'i khro bo'i skus bdud la sogs thog ser 'bebs pa shes pa bsgyur nas brgyal lo //
analyzed: khros pa'i khro bo'i skus bdud la sogs thog ser 'bebs pa shes pa bsgyur nas brgyal lo //
translated: The angry wrathful form of the Buddha, knowing that he would cause lightning and hail to fall on the demons and so forth, transformed his mind and fainted.

original: der bdag cag kyang rjes su bzung 'chal /
analyzed: der bdag cag kyang rjes su bzung 'chal /
translated: We too should be accepted.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa 'di bdag med kyi lta ba rtogs pa las byung bas kun de la btsud pas mgon po nas bla ma'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa 'di bdag med kyi lta ba rtogs pa las byung bas kun de la btsud pas mgon po nas bla ma'o //
translated: Since these miracles, magical displays, and manifestations arise from the realization of the view of selflessness, all of them are included in that.

original: de ltar drag po'i skur ston kyang thugs theg pa chen po'i snying rje dang shes rab las ma g-yos so //
analyzed: de ltar drag po'i skur ston kyang thugs theg pa chen po'i snying rje dang shes rab las ma g-yos so //
translated: Thus, although he displays the form of Rudra, his mind does not move from the compassion and wisdom of the Mahayana.

original: aa ra pa tsa na'i don rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi che ba'i yon tan bstan pa'o /
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na'i don rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi che ba'i yon tan bstan pa'o /
translated: The meaning of “arapacana” is the demonstration of the great qualities of the vajradhātu maṇḍala.

original: // / da ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes de nyid gti mug can gdul ba'i phyir shes rab ye shes spyi gtsug can gyi skur bstan pa'i byin rlabs ni sangs rgyas nas zhags pa che'i ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes de nyid gti mug can gdul ba'i phyir shes rab ye shes spyi gtsug can gyi skur bstan pa'i byin rlabs ni sangs rgyas nas zhags pa che'i ston te /
translated: Now, in order to tame the ignorant, the blessing of the wisdom of the dharmadhātu is the teaching of the great noose of the wisdom of the crown of the head.

original: de la rje btsun de'i yon tan gang zhe na /🔽rnam par snang mdzad ni sa bcu'i @126a * //
analyzed: de la rje btsun de'i yon tan gang zhe na / rnam par snang mdzad ni sa bcu'i @126a * //
translated: What are the qualities of that venerable one?🔽Vairocana is the appearance of the bodhisattvas of the tenth stage.

original: byang sems la snang pa theg pa chen po'i chos kho na ston pa /
analyzed: byang sems la snang pa theg pa chen po'i chos kho na ston pa /
translated: He teaches only the Mahāyāna dharma.

original: thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes che ba /
analyzed: thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes che ba /
translated: His mind is the great, utterly pure wisdom.

original: spang bya mtha' dag spangs nas lus ngag gi spyod pa thub pa'o //
analyzed: spang bya mtha' dag spangs nas lus ngag gi spyod pa thub pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned all that is to be abandoned, one is capable of physical and verbal conduct.

original: de'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: gsang sngags dang tshul chen te /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang tshul chen te /
translated: It is the great secret mantra,

original: thabs shes rab gnyis med las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thabs shes rab gnyis med las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from the nondual union of method and wisdom.

original: gzhan yang pha rol phyin pa bcu las byung ba gong bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang pha rol phyin pa bcu las byung ba gong bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it arises from the ten perfections, as above.

original: de bzhin du sa bcu dang stobs bcur ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bcu dang stobs bcur ldan pa'o //
translated: Likewise, it is endowed with the ten bhūmis and the ten powers.

original: shes bcu'i rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral bas spros med bdag go //
analyzed: shes bcu'i rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral bas spros med bdag go //
translated: Since it is free from the conceptual elaborations of the ten cognitions, it is the unelaborate self.

original: de ltar brjod pa dang bral na ji ltar gzung na bden pa nas gnas zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa dang bral na ji ltar gzung na bden pa nas gnas zhes bstan te /
translated: If it is free from such expressions, how is it apprehended? It is taught as “the abode of truth.”

original: 'di la sngon ma ga dh'a'i dgon pa snying po byang chub kyi gnas su 'jam dpal theg pa chen po'i chos zhu ba'i 'khor gyi gtso bo sangs rgyas nor dpal dang / rin chen dpal dang / yon tan dpal dang / mig gi dpal dang /
analyzed: 'di la sngon ma ga dh'a'i dgon pa snying po byang chub kyi gnas su 'jam dpal theg pa chen po'i chos zhu ba'i 'khor gyi gtso bo sangs rgyas nor dpal dang / rin chen dpal dang / yon tan dpal dang / mig gi dpal dang /
translated: In this regard, in the past, at the site of the essence of enlightenment in the Magadha forest, Mañjuśrī was the principal retinue requesting the Mahāyāna Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus dpal dang / ye shes dpal dang / bzang po'i dpal gyis de kho na nyid kyi don zhus pas mnyam pa nyid kyi don dam par gnyis su med pa de ltar bstan te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dpal dang / ye shes dpal dang / bzang po'i dpal gyis de kho na nyid kyi don zhus pas mnyam pa nyid kyi don dam par gnyis su med pa de ltar bstan te /
translated: They were taught that the ultimate meaning of equality is nonduality.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa'o //
translated: They abided in the limit of reality.

original: gnyis su med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is nonduality?

original: bdag med nas ngan 'jigs byed pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med nas ngan 'jigs byed pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of self, which terrifies the non-Buddhists.

original: dper na seng ge'i sgras ri dags skrag pa bzhin du bdag med pa'i sgras mu stegs skrag par byed do //
analyzed: dper na seng ge'i sgras ri dags skrag pa bzhin du bdag med pa'i sgras mu stegs skrag par byed do //
translated: Just as the sound of a lion terrifies deer, the sound of no-self terrifies the non-Buddhists.

original: spyir mu stegs la lta ba sum brgya drug cu /
analyzed: spyir mu stegs la lta ba sum brgya drug cu /
translated: In general, there are three hundred and sixty non-Buddhist views.

original: de las bsdus pa log pa'i ri bo nyi shu /
analyzed: de las bsdus pa log pa'i ri bo nyi shu /
translated: Among them, the twenty wrong mountain peaks are summarized.

original: de mu stegs rtag chad gnyis su 'dus so //
analyzed: de mu stegs rtag chad gnyis su 'dus so //
translated: Those are included in the two non-Buddhist views of permanence and annihilation.

original: ya mtshan can dgu bcu la sogs pa yod kyang ston pa ste drug nas brtsi'o //
analyzed: ya mtshan can dgu bcu la sogs pa yod kyang ston pa ste drug nas brtsi'o //
translated: Although there are ninety non-Buddhist views and so forth, they are counted as six teachers.

original: 'di la sngon ri pi ri lan rgyal po gzugs can snying po lings pa la 'ongs pas ci yang ma rnyed nas log tsam na drang srong cig 'dug nas ngas ri dags ma sod pa 'dis lan zer nas gsod pa la /
analyzed: 'di la sngon ri pi ri lan rgyal po gzugs can snying po lings pa la 'ongs pas ci yang ma rnyed nas log tsam na drang srong cig 'dug nas ngas ri dags ma sod pa 'dis lan zer nas gsod pa la /
translated: In the past, King Bimbisāra of Rīpīra went to the land of the Lings and, finding nothing, was just about to return when he saw a sage. The king said, “This man who did not kill deer is to blame.”

original: der drang srong gis dmod pa bor ba ni /
analyzed: der drang srong gis dmod pa bor ba ni /
translated: The sage cursed him:

original: nga bur skyes la khyod kyi bdud bu shog shig byas pas /
analyzed: nga bur skyes la khyod kyi bdud bu shog shig byas pas /
translated: “May you have a demon son when I am reborn as a human and you are reborn as a demon.”

original: der btsun mo la bu skyes pas lcags kyi mdzer pa can cig byung bas phas gzhibs pas pha ma'i lce yang skrangs ming yang ma skyes dgrar btags so //
analyzed: der btsun mo la bu skyes pas lcags kyi mdzer pa can cig byung bas phas gzhibs pas pha ma'i lce yang skrangs ming yang ma skyes dgrar btags so //
translated: The queen gave birth to a son with an iron goiter. The father was ashamed of him and so they named him Ajātaśatru.

original: kho cher skyes nas /
analyzed: kho cher skyes nas /
translated: When he grew up,

original: pha spyugs / phas yul gzhan du chos thos phyir la 'ongs tsam na /🔽bu la gdams ngag bya snyams te phyin pas bu'i snying nas nga la gnod @126b pa byed snyam nas der pha dong du bcug go //
analyzed: pha spyugs / phas yul gzhan du chos thos phyir la 'ongs tsam na / bu la gdams ngag bya snyams te phyin pas bu'i snying nas nga la gnod @126b pa byed snyam nas der pha dong du bcug go //
translated: his father was exiled. After his father heard the Dharma in another country, he returned.🔽Thinking to give his son advice, he went to him. The son thought, “He is going to harm me,” and so he had his father thrown into a pit.

original: mas lo rgyus byas pas bu 'gyod pa skyes nas dong nas 'don du phyin pas /
analyzed: mas lo rgyus byas pas bu 'gyod pa skyes nas dong nas 'don du phyin pas /
translated: His mother told him what had happened. The son was remorseful and went to get his father out of the pit.

original: phas bsams pa /
analyzed: phas bsams pa /
translated: The father thought,

original: gsod pa yin bsams nas lcebs nas shi'o //
analyzed: gsod pa yin bsams nas lcebs nas shi'o //
translated: He is going to kill me! and he jumped into a river and died.

original: der ma skyes dgra'i lus la 'brum nag byung nas /
analyzed: der ma skyes dgra'i lus la 'brum nag byung nas /
translated: At that time Ajatashatru developed black spots on his body.🔽 Thinking, I will ask the six non-Buddhist teachers who are staying here and so forth for a method to help me, he sent six ministers to ask for help.

original: der mya ngan byas pa la bsams pas mu stegs kyi ston pa drug bzhugs pa la sogs pa'i thabs zhu snyam nas blon po drug pos nas zla ba'i grags pa /
analyzed: der mya ngan byas pa la bsams pas mu stegs kyi ston pa drug bzhugs pa la sogs pa'i thabs zhu snyam nas blon po drug pos nas zla ba'i grags pa /
translated: They were Chandrakirti,

original: snying po stobs /🔽bde ba / don thob /
analyzed: snying po stobs / bde ba / don thob /
translated: Essence Power,🔽Happiness,🔽Attained Purpose,🔽Auspicious, and

original: bkra shis / 'jigs med /🔽drug po la zhus pas /
