analyzed: bkra shis / 'jigs med / drug po la zhus pas /
translated: Fearless.

original: rgyal po pha bsad pa la ni sdig pa mi 'ong /
analyzed: rgyal po pha bsad pa la ni sdig pa mi 'ong /
translated: They said, There is no sin in killing one's father.

original: pha bsad dang mi shi ba mir skye bas sngon gyi dus na pha ma bsad pa yongs su sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: pha bsad dang mi shi ba mir skye bas sngon gyi dus na pha ma bsad pa yongs su sangs rgyas pas /
translated: Because one who has killed his father and a dead person are reborn as humans, in the past there were those who killed their parents and then became fully enlightened buddhas.🔽 Well then, since the six teachers are still alive, ask them.🔽 They were Purana Kashyapa,🔽Ajita Keshakambala,🔽Kakuda Katyayana,

original: de 'o na ston pa drug da lta bzhugs pas dris dang / de yang 'od srungs rdzogs byed dang / phyugs lhas kyi bu ka ri dang / be ra'i bu kun du rgyal dang / ka ta'i bu nog can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang /
analyzed: de 'o na ston pa drug da lta bzhugs pas dris dang / de yang 'od srungs rdzogs byed dang / phyugs lhas kyi bu ka ri dang / be ra'i bu kun du rgyal dang / ka ta'i bu nog can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang /
translated: Nirgrantha Jnatiputra,🔽and Parsva.

original: gcer bu gnyen gyi bu dang drug la zhus pas /
analyzed: gcer bu gnyen gyi bu dang drug la zhus pas /
translated: He asked six people, including the naked ascetic, the son of a friend.🔽“O King, do not always be sad.

original: rgyal po rtag tu mya ngan ma byed cig / rtag tu mya ngan su byed pa /
analyzed: rgyal po rtag tu mya ngan ma byed cig / rtag tu mya ngan su byed pa /
translated: Those who always are sad

original: phyis kyang mya ngan byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyis kyang mya ngan byed par 'gyur //
translated: will later also be sad.

original: gnyid dang chang la'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyid dang chang la'ang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same with sleep and alcohol.”

original: zer nas rgyal po pha bsad pas ni slar thar pa'i bde ba ster /
analyzed: zer nas rgyal po pha bsad pas ni slar thar pa'i bde ba ster /
translated: Saying this, he gave the king the pleasure of liberation from the sin of patricide.

original: pha bsad pa'i sdig pas mi gos kyi zer nas so //
analyzed: pha bsad pa'i sdig pas mi gos kyi zer nas so //
translated: “The sin of patricide does not stain you.”

original: der ma skyes dgras sman 'tsho byed gzhon nu dang phrad nas zhus pas /
analyzed: der ma skyes dgras sman 'tsho byed gzhon nu dang phrad nas zhus pas /
translated: There Ajātaśatru met the physician Kumāra Jīvakabhṛtya and asked him.

original: rgyal po mya ngan byed pa legs //🔽pha bsad pa yi sdig pa ni //
analyzed: rgyal po mya ngan byed pa legs // pha bsad pa yi sdig pa ni //
translated: “It is good that the king is sad.🔽There is no greater sin

original: de las che ba yod pa min //
analyzed: de las che ba yod pa min //
translated: than patricide.🔽You should feel very great regret.”

original: 'gyod pa shin tu cher skyes shig / de bshags pa'i thabs ni grong khyer ser skya na rgyal bu don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba yod kyis de la dris dang / ston pa de rnams ni log par ston pa yin byas pas /
analyzed: 'gyod pa shin tu cher skyes shig / de bshags pa'i thabs ni grong khyer ser skya na rgyal bu don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba yod kyis de la dris dang / ston pa de rnams ni log par ston pa yin byas pas /
translated: “Those teachers are false teachers.”

original: de la yon tan ci yod de'i yon tan ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'chi ltas lnga byung ba yang ston pa la zhus pas ma shi / sor phreng can gyis dgu brgya bsad pa dang / rgyal bu pu tas yan lag bcad pa dang /
analyzed: de la yon tan ci yod de'i yon tan ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'chi ltas lnga byung ba yang ston pa la zhus pas ma shi / sor phreng can gyis dgu brgya bsad pa dang / rgyal bu pu tas yan lag bcad pa dang /
translated: When Aṅgulimāla killed nine hundred people, when Prince Puṇyabala had his limbs cut off,

original: mi lnga brgya mig phyung ba dang / kun ston pa la zhus pas kun sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mi lnga brgya mig phyung ba dang / kun ston pa la zhus pas kun sangs rgyas so //
translated: and when five hundred people had their eyes gouged out, they all became buddhas by asking the Teacher.

original: dus der ston pa mya ngan las 'das su nye ba na /
analyzed: dus der ston pa mya ngan las 'das su nye ba na /
translated: At that time, the Teacher was about to pass into nirvāṇa.

original: nam mkha' la sgra byung nas rgyal po myur bar song /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sgra byung nas rgyal po myur bar song /
translated: A voice from the sky said, “King Ajātaśatru, go quickly!

original: khyod da ste zhag bdun na shi nas dmyal khams bco brgyad du 'gro'o zer nas /
analyzed: khyod da ste zhag bdun na shi nas dmyal khams bco brgyad du 'gro'o zer nas /
translated: In seven days you will die and go to the eighteen hells.”

original: khyed su yin byas pas nga pha @127a * //
analyzed: khyed su yin byas pas nga pha @127a * //
translated: “Who are you?” he asked. “I am your father,”

original: gzugs can snying po yin zer nas song /
analyzed: gzugs can snying po yin zer nas song /
translated: Bimbisāra said, and left.

original: ma skyes dgra der brgyal /🔽brgyal ba sangs nas /
analyzed: ma skyes dgra der brgyal / brgyal ba sangs nas /
translated: Ajātaśatru fainted.🔽When he came to,

original: der 'khor mang po bcas pas ston pa la zhus pas /
analyzed: der 'khor mang po bcas pas ston pa la zhus pas /
translated: he and his many followers asked the Teacher.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la zhus zer nas 'jam dpal gyis chos thams cad gnyis su med pa sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes rgyas par bshad pas der rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa lus sems dga' ldan lha dang 'dra bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la zhus zer nas 'jam dpal gyis chos thams cad gnyis su med pa sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes rgyas par bshad pas der rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa lus sems dga' ldan lha dang 'dra bar gyur to //
translated: The king said, I have asked Manjusri, and Manjusri explained in detail that all phenomena are nondual and illusionlike. The king and his retinue became like the gods of the Joyous realm.

original: de ltar ston pa drug po des grong khyer stong lta ba log pa la btsud pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa drug po des grong khyer stong lta ba log pa la btsud pa la /
translated: Thus, those six teachers led the people of the empty city to a false view.

original: rje btsun 'jam dpal gyis mu stegs karna kar brdzus nas thams cad sun byung nas bdag med pa'i lta ba la kun btsud do //
analyzed: rje btsun 'jam dpal gyis mu stegs karna kar brdzus nas thams cad sun byung nas bdag med pa'i lta ba la kun btsud do //
translated: Then the venerable Manjusri took birth as the tirthika Karnakagomin and refuted them all. He led them to the view of selflessness.

original: de lta bu don mdzad pa des 'dul bas na don de thugs kyi dgongs pa tsam gyis byon pas yid mgyogs so //
analyzed: de lta bu don mdzad pa des 'dul bas na don de thugs kyi dgongs pa tsam gyis byon pas yid mgyogs so //
translated: Since he tamed them by such means, he is called Manogata, Swift of Mind, because he came with the mere intention in his mind.

original: de yang sgrib pa gnyis las rgyal bas na'o //
analyzed: de yang sgrib pa gnyis las rgyal bas na'o //
translated: And he is so called because he is victorious over the two obscurations.

original: 'dul lugs ji ltar 'dul zhe na /
analyzed: 'dul lugs ji ltar 'dul zhe na /
translated: How does he tame?

original: 'khor los sgyur ba stobs po che //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba stobs po che //
translated: He is a powerful universal monarch.

original: zhes sngon grong khyer 'od 'phro can na rgyal po dpa' ba'i blo gros bya ba grong khyer bye ba phrag bcu /
analyzed: zhes sngon grong khyer 'od 'phro can na rgyal po dpa' ba'i blo gros bya ba grong khyer bye ba phrag bcu /
translated: In the past, in the city of Marici, there was a king called Shuramati, who had ten million cities,

original: bud med stong phrag gsum //
analyzed: bud med stong phrag gsum //
translated: three thousand women,

original: de la sras gzi byin chen po la sogs pa lnga brgya /
analyzed: de la sras gzi byin chen po la sogs pa lnga brgya /
translated: and five hundred sons, including Mahatejas.

original: sras gzi byin chen po la chung ma lta na sdug pa stong phrag bcu yod pa gling bzhi la dbang ba rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa dus de'i tshe sangs rgyas ri rab dpal nam mkha' la phar bzhud pa mthong bas rgyal srid mchil ma'i thal
analyzed: sras gzi byin chen po la chung ma lta na sdug pa stong phrag bcu yod pa gling bzhi la dbang ba rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa dus de'i tshe sangs rgyas ri rab dpal nam mkha' la phar bzhud pa mthong bas rgyal srid mchil ma'i thal
translated: Mahatejas had ten thousand wives, including Rupasundari, and ruled the four continents, possessing the seven precious substances. At that time, he saw Buddha Meru Shri traveling through the sky. He abandoned his kingdom like a drop of spit

original: ba bzhin por nas 'gro ba la yab kyis ma 'gro byas pas ma nyan pas /
analyzed: ba bzhin por nas 'gro ba la yab kyis ma 'gro byas pas ma nyan pas /
translated: and left. When his father told him not to go, he did not listen.

original: de 'khor dang bcas pas buddha la mchod pa byas nas chos zhus pas kun thar pa thob po //
analyzed: de 'khor dang bcas pas buddha la mchod pa byas nas chos zhus pas kun thar pa thob po //
translated: He and his retinue made offerings to Buddha and requested the dharma. They all attained liberation.

original: gzhan rnams la ji ltar ston zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ji ltar ston zhe na /
translated: How does he teach others?

original: tshogs kyi nas dbang ldan zhes pas nyan rang byang sems rnams la 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi nas dbang ldan zhes pas nyan rang byang sems rnams la 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'o //
translated: From the powerful one of the assembly up to for the benefit of beings, it shows how he acts for the benefit of beings as shravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: tshul chen gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ni sngon gyi rgyal po bzhin bzangs zhes pa ri bo dan tig na dgongs pa mdzad pa la bdud bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis drag po gnod pa byas pas ma tshugs nas /
analyzed: tshul chen gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ni sngon gyi rgyal po bzhin bzangs zhes pa ri bo dan tig na dgongs pa mdzad pa la bdud bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis drag po gnod pa byas pas ma tshugs nas /
translated: The great method of not being led by others is like the former king called Bhadra who was meditating on Mount Dandaka.  He was not affected by the harm of the fierce demons.

original: der bdud de tshos bud med nyi khri sbrul nas 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas ci 'gyur byas pas ma tshugs so //
analyzed: der bdud de tshos bud med nyi khri sbrul nas 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas ci 'gyur byas pas ma tshugs so //
translated: Then those demons emanated twenty thousand women and tried to do whatever they could with the five sense objects of desire, but he was not affected.

original: ji ltar ston zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ston zhe na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: tshig rje zhes pa nas ston pa po'i zhes pas 'jam dpal gyis byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la 'jig @127b rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mtshan gyi rnam grangs mi 'dra ba mang po so sor rig pa'i tshul du bshad do //
analyzed: tshig rje zhes pa nas ston pa po'i zhes pas 'jam dpal gyis byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la 'jig @127b rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mtshan gyi rnam grangs mi 'dra ba mang po so sor rig pa'i tshul du bshad do //
translated: From “the lord of speech” up to “the teacher” explains that Mañjuśrī explained to the bodhisattvas and so on the many different enumerations of the names of the buddhas of the world in the manner of individual knowledge.

original: bstan lugs ni phyir mi nas rgyu gcig po zhes pas gang la mtshan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan lugs ni phyir mi nas rgyu gcig po zhes pas gang la mtshan bstan pa ste /
translated: The way of teaching is from “the one cause” up to “the one who teaches.”

original: nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pas theg pa kun gyi 'byung gnas sam rgyu'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pas theg pa kun gyi 'byung gnas sam rgyu'o //
translated: It is the source or cause of all vehicles, since it is taught to the hearers, solitary realizers, and bodhisattvas.

original: de spang bya gang spangs pas byung zhe na /
analyzed: de spang bya gang spangs pas byung zhe na /
translated: What is it that arises from the relinquishment of what is to be abandoned?

original: dge slong dgra bcom nas las byung bas rje btsun spang bya mtha' dag spangs nas bde ba'i ye shes 'phags lam brgyad dang ldan pas ji lta ba rig pa zung du 'jug pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i skam sar byon pa'i ye
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom nas las byung bas rje btsun spang bya mtha' dag spangs nas bde ba'i ye shes 'phags lam brgyad dang ldan pas ji lta ba rig pa zung du 'jug pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i skam sar byon pa'i ye
translated: Since it arises from the deeds of a bhikṣu arhat, the venerable one has relinquished all that is to be abandoned and, endowed with the bliss of the wisdom of the eightfold noble path, he has crossed the swamp of saṃsāra through the union of the two: knowing the way things are and knowing the variety of phenomena. He has arrived at the dry land of nirvāṇa.

original: shes te / de yang sngon rje btsun rgyal po nam mkhar gyur pa'i dus su rgyal po lha la sras de 'khrungs nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi la dbang ba btsun mo drug khri dang bcas phyi blon nang blon la sogs pa dpag tu med pa yod pa
analyzed: shes te / de yang sngon rje btsun rgyal po nam mkhar gyur pa'i dus su rgyal po lha la sras de 'khrungs nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi la dbang ba btsun mo drug khri dang bcas phyi blon nang blon la sogs pa dpag tu med pa yod pa
translated: Moreover, in the past, when the venerable one was King of the Sky, he was born as the son of King God. As a universal monarch who ruled the four continents, he had sixty thousand queens, countless outer and inner ministers, and so on.

original: la / yab rgyal po sa'i lha ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'dod pas ma tshim nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dbang po brgya byin gyi stan phyed kyis ma tshim nas yong 'dod pa'i bsam pas rin po che dang bral te 'dzam bu'i gling du song nas shi'o //
analyzed: la / yab rgyal po sa'i lha ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'dod pas ma tshim nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dbang po brgya byin gyi stan phyed kyis ma tshim nas yong 'dod pa'i bsam pas rin po che dang bral te 'dzam bu'i gling du song nas shi'o //
translated: The father, King Divaukas, was not satisfied with the pleasures of Jambudvipa, and not satisfied with half the throne of Indra, lord of the Thirty-Three, he went to Jambudvipa with the intention of taking it all, and died.

original: der bu rgyal po nam mkha' 'khor ba la skyo ba skyes nas /
analyzed: der bu rgyal po nam mkha' 'khor ba la skyo ba skyes nas /
translated: His son, King Nabha, became disgusted with samsara.

original: rgyal pos dbu rtse nas bltas pas sgo bzhin par 'chi ba dang skye ba dang rgas pa dang na ba mi 'chad pa mthong nas rgyal srid la yid byung nas /
analyzed: rgyal pos dbu rtse nas bltas pas sgo bzhin par 'chi ba dang skye ba dang rgas pa dang na ba mi 'chad pa mthong nas rgyal srid la yid byung nas /
translated: The king looked from the top of the palace and saw that birth, aging, sickness, and death were unceasing at the door. He became disgusted with the kingdom.

original: btsun mo dam pa la nga snying ma dga' nas 'gyel nas 'gro na byas pas /
analyzed: btsun mo dam pa la nga snying ma dga' nas 'gyel nas 'gro na byas pas /
translated: He said to his chief queen, I am not happy. I am going to fall down dead.

original: 'o na mu stegs kyi ston pa mi pham la chos thabs zhus zer bas /
analyzed: 'o na mu stegs kyi ston pa mi pham la chos thabs zhus zer bas /
translated: Well then, she said, ask the non-Buddhist teacher Ajita for a Dharma method.

original: des nga'i nad mi sos /
analyzed: des nga'i nad mi sos /
translated: He said, That won't cure my illness.

original: nad 'di mi gsum 'dom pa'i nad yin byas pas /🔽dam pa'i chos la 'ongs na sos te 'ang /
analyzed: nad 'di mi gsum 'dom pa'i nad yin byas pas / dam pa'i chos la 'ongs na sos te 'ang /
translated: This illness is the illness of three people.

original: de min na 'chi gsungs pas /
analyzed: de min na 'chi gsungs pas /
translated: If you come to the true Dharma, you will be cured, but if not, you will die.

original: btsun mo na re de skad ma gsung dus de'i tshe na sangs rgyas 'brug sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po bya ba bzhugs pa la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zer nas /
analyzed: btsun mo na re de skad ma gsung dus de'i tshe na sangs rgyas 'brug sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po bya ba bzhugs pa la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zer nas /
translated: The queen said, “Do not say that. At that time, the Buddha called Dragon Song King was present, and he turned the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: sangs rgyas de la lo brgyad khrir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems bskyed nas smon lam mang po zhus nas mchod pa mang po byas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de la lo brgyad khrir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems bskyed nas smon lam mang po zhus nas mchod pa mang po byas so //
translated: “I generated the awakening mind and made many aspirational prayers in the presence of that buddha, and I made many offerings for eighty thousand years while he turned the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: de nas rgyal pos g-yog 'khor rnams spangs nas gcig bu nags gseb tu bsgom du 'ongs pas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos g-yog 'khor rnams spangs nas gcig bu nags gseb tu bsgom du 'ongs pas /
translated: “Then the king abandoned his retinue and came alone to the forest to meditate.

original: ga re dge ba de tsam byas pas /
analyzed: ga re dge ba de tsam byas pas /
translated: What is the virtue of doing that much?”

original: de bsngo ba ma byas pas /
analyzed: de bsngo ba ma byas pas /
translated: “Because I did not dedicate it.”

original: @128a * // bsngo ba ji skad byas la bsngo'am /🔽tshangs par bsngo'am /
analyzed: @128a * // bsngo ba ji skad byas la bsngo'am / tshangs par bsngo'am /
translated: “How should I dedicate it?”🔽“Should I dedicate it to Brahmā?”

original: brgya byin du bsngo'am /
analyzed: brgya byin du bsngo'am /
translated: “Should I dedicate it to Indra?”🔽“Should I dedicate it to the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?”

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su bsngo'am snyam nas yod pa la nam mkha' las me tog gi char byung nas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su bsngo'am snyam nas yod pa la nam mkha' las me tog gi char byung nas /
translated: As he was thinking this, a rain of flowers fell from the sky.

original: rgyal po chen po snyan gson dang bsngo ba rnam par dag pa ni byang chub chen po yin rgyal po chen po shes par gyis zer nas /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po snyan gson dang bsngo ba rnam par dag pa ni byang chub chen po yin rgyal po chen po shes par gyis zer nas /
translated: Great King, listen! The pure dedication is the great enlightenment.

original: de'i dus na chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur mthong zhing rtogs nas sa dang po'i mthong lam skyes so //
analyzed: de'i dus na chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur mthong zhing rtogs nas sa dang po'i mthong lam skyes so //
translated: At that time, seeing and realizing all phenomena as illusion-like, the path of seeing of the first ground arose.

original: de'i rjes la ye shes 'ba' zhig las byung bas bsgom pa'i lam thob pas khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la ye shes 'ba' zhig las byung bas bsgom pa'i lam thob pas khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, since it arises solely from wisdom, the path of cultivation is attained, and one becomes distinguished.

original: gzhan don mdzad pa ni shes rab mtshon nas lam ni ston pa po zhes pa ni rab tu 'byed pa'i shes rab lung man ngag gis gzhan la ston te /
analyzed: gzhan don mdzad pa ni shes rab mtshon nas lam ni ston pa po zhes pa ni rab tu 'byed pa'i shes rab lung man ngag gis gzhan la ston te /
translated: Regarding the performance of others' benefit, the teacher of the path through the weapon of wisdom means that through the wisdom of discernment, one teaches others through scriptures and instructions.

original: ma rig pa bsal nas chos thams cad dbang rnyed pas na dman pa rnams la lam phyin ci ma log par ston no //
analyzed: ma rig pa bsal nas chos thams cad dbang rnyed pas na dman pa rnams la lam phyin ci ma log par ston no //
translated: Having dispelled ignorance, since one has attained mastery over all phenomena, one correctly teaches the path to those of lesser capacity.

original: 'di yang sngon gyi dus na bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dge slong brgya stong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' khri nyis stong dang / lha'i bu dpag tu med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di yang sngon gyi dus na bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na dge slong brgya stong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' khri nyis stong dang / lha'i bu dpag tu med pa dang /
translated: Long ago, the Bhagavān was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, together with a great saṅgha of a thousand bhikṣus, twelve thousand bodhisattvas, and countless devas,

original: lha ma srin sde brgyad la sogs pa dang / thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: lha ma srin sde brgyad la sogs pa dang / thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
translated: as well as the eight classes of spirits and so forth.

original: dus de'i tshe na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas rol du bzhugs so //
analyzed: dus de'i tshe na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas rol du bzhugs so //
translated: At that time, the noble Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta was seated to the Bhagavān's right.

original: dus de'i tshe lha'i bu rin chen mchog ces bya bas bsams pa /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe lha'i bu rin chen mchog ces bya bas bsams pa /
translated: At that time, a deva son named Ratnottama thought,

original: 'jam dpal 'dis nges pa'i lam phyin ci ma log pa'i chos cig bstan na ci ma rung snyam mo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'dis nges pa'i lam phyin ci ma log pa'i chos cig bstan na ci ma rung snyam mo //
translated: If only Mañjuśrī would teach the unmistaken Dharma of the definitive path.

original: dus der bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen nas 'jam dpal la zhus so //
analyzed: dus der bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen nas 'jam dpal la zhus so //
translated: At that time, the Bhagavān, knowing this, asked Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal gyi zhal nas chos thams cad brjod du med pa la bshad du yod dam gsungs /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi zhal nas chos thams cad brjod du med pa la bshad du yod dam gsungs /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, All phenomena are inexpressible, so how can they be explained?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal nas brjod du med pa la brjod par go bas shod gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal nas brjod du med pa la brjod par go bas shod gsungs /
translated: The Bhagavān said, Explain inexpressibility by expressing it.

original: 'jam dpal gyi zhal nas brjod du med pa la ji skad bshad lags /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi zhal nas brjod du med pa la ji skad bshad lags /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, How can one explain inexpressibility?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la brtsams nas shod gsungs /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la brtsams nas shod gsungs /
translated: beginning with the pure dharmadhātu, explain.

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang dbyer @128b med pa chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin na blo gros dman pa dag skrag cing dang nga bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang dbyer @128b med pa chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin na blo gros dman pa dag skrag cing dang nga bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If one begins with the pure dharmadhātu, since afflictive phenomena and purified phenomena are inseparable, all phenomena are equality. But will those of inferior intelligence not be frightened and terrified?

original: ston pa'i zhal nas skrag cing dang nga ba rang 'jug pa'i lam yin pas ston cig gsung /
analyzed: ston pa'i zhal nas skrag cing dang nga ba rang 'jug pa'i lam yin pas ston cig gsung /
translated: The teacher said, Fright and terror are the path of engagement, so teach.

original: de nas 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis seng ge'i khri la bzhugs te /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis seng ge'i khri la bzhugs te /
translated: Then the noble Mañjuśrī sat on the lion throne🔽and said,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la dag chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dbyer med /🔽'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la dag chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dbyer med / 'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin //
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family who know the sameness of all dharmas, who know that samsara and nirvana are inseparable,🔽 who know that samsara is itself nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid 'khor ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid 'khor ba nyid yin te /
translated: and who know that nirvana is itself samsara,🔽they are the ones who will be called bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'khor ba'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'khor ba'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Why is that?🔽The suchness of samsara is nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo de nyid 'khor ba la snang ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo de nyid 'khor ba la snang ba'o //
translated: The essence of nirvana appears as samsara.

original: dus der dbang po rnon po dang ldan pa dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob /
analyzed: dus der dbang po rnon po dang ldan pa dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob /
translated: At that time, those with sharp faculties attained acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas.

original: dbang po dman pa rnams de nyid du langs nas /
analyzed: dbang po dman pa rnams de nyid du langs nas /
translated: Those with inferior faculties rose up from that and said,

original: de ltar yin na rab tu byung ma byung dang med /
analyzed: de ltar yin na rab tu byung ma byung dang med /
translated: If that is so, then there is no difference between being ordained and not being ordained,

original: tshul khrims bsrungs ma bsrungs dang gnyis med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs ma bsrungs dang gnyis med do //
translated: and between observing and not observing morality.

original: chos de byar med zer nas bros song ngo //
analyzed: chos de byar med zer nas bros song ngo //
translated: Saying that dharma is nothing to do, they ran away.

original: der 'jam dpal gyis sprul pa'i dge slong gcig tu sprul te lam gyi bzhi mdor bsdad do //
analyzed: der 'jam dpal gyis sprul pa'i dge slong gcig tu sprul te lam gyi bzhi mdor bsdad do //
translated: Then Manjushri emanated as a monk and sat at the crossroads.

original: der nyan thos kyi rigs de la gang nas 'ongs byas pas /
analyzed: der nyan thos kyi rigs de la gang nas 'ongs byas pas /
translated: The emanated monk asked, Where have you come from?

original: 'jam dpal la 'khor 'das dbyer med thos pas skrag pa'i lo rgyus byas pas so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal la 'khor 'das dbyer med thos pas skrag pa'i lo rgyus byas pas so //
translated: The śrāvaka replied, I am afraid of hearing about the indivisibility of samsara and nirvana from Mañjuśrī.

original: khyed gar 'gro zer /
analyzed: khyed gar 'gro zer /
translated: The emanated monk asked, Where are you going?

original: nga 'phags pa 'jam dpal gam du 'gro byas pas /
analyzed: nga 'phags pa 'jam dpal gam du 'gro byas pas /
translated: The śrāvaka replied, I am going to the presence of the noble Mañjuśrī.

original: ma 'gro kho na re chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin zer bas de ltar song na dge sdig 'dra bas skyon mang po yod zer /🔽der sprul pa'i dge slong des 'o na der sdod dang / da ltar snang ba 'di sems nyid snang bar 'dug gam /
analyzed: ma 'gro kho na re chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin zer bas de ltar song na dge sdig 'dra bas skyon mang po yod zer / der sprul pa'i dge slong des 'o na der sdod dang / da ltar snang ba 'di sems nyid snang bar 'dug gam /
translated: The emanated monk said, Do not go! He says that all phenomena are equality. If you go there like that, there will be many faults, such as the similarity of virtue and misdeed.

original: bems po snang bar 'dug gam dpyod dang byas pas /
analyzed: bems po snang bar 'dug gam dpyod dang byas pas /
translated: The emanated monk said, Well then, stay there and analyze whether these appearances are the appearances of the mind itself or whether they are the appearances of matter.🔽They analyzed and thought, “The appearances are the appearances of the mind itself.

original: de tshos dpyad pas sems nyid snang bar 'dug /'o na so so rang re'i sems 'di phyi na 'dug gam nang na 'dug / gnyi ga'am kha dog gam dbyibs la sogs pa gang du 'dug dpyod dang / sems 'di dang po gang nas 'ongs /
analyzed: de tshos dpyad pas sems nyid snang bar 'dug /'o na so so rang re'i sems 'di phyi na 'dug gam nang na 'dug / gnyi ga'am kha dog gam dbyibs la sogs pa gang du 'dug dpyod dang / sems 'di dang po gang nas 'ongs /
translated: Well then, is this mind of each of us inside or outside?

original: da lta gang na 'dug / tha ma gar 'gro dpyod dang / khyod rang gi yang spyi gtsug nas rkang mthil bar gang na 'dug rtog dang byas pas /
analyzed: da lta gang na 'dug / tha ma gar 'gro dpyod dang / khyod rang gi yang spyi gtsug nas rkang mthil bar gang na 'dug rtog dang byas pas /
translated: Examine where your own [mind] is, from the crown of your head down to the soles of your feet.

original: de ltar so so rang res brtags pas ma rnyed zer ro //🔽'o na med dam byas pas gsal ba tsam du 'dug /'o na te ma @129a * //
analyzed: de ltar so so rang res brtags pas ma rnyed zer ro // 'o na med dam byas pas gsal ba tsam du 'dug /'o na te ma @129a * //
translated: When you examine it in this way, you will say, “I do not find it.”

original: rnyed pa de ka'i ngo bo la 'khor ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa'am gnyis kyi rnam par 'dug gam mi 'dug byas pas /
analyzed: rnyed pa de ka'i ngo bo la 'khor ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa'am gnyis kyi rnam par 'dug gam mi 'dug byas pas /
translated: “Well, is it nonexistent?” “It is present as mere clarity.” “Well, is the essence of what you do not find present as saṃsāra, nirvāṇa, or both?”

original: de'i ngo bo la mi 'dug zer /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo la mi 'dug zer /
translated: “It is not present as those.”

original: der sprul pa'i dge slong na re 'o na 'jam dpal gyis bshad pa yang de lta bu la dgongs pa yin pas 'thad dam mi 'thad gsungs pas /
analyzed: der sprul pa'i dge slong na re 'o na 'jam dpal gyis bshad pa yang de lta bu la dgongs pa yin pas 'thad dam mi 'thad gsungs pas /
translated: The emanated monk said, “Well then, since Mañjuśrī’s explanation is also intended in that way, is it tenable or not?”🔽“It is very tenable.”

original: shin tu 'thad zer nas de zhu ru 'deng byas nas 'ongs so //
analyzed: shin tu 'thad zer nas de zhu ru 'deng byas nas 'ongs so //
translated: “Let us go to request that.”🔽The emanated monk sat on the lion throne. The śrāvakas came with their heads bowed. “What is the problem?”

original: sprul pa'i dge slong de seng khri'i steng du bzhugs pas nyan thos de rnams mgo phur nas byung bas cis nyes byas pas /
analyzed: sprul pa'i dge slong de seng khri'i steng du bzhugs pas nyan thos de rnams mgo phur nas byung bas cis nyes byas pas /
translated: The emanated monk sat on the lion throne. The śrāvakas bowed their heads to the ground. “ What is wrong?” they asked.🔽

original: da ci bros pa ngo tsha zer nas /
analyzed: da ci bros pa ngo tsha zer nas /
translated: Now, you are ashamed to run away.

original: der chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la ngo tsha ba yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: der chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la ngo tsha ba yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: There is no shame in the equality of all phenomena.

original: da legs par nyon cig gsungs nas /
analyzed: da legs par nyon cig gsungs nas /
translated: Now listen well.

original: lam phyin ci ma log pa'i don bshad pas legs pa'i lam ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: lam phyin ci ma log pa'i don bshad pas legs pa'i lam ni ston pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the unmistaken path is explained, so it is the teacher of the good path.

original: lam phyin ci ma log par ston pas rang don grub /
analyzed: lam phyin ci ma log par ston pas rang don grub /
translated: Since it teaches the unmistaken path, it is the accomplishment of one's own purpose.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa grub /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa grub /
translated: It is the accomplishment of others' thoughts.

original: de ltar yin phan chad du 'dzin pa med pas kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin phan chad du 'dzin pa med pas kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: Since that is the case, since there is no grasping, it is the abandonment of all conceptions.

original: 'o na rnam par mi rtog pa la sku ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par mi rtog pa la sku ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: Well then, how does the kāya arise in nonconceptuality?

original: zad mi shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: It arises inexhaustibly.

original: de la rgyu tshogs dgos pas bsod nams ldan pa ye shes tshogs te /
analyzed: de la rgyu tshogs dgos pas bsod nams ldan pa ye shes tshogs te /
translated: Since it is necessary to gather the causes, it is endowed with merit.

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu'o //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu'o //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is the ten perfections.

original: ye shes kyi khyad par dang yod med shes zhes pa theg pa'i khyad par te ;
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par dang yod med shes zhes pa theg pa'i khyad par te ;
translated: The difference of wisdom and the knowledge of existence and nonexistence is the difference of vehicles.

original: 'di ni dpe bstan pa ni sngon yul aa nyu ta zhes pa'i lung pa dgon pa cig na phar mi rgod lnga phyin pas shin tu skom pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni dpe bstan pa ni sngon yul aa nyu ta zhes pa'i lung pa dgon pa cig na phar mi rgod lnga phyin pas shin tu skom pa la /
translated: This is illustrated by the following story. Once upon a time, five bandits fled to a remote place.🔽They were very thirsty, and near a pond they saw the reflection of a huge black snake on a tree.

original: rdzing bu cig gi 'gram na shing cig la sbrul nag po chen po cig 'dug pa'i gzugs brnyan chu nang du byung ba la mi rnams chu 'thung ba'i blo che chung gis gcig na re sbrul dngos yin zer nas chu 'thung ma nus /
analyzed: rdzing bu cig gi 'gram na shing cig la sbrul nag po chen po cig 'dug pa'i gzugs brnyan chu nang du byung ba la mi rnams chu 'thung ba'i blo che chung gis gcig na re sbrul dngos yin zer nas chu 'thung ma nus /
translated: Some of them thought it was a real snake and could not drink the water.

original: gcig na re gzugs brnyan ngag yin te chu 'thungs na gnod pa 'ong bas dug sngags btab na phan zer ro //
analyzed: gcig na re gzugs brnyan ngag yin te chu 'thungs na gnod pa 'ong bas dug sngags btab na phan zer ro //
translated: One said, “It is a reflection. If you drink the water, it will harm you. It will help if you recite a mantra.”

original: gcig na re gzugs brnyan yin na 'thung dang zer /
analyzed: gcig na re gzugs brnyan yin na 'thung dang zer /
translated: One said, “If it is a reflection, drink it.”

original: gcig na re 'di rdog pas brdzis la btung zer /
analyzed: gcig na re 'di rdog pas brdzis la btung zer /
translated: One said, “Kick it with your foot and drink.”

original: blo dang ldan pa gcig na re 'di gzugs brnyan yin pas ci yang bya mi dgos pas de ga rang du zhog la chu btung zer nas khos 'thungs so //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa gcig na re 'di gzugs brnyan yin pas ci yang bya mi dgos pas de ga rang du zhog la chu btung zer nas khos 'thungs so //
translated: The wise one said, “It is a reflection. There is no need to do anything. Leave it as it is and drink the water.” He drank it.

original: de bzhin du theg pa'i khyad par la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa'i khyad par la sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, it is applied to the distinctions of the vehicles.

original: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
translated: The two accumulations are the one who accumulates them.

original: zhes pa ni sngon 'jam dpal rgyal po mig bzangs su @129b gyur tsam na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon 'jam dpal rgyal po mig bzangs su @129b gyur tsam na /
translated: In the past, when Mañjuśrī was just a king named Sunetra,

original: rgyal po'i chad pas sems can stong btson rar bcug pa las /
analyzed: rgyal po'i chad pas sems can stong btson rar bcug pa las /
translated: he released a thousand beings from prison who had been sentenced to death by the king.

original: bu smad yul 'khor byin nas btson ra nas bton no //
analyzed: bu smad yul 'khor byin nas btson ra nas bton no //
translated: He gave them his wives and children and his kingdom, and released them from prison.

original: rgyal po mi pham pa'i dus su lus sbyin par btang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po mi pham pa'i dus su lus sbyin par btang ngo //
translated: When he was King Ajita, he gave away his body as a gift.

original: rgyal po gtsug na rin chen gyis mgo sbyin par btang /
analyzed: rgyal po gtsug na rin chen gyis mgo sbyin par btang /
translated: When he was King Ratnacūḍa, he gave away his head.

original: rgyal po zla ba 'od kyi dus su mig byin /
analyzed: rgyal po zla ba 'od kyi dus su mig byin /
translated: When he was King Candracchattra, he gave away his eyes.

original: rgyal po gtogs so'i dus su dbang po lnga sbyin par btang /
analyzed: rgyal po gtogs so'i dus su dbang po lnga sbyin par btang /
translated: When he was King Pūrṇabhadra, he gave away his five sense faculties as gifts.🔽When he was Prince Sarvabhibhū, he gave away his legs and blood as gifts.

original: rgyal bu thams cad gtong bar grags pa'i dus su rkang dang khrag sbyin par btang bas des na rje btsun gyi tshogs gnyis bsags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal bu thams cad gtong bar grags pa'i dus su rkang dang khrag sbyin par btang bas des na rje btsun gyi tshogs gnyis bsags pa'o //
translated: Thus, the venerable one accumulated the two accumulations.

original: de thams cad kyang rnal 'byor ram ting nge 'dzin dam pa la brten pas rtag par kun rgyal nas mi g-yo ba zhes pas bstan /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang rnal 'byor ram ting nge 'dzin dam pa la brten pas rtag par kun rgyal nas mi g-yo ba zhes pas bstan /
translated: Since all of these are based on the sublime yoga or samadhi, they are called “unwavering.”

original: 'di yang sngon bya rgod phung po'i ri la bcom ldan 'das 'khor dpag tu med pa la chos ston pa'i dus su /
analyzed: 'di yang sngon bya rgod phung po'i ri la bcom ldan 'das 'khor dpag tu med pa la chos ston pa'i dus su /
translated: This is also as follows: In the past, when the Bhagavat was teaching the Dharma to an immeasurable retinue on Vulture Peak,

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas 'chag tu byon pa dang / gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu yang dag thugs la sgom pa byed pa gzigs nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs nas 'chag tu byon pa dang / gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu yang dag thugs la sgom pa byed pa gzigs nas /
translated: the noble Manjushri arose from samadhi and went for a walk. He saw the elder Shariputra practicing meditation on reality.🔽“Are you practicing concentration?”

original: khyod bsam gtan byed dam byas pas byed zer nas /
analyzed: khyod bsam gtan byed dam byas pas byed zer nas /
translated: “I am.”

original: khyod nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir byed dam /
analyzed: khyod nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir byed dam /
translated: “Are you practicing in order to abandon the afflictions?”🔽“Yes, I am.”

original: de bzhin byed zer na 'o na khyod dus gsum gang la gnas nas byed dam /🔽yul lnga la gnas nas byed dam /
analyzed: de bzhin byed zer na 'o na khyod dus gsum gang la gnas nas byed dam / yul lnga la gnas nas byed dam /
translated: “Well then, in which of the three times do you abide in order to practice?”🔽“Do you practice abiding in the five objects?”

original: dbang po lnga la gnas nas byed dam /
analyzed: dbang po lnga la gnas nas byed dam /
translated: “Do you practice abiding in the five faculties?”

original: khams gsum la gnas nas byed dam /
analyzed: khams gsum la gnas nas byed dam /
translated: “Do you practice abiding in the three realms?”

original: de thams cad ni mnyam pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de thams cad ni mnyam pa nyid yin /
translated: “All of those are equality.”

original: khyod la bsgom bya sgom byed kyi sgom pa ji ltar yin dris pas /
analyzed: khyod la bsgom bya sgom byed kyi sgom pa ji ltar yin dris pas /
translated: When asked, What is your meditation in which there is something to be meditated upon and a meditator?

original: lan du nga rtog pa spong ba tsam du sgom zer /
analyzed: lan du nga rtog pa spong ba tsam du sgom zer /
translated: he replied, I meditate by simply abandoning thoughts.🔽 Then, Are thoughts and mind the same or different?

original: 'o na rtog pa dang sems gcig gam tha dad rtog pa dang / sems la tha dad med pas brtags na ci yang rnyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na rtog pa dang sems gcig gam tha dad rtog pa dang / sems la tha dad med pas brtags na ci yang rnyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no difference between thoughts and mind, when examined, nothing is found.

original: de'i dus su kha cig ni ma mos nas du 'bod kyi dmyal bar thang cig skyes /
analyzed: de'i dus su kha cig ni ma mos nas du 'bod kyi dmyal bar thang cig skyes /
translated: At that time, some, without faith, were born in the Raurava hell for an instant,

original: de nas dga' ldan du skyes so //
analyzed: de nas dga' ldan du skyes so //
translated: and then were born in Tushita.

original: 'jam dpal bsam gtan de gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal bsam gtan de gang zhe na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is that concentration?

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: mi dmigs pa de mi rtog pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de mi rtog pa /
translated: That non-apprehension is non-conceptual,

original: mi dpyod pa spros pa nye bar zhi ba de ga la yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: mi dpyod pa spros pa nye bar zhi ba de ga la yod do zhe'am /
translated: non-analytical, and the pacification of mental proliferation.🔽 Is it both?

original: gnyis ka'o zhe'am /🔽gnyis ka ma yin par zhe'am gang du yang khas blang du med pa /
analyzed: gnyis ka'o zhe'am / gnyis ka ma yin par zhe'am gang du yang khas blang du med pa /
translated: Is it neither?

original: dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from all reference points,

original: sems pa med cing sems dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sems pa med cing sems dang bral ba ste /
translated: without thought, and free from mind.🔽 That which is conceptualized in the unconditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas la gang rtog dang // mya ngan 'das @130a * //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la gang rtog dang // mya ngan 'das @130a * //
translated: and nirvāṇa,

original: la gang rtog pa //
analyzed: la gang rtog pa //
translated: What is the object of thought?

original: gnyis ka bdud kyi las yin zhing //
analyzed: gnyis ka bdud kyi las yin zhing //
translated: Both are the work of Mara,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bshad //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis rab tu bshad //
translated: as the Buddhas have declared.

original: ces gsungs pas thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa thob po //
analyzed: ces gsungs pas thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa thob po //
translated: Thus, all of them attained arhatship.

original: des na rje btsun 'khor ba ji srid du bzhugs shing rnal 'byor dam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na rje btsun 'khor ba ji srid du bzhugs shing rnal 'byor dam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Lord is said to abide for as long as cyclic existence endures, and to be endowed with the highest yoga.

original: de'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is its result?

original: sku gsum dang / sku lnga dang / ye shes lnga dang / rigs lnga dang / spyan lnga dang ldan par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum dang / sku lnga dang / ye shes lnga dang / rigs lnga dang / spyan lnga dang ldan par bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught to be endowed with the three bodies, the five bodies, the five pristine wisdoms, the five spiritual clans, and the five eyes.

original: phrin las bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phrin las bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of its activity is:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed pa'o //
translated: It generates all the Buddhas.

original: zhes pas sangs rgyas kun chos nyid las skyes pa dang / thams cad la ma nor bar bstan pas de la sangs rgyas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pas sangs rgyas kun chos nyid las skyes pa dang / thams cad la ma nor bar bstan pas de la sangs rgyas 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since all the Buddhas are born from reality, and since it is taught to be unerring with respect to all, the Buddhas arise from it.

original: rje btsun nyid kyang gnyis med las skyes pas na sras po mchog / don mdzad kyang nyes pas mi gos te /
analyzed: rje btsun nyid kyang gnyis med las skyes pas na sras po mchog / don mdzad kyang nyes pas mi gos te /
translated: Since the Lord himself is born from nonduality, he is the supreme son.

original: chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur shes pas srid pa mi len pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams sgyu ma lta bur shes pas srid pa mi len pa'o //
translated: Since phenomena are understood to be like illusions, one does not take up existence.

original: 'o na 'gro don ji ltar mdzad na gnyis med las gzugs sku gnyis byung nas srid pa sel lo //
analyzed: 'o na 'gro don ji ltar mdzad na gnyis med las gzugs sku gnyis byung nas srid pa sel lo //
translated: If one asks how benefit for transmigrators is performed, the two form bodies arise from the nondual [citta], and existence is eliminated.

original: 'gran zla med pa'i sku skye 'chi dang bral ba sku byung ma thag tu 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa'i sku skye 'chi dang bral ba sku byung ma thag tu 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'o //
translated: The body that is without rival, free from birth and death, performs the welfare of transmigrators as soon as it arises.

original: sku ni gzha' tshon lta bu la mtshan dpes spras pa ste /
analyzed: sku ni gzha' tshon lta bu la mtshan dpes spras pa ste /
translated: The body is like a rainbow, adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: stong pa nyid las byung ba'i sku de ye shes lnga'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las byung ba'i sku de ye shes lnga'i ngo bo ste /
translated: That body that arises from emptiness is the essence of the five wisdoms.

original: shes rab ye shes nas 'od gsal bas ye shes lngas don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes nas 'od gsal bas ye shes lngas don mdzad pa'o //
translated: Since it is clear light, it performs benefit with the five wisdoms.

original: rang don du shes skyob gnyis mchog bdag po /
analyzed: rang don du shes skyob gnyis mchog bdag po /
translated: For one’s own benefit, it is the lord of the two supreme ones, knowledge and protection.

original: gzhan don dang phrin las mdzad pas rig sngags nas don zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan don dang phrin las mdzad pas rig sngags nas don zhes pa'o //
translated: For the benefit of others, it performs benefit with the activities of knowledge mantras.

original: rje btsun dbu la ye shes lnga'i gtsug tor spro bsdus bzhugs /
analyzed: rje btsun dbu la ye shes lnga'i gtsug tor spro bsdus bzhugs /
translated: The Jetsun sits in the crown of the head, the source of the five wisdoms, emanating and reabsorbing.

original: sku'i dpe nam mkha' la kun 'byung pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sku'i dpe nam mkha' la kun 'byung pa bzhin no //
translated: The example of the body is like the source of everything in space.

original: gong du bstan pa bzhin du khyad par du gyur pas 'gro ba kun la spyan gyis gzigs nas gdul bya ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du skye ba ston pas na sna tshogs gzugs can bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa bzhin du khyad par du gyur pas 'gro ba kun la spyan gyis gzigs nas gdul bya ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du skye ba ston pas na sna tshogs gzugs can bskyed pa'o //
translated: As explained above, he is the one who generates the various forms, because he sees with his eyes all beings, and because he shows himself in various ways in order to tame those to be tamed.

original: drang srong che dgus mchod cing brjod pa ni sngon ston pa lha'i dbang po dbang sgyur gyi gnas na sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' mang po bzhugs pa la kun chos kyi 'gro ba mdzad pa la /
analyzed: drang srong che dgus mchod cing brjod pa ni sngon ston pa lha'i dbang po dbang sgyur gyi gnas na sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' mang po bzhugs pa la kun chos kyi 'gro ba mdzad pa la /
translated: The great sages worship and praise him. In the past, when the teacher was in the abode of Vaishravana, the lord of the gods, many buddhas and bodhisattvas were present, and all of them engaged in Dharma activity.

original: 'jam dpal gyis ma gsungs par gzhan mi gsung ba la sus kyang ma spobs nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis ma gsungs par gzhan mi gsung ba la sus kyang ma spobs nas /
translated: When Manjushri did not speak, and no one else spoke, no one else was eloquent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug gis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug gis /
translated: Then the sixteen bodhisattvas🔽Praised each of them with sixteen verses, beginning with:

original: dpal gyi 'byung gnas 'jam dpal kun gyi dpal //🔽la sogs pa tshigs bcad bcu drug gis re re @130b bstod do //
analyzed: dpal gyi 'byung gnas 'jam dpal kun gyi dpal // la sogs pa tshigs bcad bcu drug gis re re @130b bstod do //
translated: The source of glory, the glory of all Manjushris,

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyis kyang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyis kyang /
translated: The buddhas of the ten directions also praised him,🔽With:

original: nyid kyi mdangs bzang sems kyi ni //
analyzed: nyid kyi mdangs bzang sems kyi ni //
translated: Your excellent radiance, mind,

original: la sogs pas bstod do //
analyzed: la sogs pas bstod do //
translated: And so forth.

original: dus de nyid du lha dang lha mo la sogs pa dpag tu med pa rnams kyis mchod pa sna tshogs pas mchod //
analyzed: dus de nyid du lha dang lha mo la sogs pa dpag tu med pa rnams kyis mchod pa sna tshogs pas mchod //
translated: At that very moment, countless gods, goddesses, and others made offerings with various offerings.

original: bstod pa kun gyis bstod nas zab mo'i don mang du zhus so //
analyzed: bstod pa kun gyis bstod nas zab mo'i don mang du zhus so //
translated: Having praised with all praises, they asked many questions about the profound meaning.

original: yon tan yod pas bstod pa nas sku gsung thugs dang shes skyob gnyis yod pa can no //
analyzed: yon tan yod pas bstod pa nas sku gsung thugs dang shes skyob gnyis yod pa can no //
translated: From the praise of having qualities, up to the praise of having two protectors of body, speech, and mind.

original: thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes gsang sngags kyi bstan pa 'dzin pa des na gtso bo ste /
analyzed: thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes gsang sngags kyi bstan pa 'dzin pa des na gtso bo ste /
translated: The mind is the secret mantra teaching of pure wisdom. Therefore, it is the principal one.

original: dkon mchog gsum dang theg pa gsum ston pa gong bzhin no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dang theg pa gsum ston pa gong bzhin no //
translated: It teaches the Three Jewels and the Three Vehicles as above.

original: des na 'gro ba'i don thugs rje zhags pas thun mong ma yin pa des 'dzin te /
analyzed: des na 'gro ba'i don thugs rje zhags pas thun mong ma yin pa des 'dzin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning for sentient beings is held by the lasso of compassion.

original: des sems can mi gtong bas zhags pa dang sems can 'dzin pas lcags kyu dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: des sems can mi gtong bas zhags pa dang sems can 'dzin pas lcags kyu dang 'dra'o //
translated: Since it does not abandon sentient beings, it is like a lasso. Since it holds sentient beings, it is like a hook.

original: des 'ching bas zhags pa che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des 'ching bas zhags pa che zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it binds with that, it is called the great lasso.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal shes rab ye shes spyi gtsug gi yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal shes rab ye shes spyi gtsug gi yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: It shows the qualities of the crown of the wisdom of noble Manjushri.

original: da ni me long lta bu'i ye shes de gdul bya zhe sdang can gdul ba'i phyir khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa khro bo'i tshogs dpag tu med pa rnams bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni me long lta bu'i ye shes de gdul bya zhe sdang can gdul ba'i phyir khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa khro bo'i tshogs dpag tu med pa rnams bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to tame those to be tamed who have anger, the teaching of the assembly of immeasurable wrathful ones, such as the conqueror over the three realms, is the mirror-like pristine consciousness.

original: rdo rje ni me long lta bu de las 'jigs par byed pa'i sku gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje ni me long lta bu de las 'jigs par byed pa'i sku gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wrathful form that terrifies from the vajra, which is the mirror-like pristine consciousness?

original: khro bo'i rgyal po gdong drug 'jigs //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po gdong drug 'jigs //
translated: The wrathful king with six faces is terrifying.

original: mig drug lag drug stobs dang ldan pa ni pha rol phyin pa drug dang / rjes su dran pa drug dang / mngon shes drug gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: mig drug lag drug stobs dang ldan pa ni pha rol phyin pa drug dang / rjes su dran pa drug dang / mngon shes drug gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The one with six eyes, six arms, and great strength is the essence of the six perfections, the six recollections, and the six higher perceptions.

original: 'di la sngon lha dang lha ma yin 'thab pa'i dus su ma h'a de ba yab yum ma phrel  ba me lhas phral bas /
analyzed: 'di la sngon lha dang lha ma yin 'thab pa'i dus su ma h'a de ba yab yum ma phrel  ba me lhas phral bas /
translated: In the past, when the gods and demigods were fighting, Mahadeva and his consort were inseparable. Since they were separated by the fire god,

original: me lha'i kha la pho mtshan brgyab bas /
analyzed: me lha'i kha la pho mtshan brgyab bas /
translated: the male organ was placed on the mouth of the fire god.

original: me lta bu che nas ston pa la thabs zhus nas khos me'i dkyil 'khor du bsgoms nas mdun du bum pa drug bsgoms te khong pa'i sa bon byabs nas bum par blugs pas /
analyzed: me lta bu che nas ston pa la thabs zhus nas khos me'i dkyil 'khor du bsgoms nas mdun du bum pa drug bsgoms te khong pa'i sa bon byabs nas bum par blugs pas /
translated: Since he became as big as fire, he requested a method from the teacher. He meditated on the maṇḍala of fire, meditated on six vases in front, and sprinkled the seed syllables in his stomach and poured them into the vases.

original: bum pa drug sbrum nas der gcig tu 'byar nas de'i nang nas gdong pa drug pa gcig byung ste gzhon nu mig ces kyang bya /
analyzed: bum pa drug sbrum nas der gcig tu 'byar nas de'i nang nas gdong pa drug pa gcig byung ste gzhon nu mig ces kyang bya /
translated: He emanated six heads on his vase, and they stuck together. From within them, a six-faced one appeared. He was also called Kumāra Ekānana.

original: gzhon nu gdong drug zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: gzhon nu gdong drug zhes kyang bya /
translated: He was also called Kumāra Ṣaṇṇana.

original: de'i bu dbang ldan drag po bya ba 'khor dang bcas pas skye 'gro kun la dbang byed pa yod pa de gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bu dbang ldan drag po bya ba 'khor dang bcas pas skye 'gro kun la dbang byed pa yod pa de gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: He had a son named Powerful Rudra, who with his retinue ruled over all living beings. In order to tame him,

original: rje btsun gyis khro bo gdong drug tu sprul pas na des 'jigs pas na 'jigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rje btsun gyis khro bo gdong drug tu sprul pas na des 'jigs pas na 'jigs zhes bya'o //
translated: the venerable one emanated as the wrathful six-faced one. Because of that, he was called Bhairava.

original: keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa po //
analyzed: keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa po //
translated: He was a skeleton with bared fangs.

original: @131a * // zhes bya ba ni lha mo au ma la bu gsum ni /
analyzed: @131a * // zhes bya ba ni lha mo au ma la bu gsum ni /
translated: The goddess Umā had three sons:

original: k'arti ka dang / bhring+gi ri ti dang / karni ka gsum yod pa las /
analyzed: k'arti ka dang / bhring+gi ri ti dang / karni ka gsum yod pa las /
translated: Kārttikeya, Bhṛṅgiriṭi, and Karṇika.

original: ma srin mo'i spyod pa byed pas phas sbas te /
analyzed: ma srin mo'i spyod pa byed pas phas sbas te /
translated: Because of the behavior of the demoness mother, the father hid them.

original: nam zhig k'arti ka shin tu bzang sdug la 'od che nas mos bltar 'ongs pas bu bros te /
analyzed: nam zhig k'arti ka shin tu bzang sdug la 'od che nas mos bltar 'ongs pas bu bros te /
translated: At one time, Kārttikeya was very handsome, and because of his great radiance, she came to look at him. The son ran away.

original: ded pas zin nas sha 'dod pa rus pa phas khyer zer nas sha bkros nas zos te song ngo //
analyzed: ded pas zin nas sha 'dod pa rus pa phas khyer zer nas sha bkros nas zos te song ngo //
translated: The father said, “I want the meat,” and he took the meat and ate it.

original: phas phyin tsam na shi la khad nas 'dug pa la rtsi ma gi ta btab pas ma shi nas de shin tu drag rtsal che la zhe sdang tshad du phyin pa cig byung /
analyzed: phas phyin tsam na shi la khad nas 'dug pa la rtsi ma gi ta btab pas ma shi nas de shin tu drag rtsal che la zhe sdang tshad du phyin pa cig byung /
translated: When the father returned, the son was on the verge of death. He was treated with the medicine makit, and he did not die. He became very strong and his hatred reached its full extent.

original: de gdul ba'i phyir keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa'i khro bo'o //
analyzed: de gdul ba'i phyir keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa'i khro bo'o //
translated: In order to subdue him, there is the wrathful one with a skeleton and bared fangs.

original: ha la ha la gdong brgya ba ni sngar 'jig rten pa'i lha chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug dang / lha ma srin sde brgyad tshogs nas gros byas pas /
analyzed: ha la ha la gdong brgya ba ni sngar 'jig rten pa'i lha chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug dang / lha ma srin sde brgyad tshogs nas gros byas pas /
translated: As for Halahala with a hundred heads, previously the great worldly gods, the sixteen bodhisattvas, and the eight classes of devas and rakshasas gathered and discussed this.

original: phyi'i rgya mtsho 'di na rin po che yod pas 'di dbyung ba'i thabs la ri rab la sgrub ma byas la skrog par chad /
analyzed: phyi'i rgya mtsho 'di na rin po che yod pas 'di dbyung ba'i thabs la ri rab la sgrub ma byas la skrog par chad /
translated: “Since there are jewels in this outer ocean, we must find a way to extract them. We will perform the sādhana on Mount Meru and summon them.”

original: klu chen po brgyad kyis srub thag byas /
analyzed: klu chen po brgyad kyis srub thag byas /
translated: The eight great nāgas made the churning rope.

original: lha chen po brgyad kyis 'then pas sna la rin po che mang po byung nas lha'i rgyan byas /
analyzed: lha chen po brgyad kyis 'then pas sna la rin po che mang po byung nas lha'i rgyan byas /
translated: The eight great devas pulled it, and many jewels came out of the nose. They made ornaments for the devas.

original: de nas dug lnga byung ste /
analyzed: de nas dug lnga byung ste /
translated: Then the five poisons arose.

original: btsan dug / dbyig dug / mche ba'i dug / mthong ba'i dug / thos pa'i dug ha la ha la byung ngo //
analyzed: btsan dug / dbyig dug / mche ba'i dug / mthong ba'i dug / thos pa'i dug ha la ha la byung ngo //
translated: The poisons were the poison of the powerful, the poison of the precious, the poison of the fangs, the poison of sight, and the poison of hearing.

original: btsan dug dbyig dug bzhag go //
analyzed: btsan dug dbyig dug bzhag go //
translated: The poison of the powerful and the poison of the precious were set aside.

original: mche ba'i dug sems can la gnod kyis dogs nas rgyal po mig mi bzang gis 'thungs pas sha'i spyan long nas ye shes kyi spyan mnga' bas des kun la bltas na gnod pas lag tu mchod rten bzhag go //
analyzed: mche ba'i dug sems can la gnod kyis dogs nas rgyal po mig mi bzang gis 'thungs pas sha'i spyan long nas ye shes kyi spyan mnga' bas des kun la bltas na gnod pas lag tu mchod rten bzhag go //
translated: The poison of the fangs was feared to harm sentient beings. When King Virūpākṣa drank it, his physical eyes were blinded, but since he possessed the eyes of primordial wisdom, when he looked at everyone, they were harmed. Therefore, he placed a stūpa in his hand.

original: mthong ba'i dug byung nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyis 'thungs pas khong par ma tshugs nas ske nas tsar gyis phyung nas kro dha mgrin sngon gdug pa sel bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dug byung nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyis 'thungs pas khong par ma tshugs nas ske nas tsar gyis phyung nas kro dha mgrin sngon gdug pa sel bya'o //
translated: When the poison of sight arose, Ārya Avalokiteśvara drank it, but since it did not stay in his stomach, it came out of his throat and was expelled. Krodha Nīladaṇḍa removed the poison.

original: de nas ha la ha la su'i rna bar thos pa 'chi ba na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhal brgya tham par sprul nas 'thungs te /
analyzed: de nas ha la ha la su'i rna bar thos pa 'chi ba na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhal brgya tham par sprul nas 'thungs te /
translated: Then, when the poison of hearing arose, Ārya Mañjuśrī emanated a hundred mouths and drank it.

original: thub nas sems can rnams la phan par byas so //
analyzed: thub nas sems can rnams la phan par byas so //
translated: Since he was able to, he benefited sentient beings.

original: de'i ngo bo bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: de'i ngo bo bstan pa ni ;
translated: The teaching on its essence is this:

original: gshin rje gshed po bgegs kyi rgyal //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed po bgegs kyi rgyal //
translated: Yamântaka is the king of obstructors.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon tshe lo dpag tu med pa thub pa'i dus su /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon tshe lo dpag tu med pa thub pa'i dus su /
translated: In the past, when people lived for countless years,

original: thub pa bgegs kyi rgyal po bi n'a ya ga zhes bya ba byol song gi gzugs la lto ba che ba mgo lcags ri'i ngos la gtad /
analyzed: thub pa bgegs kyi rgyal po bi n'a ya ga zhes bya ba byol song gi gzugs la lto ba che ba mgo lcags ri'i ngos la gtad /
translated: there was a sage named Vinayaka, the king of obstructors, who had the form of an animal, a huge belly, his head facing the side of the Iron Mountain,

original: rkang pa ri rab kyi ngos la gtad nas skye 'gro kun la @131b bar du gcod pa yod do //
analyzed: rkang pa ri rab kyi ngos la gtad nas skye 'gro kun la @131b bar du gcod pa yod do //
translated: and his feet facing the side of Mount Meru, and he was an obstructor to all beings.

original: de gdul ba'i don du sgyu 'phrul gsus po cher sprul nas de'i steng du bzhugs pas /
analyzed: de gdul ba'i don du sgyu 'phrul gsus po cher sprul nas de'i steng du bzhugs pas /
translated: In order to subdue him, [the Buddha] emanated as a huge-bellied illusionist and sat on top of him.

original: lcid lan gsum du phab pas 'khun ma byung nas /
analyzed: lcid lan gsum du phab pas 'khun ma byung nas /
translated: He was unable to make a sound because he was pressed down three times.

original: der bsam gtan dang por sleb pa'i lus kyis mnan pas bred nas chos skyong ba'i srung mar dam bcas so //
analyzed: der bsam gtan dang por sleb pa'i lus kyis mnan pas bred nas chos skyong ba'i srung mar dam bcas so //
translated: When he was pressed down with the body that had reached the first concentration, he was frightened and vowed to be a Dharma protector.

original: khro bo'i rgyu gang zhe na rdo rje las byung ba de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyu gang zhe na rdo rje las byung ba de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: What is the cause of wrath? It is called that because it arises from the vajra.

original: ngo bo'am rang bzhin nam mkha' lta bu gang gis dang por ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo'am rang bzhin nam mkha' lta bu gang gis dang por ma gos pa'o //
translated: The essence or nature is like space, by which one is not initially defiled.

original: dbu skra kham nag gyen du brdzes pa sprul gyi rgyan khro bo'i rgyan dang gsung dang thugs bstan pa ni /🔽glang chen nas gad rgyangs ha ha zhes sgrogs pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dbu skra kham nag gyen du brdzes pa sprul gyi rgyan khro bo'i rgyan dang gsung dang thugs bstan pa ni / glang chen nas gad rgyangs ha ha zhes sgrogs pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The wrathful ornaments, speech, and mind are taught.

original: glang lpags gos /
analyzed: glang lpags gos /
translated: The elephant skin garment.

original: gsung ha ha dang hi hi dang rdo rje'i gad rgyangs so //
analyzed: gsung ha ha dang hi hi dang rdo rje'i gad rgyangs so //
translated: His speech is ha ha and hi hi, and the vajra laughter.

original: 'o na khro bo de nyid zhe sdang 'ba' zhig gam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na khro bo de nyid zhe sdang 'ba' zhig gam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Now, is that wrathful one only hatred? No,

original: thugs bde ba chen po las ma g-yos so //
analyzed: thugs bde ba chen po las ma g-yos so //
translated: he does not move from the great bliss mind.

original: gsung rdo rje h'um ste h'um zhes sgrogs so //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje h'um ste h'um zhes sgrogs so //
translated: His speech is the vajra hūṃ, and he proclaims hūṃ.

original: phyag mtshan mtshon du rdo rje mda' gzhu dang / rdo rje ral gri dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / rtse lnga pa dang / g-yul sel ba rdo rje mdung la sogs pa dpag tu med do //
analyzed: phyag mtshan mtshon du rdo rje mda' gzhu dang / rdo rje ral gri dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / rtse lnga pa dang / g-yul sel ba rdo rje mdung la sogs pa dpag tu med do //
translated: His hand implements are the vajra bow and arrow, vajra sword, single-pointed vajra, five-pointed vajra, vajra spear that conquers in battle, and so on, which are immeasurable.

original: spyan rdo rje 'bar ba'i mig / dbu skra rdo rje /
analyzed: spyan rdo rje 'bar ba'i mig / dbu skra rdo rje /
translated: His eyes are the vajra blazing eyes, and his hair is the vajra hair.

original: rdo rje 'bebs pa 'od du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pa 'od du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The vajra descent arises as light.

original: gong gi gdong brgya la mig dang do //
analyzed: gong gi gdong brgya la mig dang do //
translated: The above one hundred faces have eyes and mouths.

original: lus kyi ba spu 'ang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lus kyi ba spu 'ang rdo rje'o //
translated: The hairs on his body are also vajras.

original: gcig pu'i lus ni skye shi med pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gcig pu'i lus ni skye shi med pa'i sku'o //
translated: His single body is the body of immortality.

original: pags pa yang rdo rje /
analyzed: pags pa yang rdo rje /
translated: His skin is also a vajra.

original: phyag rgya lnga yang rdo rjes brgyan pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga yang rdo rjes brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with the five symbolic ornaments and a vajra.

original: gsung ha ha sgrogs pa ci sgrogs na yi ge drug pa ste /
analyzed: gsung ha ha sgrogs pa ci sgrogs na yi ge drug pa ste /
translated: He proclaims the sound “ha ha.” What does he proclaim? The six syllables.

original: aom ya m'anta ka h'um ni khro bo'i yang snying ngo //
analyzed: aom ya m'anta ka h'um ni khro bo'i yang snying ngo //
translated: “Oṃ yamāntaka hūṃ” is the essence of wrath.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te sngon ri rab kyi steng chos bzang lha'i 'dun sar /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te sngon ri rab kyi steng chos bzang lha'i 'dun sar /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows. In the past, on the peak of Mount Meru, in the assembly hall of the gods,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mang po tshogs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mang po tshogs so //
translated: many buddhas and bodhisattvas gathered.🔽At that time, the lord of gods Maheśvara and his consort Umā had a retinue of twenty-one male messengers and twenty-one female messengers. They were Viṣṇu,

original: dus de'i tshe na lha dbang phyug chen po dang yum au ma drag po'i 'khor pho nyi shu rtsa gcig dang mo nyi shu rtsa gcig yod de de yang khyab 'jug dang / gzhon nu k'arti ka dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe na lha dbang phyug chen po dang yum au ma drag po'i 'khor pho nyi shu rtsa gcig dang mo nyi shu rtsa gcig yod de de yang khyab 'jug dang / gzhon nu k'arti ka dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang /
translated: Kumāra Kārttikeya, Brahmā, Indra,🔽and so on.

original: nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / spen pa dang / mig dmar dang / tshogs kyi bdag po dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / rgyal bar byed pa dang / nor sbyin dang / rlung lha dang / me lha dang / lus ngan po dang /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / spen pa dang / mig dmar dang / tshogs kyi bdag po dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / rgyal bar byed pa dang / nor sbyin dang / rlung lha dang / me lha dang / lus ngan po dang /
translated: Sun, moon, Saturn, Mars, Rāhu, Bṛhaspati, Śukra, Kubera, Vāyu, Agni, Virūpākṣa,

original: 'phags skyes po dang / gshin rje dang / tshogs bdag dang / chu lha dang / bhring+gi ri ti dang / dga' byed dbang phyug rnams ni pho 'khor @132a * //
analyzed: 'phags skyes po dang / gshin rje dang / tshogs bdag dang / chu lha dang / bhring+gi ri ti dang / dga' byed dbang phyug rnams ni pho 'khor @132a * //
translated: Virūḍhaka, Yama, Gaṇeśa, Varuṇa, Bhṛṅgiriṭi, and Īśvara are the male retinue.

original: ro ; / mo rnams ni au ma dang / rdo rje rgyal mo dang / drug ldan ma dang / tshangs ma dang / dbang mo dang / mi'am ci ma dang / ro hi ni dang / dbugs 'dzin ma dang / skye ba 'phrog ma dang /
analyzed: ro ; / mo rnams ni au ma dang / rdo rje rgyal mo dang / drug ldan ma dang / tshangs ma dang / dbang mo dang / mi'am ci ma dang / ro hi ni dang / dbugs 'dzin ma dang / skye ba 'phrog ma dang /
translated: The females are Umā, Vajrarājñī, Ṣaṇmukhi, Brahmāṇī, Vaiṣṇavī, Kinnarī, Rohiṇī, Marīcī, and Jayā.

original: gsod ma dang / zab mo dang / 'gro ma dang / dga' ma dang / zhi ba mo dang ; rlung gi mo dang / me ma mo dang / lus ngan mo dang / phag mo dang / tsa mundi dang / sna chen ma dang /🔽chu lha mo dang rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: gsod ma dang / zab mo dang / 'gro ma dang / dga' ma dang / zhi ba mo dang ; rlung gi mo dang / me ma mo dang / lus ngan mo dang / phag mo dang / tsa mundi dang / sna chen ma dang / chu lha mo dang rtsa gcig go //
translated: The eight classes of gods and demons, the twelve mothers such as Brahmaṇī, the seven mothers such as Bāriḍi, the five yakṣas such as Caṇḍa, the ten rākṣasīs such as Hārītī,

original: lha ma srin sde brgyad dang / tshangs ma la sogs pa ma mo bcu gnyis dang / bar chad ldan ma la sogs pa ma bdun dang / gtum po la sogs pa gnod sbyin lnga dang / srin mo 'phrog ma la sogs pa bcu dang /
analyzed: lha ma srin sde brgyad dang / tshangs ma la sogs pa ma mo bcu gnyis dang / bar chad ldan ma la sogs pa ma bdun dang / gtum po la sogs pa gnod sbyin lnga dang / srin mo 'phrog ma la sogs pa bcu dang /
translated: and the single goddess of the river.

original: 'phyang ma la sogs pa mo gnyis dang / der yang ma zad de'i nye 'khor ni ma mo bcu gnyis dang / ma rungs ma'i tshogs dang / 'phra men ma'i tshogs dang / rims bdag mo'i tshogs dang / ngan song gsum gyi tshogs kyi tshogs dang bcas pa rnams ri rab kyi byang shar mtshams na thod pa dgu brtsegs zhes bya ba'i pho brang na gnas nas /
analyzed: 'phyang ma la sogs pa mo gnyis dang / der yang ma zad de'i nye 'khor ni ma mo bcu gnyis dang / ma rungs ma'i tshogs dang / 'phra men ma'i tshogs dang / rims bdag mo'i tshogs dang / ngan song gsum gyi tshogs kyi tshogs dang bcas pa rnams ri rab kyi byang shar mtshams na thod pa dgu brtsegs zhes bya ba'i pho brang na gnas nas /
translated: They all reside in the palace called Nine-Storey Skull, in the northeast of Mount Meru.

original: zla dus khyad par can la kun tshogs shing sems can mang po gsod cing sbyin sreg byed /
analyzed: zla dus khyad par can la kun tshogs shing sems can mang po gsod cing sbyin sreg byed /
translated: On special days of the month, they all gather, kill many sentient beings, and perform burnt offerings.

original: lo thog la ser ba 'bebs /
analyzed: lo thog la ser ba 'bebs /
translated: They send hailstorms on the crops.

original: mi nad phyugs nad mang po gtong /
analyzed: mi nad phyugs nad mang po gtong /
translated: They send many human diseases and animal diseases.

original: su dge ba byed pa'i bar du gcod pa dang / ri rab klad la bskor ba /
analyzed: su dge ba byed pa'i bar du gcod pa dang / ri rab klad la bskor ba /
translated: They create obstacles for anyone who practices virtue, and they circle Mount Meru on their heads.🔽They gulp down the ocean in one swallow.

original: rgya mtsho hub kyis 'debs pa de lta bu zhe sdang chen po'i ru tra de lta bu yod do //
analyzed: rgya mtsho hub kyis 'debs pa de lta bu zhe sdang chen po'i ru tra de lta bu yod do //
translated: Such is the great wrathful Rudra.

original: dus de'i tshe sangs rgyas rnams 'dus nas 'phags pa 'jam dpal la gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe sangs rgyas rnams 'dus nas 'phags pa 'jam dpal la gsol ba btab pa /
translated: At that time, the buddhas gathered and made a request to Ārya Mañjuśrī:

original: zhi bas byang chub 'grub 'gyur yang //
analyzed: zhi bas byang chub 'grub 'gyur yang //
translated: “Although awakening is accomplished through peace,

original: yang dag byang chub thob byed pa //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub thob byed pa //
translated: in order to attain true awakening,

original: gtum po rnams ni gdul ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gtum po rnams ni gdul ba'i phyir //
translated: for the sake of taming the fierce ones,

original: rang rig drag po bskyed 'gyur mdzod //
analyzed: rang rig drag po bskyed 'gyur mdzod //
translated: generate the fierce one of self-awareness.”

original: ces zhus so //
analyzed: ces zhus so //
translated: Thus they requested.

original: lan du / byang chub yang dag thob byed pa'i //
analyzed: lan du / byang chub yang dag thob byed pa'i //
translated: In reply, [Mañjuśrī] said:

original: sems can 'di rnams snod min te //
analyzed: sems can 'di rnams snod min te //
translated: “These sentient beings are not vessels for🔽attaining true awakening,

original: nyon mongs rnams ni me ltar 'bar //
analyzed: nyon mongs rnams ni me ltar 'bar //
translated: as their afflictions blaze like fire.

original: nga yis gdul ba'i snod min no //
analyzed: nga yis gdul ba'i snod min no //
translated: They are not vessels to be tamed by me.”

original: zhes pas yang bka' stsal pa /🔽khyed ni dus gsum sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: zhes pas yang bka' stsal pa / khyed ni dus gsum sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: Thus he spoke.🔽“You are the heart-sons of the buddhas of the three times,

original: thugs kyi sras te gtso bo che //
analyzed: thugs kyi sras te gtso bo che //
translated: the great leaders,

original: gdug pa 'dul ba'i dpa' bo ste //
analyzed: gdug pa 'dul ba'i dpa' bo ste //
translated: the heroes who tame the fierce ones,

original: rang rig drag po bskyed du gsol //
analyzed: rang rig drag po bskyed du gsol //
translated: generate the fierce one of self-awareness.”

original: zhes zhus pas /
analyzed: zhes zhus pas /
translated: Thus they requested.

original: de nas rje btsun nyid kun du 'bar ba'i snying po khro gnyer @132b can smin ma bcum pa mche ba lhag ge phyung ba /
analyzed: de nas rje btsun nyid kun du 'bar ba'i snying po khro gnyer @132b can smin ma bcum pa mche ba lhag ge phyung ba /
translated: Then the venerable one, the essence of blazing light, with a frowning face, his eyebrows furrowed, his fangs bared,

original: shin tu gtsigs pa zhal dang phyag mtshan dang sku mdog sna tshogs par gyur nas /
analyzed: shin tu gtsigs pa zhal dang phyag mtshan dang sku mdog sna tshogs par gyur nas /
translated: They became very fierce, with various faces, hand implements, and colors.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma 'tshal lags so zer nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma 'tshal lags so zer nas /
translated: They said, “We do not know the tathāgatas.”

original: der sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa ma rungs pa mchis pa 'di thul gsungs nas /
analyzed: der sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa ma rungs pa mchis pa 'di thul gsungs nas /
translated: There the buddhas said, “Maheśvara and so on are here. Subdue them.”

original: de nas gzhung bzhin du ha ha la sogs pa'i sgras khro bo gnas nyi shu rtsa brgyad nas re re spro zhing bkug pas /
analyzed: de nas gzhung bzhin du ha ha la sogs pa'i sgras khro bo gnas nyi shu rtsa brgyad nas re re spro zhing bkug pas /
translated: Then, as in the text, with sounds such as “ha ha,” each of the wrathful ones was emanated from the twenty-eight abodes and summoned.

original: la la khang pa nas thon /
analyzed: la la khang pa nas thon /
translated: Some came out of the house.

original: la las bcom ldan 'das kyi khang pa'i rtsar phyin pa la sogs pa du ma byas /
analyzed: la las bcom ldan 'das kyi khang pa'i rtsar phyin pa la sogs pa du ma byas /
translated: Some went to the edge of the Bhagavān’s house.

original: de nas thugs ka nas khro bo me ltar 'bar ba phyung nas 'gugs su btang bas /
analyzed: de nas thugs ka nas khro bo me ltar 'bar ba phyung nas 'gugs su btang bas /
translated: Then, having emanated the wrathful Agni from his heart, he was sent to summon [the gods].

original: ma h'a de ba yab yum zhags pas bcings nas gshin rje gshed po'i zhabs g-yas pa'i 'og tu dbang phyug chen po bcug / g-yon pa'i 'og tu lha mo au ma gan rkyal du bcug go //
analyzed: ma h'a de ba yab yum zhags pas bcings nas gshin rje gshed po'i zhabs g-yas pa'i 'og tu dbang phyug chen po bcug / g-yon pa'i 'og tu lha mo au ma gan rkyal du bcug go //
translated: Having bound Maheśvara and his consort with a noose, he placed Maheśvara under the right foot of Yamāntaka and placed Umā, the goddess, on her back under the left foot.
