original: der 'khor thams cad la 'o dod mang po phyung nas 'jig rten gyi drag po thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du gnod pa sna tshogs byas pa las /
analyzed: der 'khor thams cad la 'o dod mang po phyung nas 'jig rten gyi drag po thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du gnod pa sna tshogs byas pa las /
translated: Then, all the retinue cried out in distress.  All the fierce ones of the world, having done various harms in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: nam mkha' la ral gri'i char phab nas kun shin tu bred nas 'dus so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ral gri'i char phab nas kun shin tu bred nas 'dus so //
translated: caused a rain of swords to fall from the sky.  All of them became extremely frightened and gathered together.

original: nye ba'i 'khor pho rnams 'khor gyi khro bo rnams kyi zhabs 'og tu bcug go //
analyzed: nye ba'i 'khor pho rnams 'khor gyi khro bo rnams kyi zhabs 'og tu bcug go //
translated: The male close retinue were placed under the feet of the wrathful ones in the retinue.

original: der shin tu bred a'a yu: zhes slar bslang nas khro bo rnams kyi zhabs kyis reg pas khyad par du gyur pa'i bde ba khyad par skyes so //
analyzed: der shin tu bred a'a yu: zhes slar bslang nas khro bo rnams kyi zhabs kyis reg pas khyad par du gyur pa'i bde ba khyad par skyes so //
translated: There, having been extremely frightened, they were raised up again with āyuḥ and touched by the feet of the wrathful ones, a special bliss was born.

original: de ltar lha chen po na re /
analyzed: de ltar lha chen po na re /
translated: In that way, the great god said:

original: ae ma sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
analyzed: ae ma sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
translated: Ema!  All buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas ye shes bla na med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes bla na med //
translated: the unsurpassed wisdom of the buddhas,

original: zhabs mthil gyis ni mnan nas ni //
analyzed: zhabs mthil gyis ni mnan nas ni //
translated: having been pressed down with the soles of the feet,

original: mya ngan 'das la rab bzhag nas //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la rab bzhag nas //
translated: having been placed in nirvana,

original: zer nas der lha chen po yab yum dam tshig la phog nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bstan nas chos skyong srung mar dam bcas so //🔽der ma rungs pa'i tshogs rnams khro bo'i tshogs kyis sgra ha ha zhes pas btul lo //🔽'phra men gyi tshogs rnams hi hi zhes pas btul lo //
analyzed: zer nas der lha chen po yab yum dam tshig la phog nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bstan nas chos skyong srung mar dam bcas so // der ma rungs pa'i tshogs rnams khro bo'i tshogs kyis sgra ha ha zhes pas btul lo // 'phra men gyi tshogs rnams hi hi zhes pas btul lo //
translated: The great gods, father and mother, were offended by the samaya, and so the Buddha taught them to go for refuge to the Three Jewels, and they were bound under oath to be protectors of the Dharma.🔽The Buddha subdued the unruly hordes with the sound of ha ha of the wrathful assembly.🔽He subdued the hordes of rakshasas with the sound of hi hi.

original: ngan song rnams rdo rje gad mos btul lo //
analyzed: ngan song rnams rdo rje gad mos btul lo //
translated: He subdued the lower realms with the sound of ha ha.

original: de rnams la dam tshig dang sdom pa phog pas bdag cag rnams zas skal med pas nged rnams 'chi na zer nas /🔽sgrub pa po rnams kyis gtor ma dang dkyil 'khor ster zer za ba dang / dam tshig nyams pa dang bstan pa 'jig pa'i snying khrag @133a * //
analyzed: de rnams la dam tshig dang sdom pa phog pas bdag cag rnams zas skal med pas nged rnams 'chi na zer nas / sgrub pa po rnams kyis gtor ma dang dkyil 'khor ster zer za ba dang / dam tshig nyams pa dang bstan pa 'jig pa'i snying khrag @133a * //
translated: They said, We have no share of food, and so we will die.🔽The practitioners said, We will give you torma and mandala, and they ate them.

original: dron mo sbyin par bya ste dam bcas so //
analyzed: dron mo sbyin par bya ste dam bcas so //
translated: The Buddha said, I will give you the warm blood of your heart, which is the samaya of breaking the teachings.

original: rje btsun gyi yon tan bshad pa nas /
analyzed: rje btsun gyi yon tan bshad pa nas /
translated: The Buddha explained the qualities of the Jetsun, and so forth.

original: mar 'jig rten pa brgya lnga bcu dang / nyi shu rtsa lnga kun de ru dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: mar 'jig rten pa brgya lnga bcu dang / nyi shu rtsa lnga kun de ru dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: The worldly beings who were there, one hundred and fifty-two, all took the vow.

original: de tsam gyi rnam par 'phrul pa mdzad pa su yin zhe na /
analyzed: de tsam gyi rnam par 'phrul pa mdzad pa su yin zhe na /
translated: Who was it that performed such a miracle?

original: 'jam pa'i dbyangs nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dbyangs nyid yin no //
translated: It was Mañjuśrī himself.

original: dus der ha ha dang hi hi dang sgra drag po'i h'um rnams phul /
analyzed: dus der ha ha dang hi hi dang sgra drag po'i h'um rnams phul /
translated: At that time, he uttered “ha ha” and “hi hi” and the loud sound of “hūṃ.”

original: ri rab steng du mdzad pa de bzhin du khams gsum dus gcig tu khyab po //
analyzed: ri rab steng du mdzad pa de bzhin du khams gsum dus gcig tu khyab po //
translated: Just as he did this on top of Mount Meru, he pervaded the three realms all at once.

original: der ma zad nam mkhas gar khyab pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam 'phrul dang drag po h'um sgra dus gcig tu mdzad do //
analyzed: der ma zad nam mkhas gar khyab pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam 'phrul dang drag po h'um sgra dus gcig tu mdzad do //
translated: Not only that, he performed the miracle and the loud sound of “hūṃ” simultaneously in all the worlds that are pervaded by space.

original: des na rje btsun 'jam dpal /
analyzed: des na rje btsun 'jam dpal /
translated: Therefore, the venerable Mañjuśrī

original: sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog / ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog / ces bya'o //
translated: is called “the supreme among those endowed with sound.”

original: sngon shar phyogs bde ba can na sangs rgyas 'od kyi tog 'khor mang po la chos ston pa'i sar /
analyzed: sngon shar phyogs bde ba can na sangs rgyas 'od kyi tog 'khor mang po la chos ston pa'i sar /
translated: In the past, in the eastern buddha field of Sukhāvatī, when the Buddha Prabhāsottama was teaching the Dharma to a large retinue,

original: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong phrag mang po dang lha'i bu mang po phyir 'brangs nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' brgya stong phrag mang po dang lha'i bu mang po phyir 'brangs nas /
translated: Manjushri, with many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas and many sons of the gods following behind,

original: 'jam dpal gyis 'od gsal ba'i sgras stong gsum bkang nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis 'od gsal ba'i sgras stong gsum bkang nas /
translated: filled the trichiliocosm with the sound of his clear voice.

original: bdud sba bkong ba yin pa sangs rgyas de'i 'khor nyan thos yo rlung dmar gyis khyer ba ltar 'gyel lo //
analyzed: bdud sba bkong ba yin pa sangs rgyas de'i 'khor nyan thos yo rlung dmar gyis khyer ba ltar 'gyel lo //
translated: The demons were terrified, and the shravaka retinue of that buddha fell down like a great red wind had swept over them.

original: der sangs rgyas de la zhus pas /
analyzed: der sangs rgyas de la zhus pas /
translated: They asked that buddha, “What is this?”

original: 'di ni 'jam dpal bdud sba bkong ba'i sgra yin gsungs /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jam dpal bdud sba bkong ba'i sgra yin gsungs /
translated: “This is the sound of Manjushri terrifying the demons,” he said.

original: der nged cag blta zer nas chos zhus so //
analyzed: der nged cag blta zer nas chos zhus so //
translated: “We want to see him,” they said, and they requested teachings.

original: des na yang sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: des na yang sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: Therefore, he is also supreme among those who possess sound.

original: la la dag na re keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: la la dag na re keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa'i skabs su /
translated: Some say that when he was a skeleton with bared fangs,

original: sngon mi cig rgya mtsho'i 'gram du phyin pas bud med nag mo cig gis ded nas der chad nas yod pa las khos mi'i 'gram rus cig rnyed nas lag tu blangs pa tsam gyis bud med de skad ngan dang bcas te bros so //
analyzed: sngon mi cig rgya mtsho'i 'gram du phyin pas bud med nag mo cig gis ded nas der chad nas yod pa las khos mi'i 'gram rus cig rnyed nas lag tu blangs pa tsam gyis bud med de skad ngan dang bcas te bros so //
translated: in the past a man went to the shore of the ocean. A black woman led him there and they had sex. He found a human skull and as soon as he picked it up, the woman let out a terrible scream and ran away.

original: der ded pas phug cig tu bros so //
analyzed: der ded pas phug cig tu bros so //
translated: The demoness pursued him, but he escaped into a cave.🔽When he got there, he found five hundred demonesses.

original: der phyin pas srin mo'i bu lnga brgya 'dug ste yo bred nas da khyod ci zer nyan zer nas /
analyzed: der phyin pas srin mo'i bu lnga brgya 'dug ste yo bred nas da khyod ci zer nyan zer nas /
translated: He asked them, “What are you afraid of?”

original: der khyed cag ci la bred byas pas lag na mi'i rus pa de la gri mang po thogs pa 'dug zer nas /
analyzed: der khyed cag ci la bred byas pas lag na mi'i rus pa de la gri mang po thogs pa 'dug zer nas /
translated: They said, “There is a man with a human bone in his hand, and he has many knives.”

original: der mi des khyed cag ma smad kyang da phyin cad mi ma gsod byas nas /
analyzed: der mi des khyed cag ma smad kyang da phyin cad mi ma gsod byas nas /
translated: The man said, “I will not kill any more of you.

original: der drang srong mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa la dris pas /
analyzed: der drang srong mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa la dris pas /
translated: ” He asked a sage who had the supernormal cognitive powers,

original: 'di sngon 'jam dpal 'don pa'i mi cig gi 'gram rus yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di sngon 'jam dpal 'don pa'i mi cig gi 'gram rus yin gyi /
translated: “This is the skull of a man who recited Mañjuśrī in the past.🔽If you make an object of worship out of it and recite Mañjuśrī, you will attain spiritual powers.”

original: 'di la mchod gnas kyis la 'jam dpal thon dang dngos grub thob kyis zer nas de ltar @133b byas pas thob po //
analyzed: 'di la mchod gnas kyis la 'jam dpal thon dang dngos grub thob kyis zer nas de ltar @133b byas pas thob po //
translated: He did as he was told and attained spiritual powers.

original: yang 'di ni 'jam dpal bsgom par 'thad do //
analyzed: yang 'di ni 'jam dpal bsgom par 'thad do //
translated: This is also suitable for meditating on Mañjuśrī.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa po la /
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa po la /
translated: For those with bared fangs,

original: sngon mi tshon po cig yod pa la yul de na mkha' 'gro ma bdun yod pas gcig btang nas sang nub khyod la za res 'bab pas nged cag 'od ngo zer nas song ngo //
analyzed: sngon mi tshon po cig yod pa la yul de na mkha' 'gro ma bdun yod pas gcig btang nas sang nub khyod la za res 'bab pas nged cag 'od ngo zer nas song ngo //
translated: Once there was a man who was very dark. In that country there were seven dakinis. One of them said to him, Tomorrow night it will be my turn to eat you. We are the ones who make the light. And she left.

original: der mi des lung ba cig na yar bros nas phug cig tu yibs snyam nas phyin pas /
analyzed: der mi des lung ba cig na yar bros nas phug cig tu yibs snyam nas phyin pas /
translated: The man thought, I will escape to a valley and hide in a cave. He went there.

original: thod pa so rtseg ge ba cig 'dug te phang du thogs nas 'dug pas /
analyzed: thod pa so rtseg ge ba cig 'dug te phang du thogs nas 'dug pas /
translated: There was a skull with sharp teeth. He picked it up and held it in his lap.

original: mkha' 'gro mas rjes chod nas byung bas thod pa mthong bas gan cing bub cing bros te /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro mas rjes chod nas byung bas thod pa mthong bas gan cing bub cing bros te /
translated: The dakinis caught up with him. When they saw the skull, they were frightened and ran away.

original: khos ded / da ci zer ba nyan zer /
analyzed: khos ded / da ci zer ba nyan zer /
translated: The man chased them and said, What is this? Tell me!🔽Where are you running?

original: ci la 'bros byas pas thod pa'i so par na tshur khro bo kha gdangs pa mang po 'dug zer /
analyzed: ci la 'bros byas pas thod pa'i so par na tshur khro bo kha gdangs pa mang po 'dug zer /
translated: There are many wrathful ones with bared fangs inside the skull.

original: der mkha' 'gro ma bdun po kho'i grogs su bcas so //
analyzed: der mkha' 'gro ma bdun po kho'i grogs su bcas so //
translated: The seven dakinis became his companions.

original: der drang srong mngon par shes pa la dris pas /
analyzed: der drang srong mngon par shes pa la dris pas /
translated: He asked a rishi with supernormal powers, What is this skull?

original: 'di 'jam dpal sgom pa cig phung po bor nas sangs rgyas pa'i mgo bo yin pas de sgrubs dang 'jam dpal zhal mthong ngo zer ro //
analyzed: 'di 'jam dpal sgom pa cig phung po bor nas sangs rgyas pa'i mgo bo yin pas de sgrubs dang 'jam dpal zhal mthong ngo zer ro //
translated: This is the head of the one who has cast off the aggregates and become enlightened through meditating on Manjushri. If you practice it, you will see Manjushri's face.

original: de ni sngon byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni sngon byung ngo //
translated: That is the past.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal khro bos sdug bsngal gcod pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal khro bos sdug bsngal gcod pa'i yon tan bstan pa'o /
translated: It is the teaching of the qualities of the noble Manjushri Yamantaka that cuts through suffering.

original: // / da ni rje btsun 'jam dpal de nyid so sor rtog pa'i ye shes de 'jam dpal rnon po'i skur bstan pa ni /
analyzed: // / da ni rje btsun 'jam dpal de nyid so sor rtog pa'i ye shes de 'jam dpal rnon po'i skur bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, the very same venerable Manjushri is taught to be the wisdom of discernment, appearing in the form of Manjushri Sharp.

original: gdul bya 'dod chags can gdul ba'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs dang yon tan dang phrin las kyi khyad par gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gdul bya 'dod chags can gdul ba'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs dang yon tan dang phrin las kyi khyad par gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to tame those to be tamed who have desire, the distinctions of body, speech, mind, qualities, and activity are taught.

original: yang dag bdag med ces pa nas 'od 'bar gsal zhes pas ston te /
analyzed: yang dag bdag med ces pa nas 'od 'bar gsal zhes pas ston te /
translated: This is shown by the true absence of self up to radiating blazing light.

original: de la so sor rtog pa'i ngo bo gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la so sor rtog pa'i ngo bo gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of discernment?

original: yang dag pa'i bdag rnam pa gnyis kyis stong pa'i de bzhin nyid de glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i shes pa ma 'dres pa rang gsal ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bdag rnam pa gnyis kyis stong pa'i de bzhin nyid de glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i shes pa ma 'dres pa rang gsal ba'o //
translated: It is suchness, empty of the two kinds of true self, the unmixed, self-luminous consciousness free from adventitious stains.

original: de lta bu de gzhan la ji ltar ston zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu de gzhan la ji ltar ston zhe na /
translated: How is such a state to be shown to others?

original: stong nyid ces pa nas mya ngan 'das pa po zhes pas ston te /
analyzed: stong nyid ces pa nas mya ngan 'das pa po zhes pas ston te /
translated: The passage from “emptiness” to “one who has attained nirvana” shows this.

original: sngon rje btsun 'jam dpal rgyal po'i pho brang 'od 'phro can na bzhugs pa'i dus su byang chub sems dpa' bzhin bzangs la sogs pa zab cing rgya che ba'i chos stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo zhur 'ongs pas /🔽phyogs kun nas kun du btsal bas thang chad nas yi mug ste ma mthong nas ston pa sh'akya thub pa la zhus pas rje btsun gyi yon tan mang du bshad nas khyed rnams rje btsun la @134a * //
analyzed: sngon rje btsun 'jam dpal rgyal po'i pho brang 'od 'phro can na bzhugs pa'i dus su byang chub sems dpa' bzhin bzangs la sogs pa zab cing rgya che ba'i chos stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo zhur 'ongs pas / phyogs kun nas kun du btsal bas thang chad nas yi mug ste ma mthong nas ston pa sh'akya thub pa la zhus pas rje btsun gyi yon tan mang du bshad nas khyed rnams rje btsun la @134a * //
translated: In the past, when the venerable Manjushri was dwelling in the palace of the king of the gods, the light-maker, the bodhisattvas Subhadra and others came to request the profound and extensive teachings on the nature of emptiness.

original: phyag 'tshol la gsol ba thob dang byin rlabs 'char gsungs nas /
analyzed: phyag 'tshol la gsol ba thob dang byin rlabs 'char gsungs nas /
translated: They searched everywhere, but became exhausted and discouraged and did not see him. When they asked teacher Shakyamuni, he spoke at length about the venerable Manjushri’s good qualities and said, “You should pay homage to the venerable Manjushri and make supplications to him. Blessings will arise.”

original: der byang chub sems dpa' bzhin bzangs kyis grogs po rnams la de ltar slob nas /
analyzed: der byang chub sems dpa' bzhin bzangs kyis grogs po rnams la de ltar slob nas /
translated: So the bodhisattva Subhadra taught his friends to do this.

original: kun gyis de ltar byas pa dang ma mthong nas yang sh'akya thub pa la zhus pas /
analyzed: kun gyis de ltar byas pa dang ma mthong nas yang sh'akya thub pa la zhus pas /
translated: Everyone did as he had been told, but still they could not see him. They asked Shakyamuni again.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du zhog gsungs nas bzhin bzangs kyis thams cad mnyam pa nyid du sems zhog dang yon tan mthong ngo zer nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du zhog gsungs nas bzhin bzangs kyis thams cad mnyam pa nyid du sems zhog dang yon tan mthong ngo zer nas /
translated: “ Place all phenomena in their equality,” he said. “ Good sirs, if you place all phenomena in their equality, you will see his good qualities.”

original: de ltar byas pas zhag bdun gyi nang par rje btsun padma'i steng na sku gser gyi gtan pa phyis pa bzhin du bzhugs pa mthong ma thag tu sku las 'od zer byung ste 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bkang ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas zhag bdun gyi nang par rje btsun padma'i steng na sku gser gyi gtan pa phyis pa bzhin du bzhugs pa mthong ma thag tu sku las 'od zer byung ste 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bkang ste /
translated: They did as they had been told, and on the morning of the seventh day they saw the venerable one sitting on a lotus, his body shining like polished gold. As soon as they saw him, light rays came out of his body and filled the entire world.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa la mdzad pa bcu gnyis la sogs pa so so'i rnam par thar pa bstan nas bzhugs pa'i dus su nam mkha' las me tog la sogs pa'i char byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa la mdzad pa bcu gnyis la sogs pa so so'i rnam par thar pa bstan nas bzhugs pa'i dus su nam mkha' las me tog la sogs pa'i char byung ngo //
translated: The buddhas, bodhisattvas, shravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so forth, were revealed in their individual biographies, such as the twelve deeds. When they were all sitting there, a rain of flowers and so forth fell from the sky.

original: dus der zab cing rgya che ba'i chos phyogs bcu thams cad du nye ring med par chos kyi dud bus /
analyzed: dus der zab cing rgya che ba'i chos phyogs bcu thams cad du nye ring med par chos kyi dud bus /
translated: At that time, with the smoke of the Dharma, which is profound and vast, without partiality in the ten directions,

original: gand'i dang chos kyi rnga brdungs nas kun thar pa la bkod pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rje btsun khyod yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gand'i dang chos kyi rnga brdungs nas kun thar pa la bkod pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rje btsun khyod yin zhes pa'o //
translated: having beaten the drum of the Dharma, he established all beings in liberation. Therefore, he is the non-abiding nirvana, the exalted one.🔽What is his body like?

original: sku ji lta bu zhe na chos sku gzugs med las /
analyzed: sku ji lta bu zhe na chos sku gzugs med las /
translated: The dharmakaya is formless.

original: longs sku gzugs bzangs mtshan dpes brgyan pa /
analyzed: longs sku gzugs bzangs mtshan dpes brgyan pa /
translated: The sambhogakaya is well-formed, adorned with the marks and signs.

original: sprul sku cir yang ston pas na /
analyzed: sprul sku cir yang ston pas na /
translated: The nirmanakaya manifests in any way.

original: gzugs med nas snang ba'i dpal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med nas snang ba'i dpal zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the glory that appears from the formless realm.

original: 'o na mi dogs sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi dogs sam zhe na /
translated: Well then, is he not doubted?

original: gzugs rnams ma lus 'chang ba po //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma lus 'chang ba po //
translated: He is the one who holds all forms without exception.

original: zhes pa rje btsun gyis sems sgyu ma lta bur shes /
analyzed: zhes pa rje btsun gyis sems sgyu ma lta bur shes /
translated: The exalted one knows the mind to be like an illusion.

original: 'jig rten rmi lam lta bur shes /
analyzed: 'jig rten rmi lam lta bur shes /
translated: He knows the world to be like a dream.

original: smon lam dang sangs rgyas ni mig yor lta bur shes /
analyzed: smon lam dang sangs rgyas ni mig yor lta bur shes /
translated: He knows aspirations and buddhas to be like optical illusions.

original: chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur shes /
analyzed: chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur shes /
translated: He knows all phenomena to be like emanations.

original: tshig thams cad brag ca lta bur shes /
analyzed: tshig thams cad brag ca lta bur shes /
translated: He knows all words to be like echoes.

original: skye shi thams cad 'khrul 'khor du 'du shes /
analyzed: skye shi thams cad 'khrul 'khor du 'du shes /
translated: He understood that all birth and death is included in the wheel of life.

original: snang srid thams cad dri za'i grong khyer du 'du shes /
analyzed: snang srid thams cad dri za'i grong khyer du 'du shes /
translated: He understood that all of phenomenal existence is included in the city of the gandharvas.

original: de ltar rtogs nas cis kyang mi tshugs pas na /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs nas cis kyang mi tshugs pas na /
translated: Having realized this, he was unassailable by anything.🔽He was known as the great one who cannot be assailed.

original: tshugs pa med cing che bar grags pa ste sngon rje btsun byang chub shing drung na bzhugs pa'i dus su /
analyzed: tshugs pa med cing che bar grags pa ste sngon rje btsun byang chub shing drung na bzhugs pa'i dus su /
translated: Once, when the Jetsun was staying at the foot of a tree,

original: bdud sdig to can shin tu 'jigs pa mang mos nam mkha' la thog la sogs pa dang / la las ri la sogs pa mdung dang / shakti dang sna tshogs pa brdeg pa la /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can shin tu 'jigs pa mang mos nam mkha' la thog la sogs pa dang / la las ri la sogs pa mdung dang / shakti dang sna tshogs pa brdeg pa la /
translated: many terrifying demons appeared in the sky, some throwing lightning bolts, some throwing mountains, and some throwing spears and saktis.

original: rje btsun gyi ba spu las 'od zer byung bas bdud @134b rnams la phog pas shin tu brgyal nas sa la 'gyel lo //
analyzed: rje btsun gyi ba spu las 'od zer byung bas bdud @134b rnams la phog pas shin tu brgyal nas sa la 'gyel lo //
translated: Light rays came from the pores of the Jetsun’s body and struck the demons, causing them to faint and fall to the ground.

original: der skyabs btsal bas kun thar pa la bkod do //
analyzed: der skyabs btsal bas kun thar pa la bkod do //
translated: When they sought refuge, he placed them all in liberation.

original: des na 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas pa dang dam pa'i chos dar ba'i rtse mo yin pas tog go //
analyzed: des na 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas pa dang dam pa'i chos dar ba'i rtse mo yin pas tog go //
translated: Since he was on the very high noble path and was the pinnacle of the spread of the genuine dharma, he was the crest jewel.

original: 'o na 'gro don mdzad sku dngos gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'gro don mdzad sku dngos gang yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the actual body that performs benefit for beings?

original: 'jig rten gsum na mdzes pa ste sku gzhon pa dang rgan pas 'jigs pas ci yang ston to /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na mdzes pa ste sku gzhon pa dang rgan pas 'jigs pas ci yang ston to /
translated: The youth and the aged are frightened by the beauty of the three worlds, and so he shows himself in any way whatsoever.

original: sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mdzes //
analyzed: sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mdzes //
translated: Beautiful, he is the ornament of the three worlds.

original: zhes pa sngon lho phyogs gyad yul na sdig spyod kyi rgyal po dpal sbyin bya ba mtshams med pa lnga'i las byed pa sus kyang ma thul ba cig yod /
analyzed: zhes pa sngon lho phyogs gyad yul na sdig spyod kyi rgyal po dpal sbyin bya ba mtshams med pa lnga'i las byed pa sus kyang ma thul ba cig yod /
translated: In the past, in the land of the southern barbarians, there was a king called Paljin who was a sinner. He committed the five heinous acts and no one could subdue him.

original: de la bu mo mdzes pa cig yod pa la khyim thab tu rung ba ma rnyed pas rje btsun gyi sku blta bas chog mi shes pa de bu mo'i gam du phyin pas /
analyzed: de la bu mo mdzes pa cig yod pa la khyim thab tu rung ba ma rnyed pas rje btsun gyi sku blta bas chog mi shes pa de bu mo'i gam du phyin pas /
translated: He had a beautiful daughter, but he could not find a suitable husband for her. The Jetsun's form, which is so pleasing to behold, went to the side of the daughter.

original: bu mos mthong nas rje btsun la mig mi 'dzums par blta'o //
analyzed: bu mos mthong nas rje btsun la mig mi 'dzums par blta'o //
translated: When the daughter saw him, she looked at the Jetsun with unblinking eyes.

original: der rje btsun gyis khyod ci la lta gsungs pas /
analyzed: der rje btsun gyis khyod ci la lta gsungs pas /
translated: Then the Jetsun said, What are you looking at?

original: nga khyed la khyim thab tu re zer /
analyzed: nga khyed la khyim thab tu re zer /
translated: She said, I want you to be my husband.

original: rje btsun gyis bu mo khyod gzhan gyi dbang du ma bzung na nga mi 'dod gsungs pas /
analyzed: rje btsun gyis bu mo khyod gzhan gyi dbang du ma bzung na nga mi 'dod gsungs pas /
translated: The Jetsun said, If you are not taken over by others, I do not want you.

original: nga'i khyim thab tu rung ba'i khyo ga med pas nga la bdag po med zer nas /
analyzed: nga'i khyim thab tu rung ba'i khyo ga med pas nga la bdag po med zer nas /
translated: I have no husband suitable to be my spouse, so I am without a master.

original: 'o na ngas smras pa'i tshig 'di nyan nam gsungs pas /
analyzed: 'o na ngas smras pa'i tshig 'di nyan nam gsungs pas /
translated: Then, Will you listen to the words I say?

original: ci gsungs nyan zer nas /
analyzed: ci gsungs nyan zer nas /
translated: I will listen to whatever you say.

original: 'o na bu mo'i pha rgyal po dpa' byin nang par nga'i gam du sdom pa 'dzin nus sam byas pas /
analyzed: 'o na bu mo'i pha rgyal po dpa' byin nang par nga'i gam du sdom pa 'dzin nus sam byas pas /
translated: Then, Can the father of the girl, King Vīradatta, take vows in my presence tomorrow?

original: ngas yab la zhu ba dbul gyis zer nas der zhu ba phul bas ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: ngas yab la zhu ba dbul gyis zer nas der zhu ba phul bas ma gnang ngo //
translated: I will request my father. Saying that, she made the request, but he did not permit it.

original: bu mos lceb tshul bstan pas yab kyis gnang nas /
analyzed: bu mos lceb tshul bstan pas yab kyis gnang nas /
translated: The girl demonstrated a method of suicide, and her father permitted it.

original: der yab dam pa'i chos la bkod do //
analyzed: der yab dam pa'i chos la bkod do //
translated: There, she established her father in the true Dharma.

original: bu mo la rje btsun ci 'dra pa cig sprul nas bzhag pas sras gsum byung zhing ma sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bu mo la rje btsun ci 'dra pa cig sprul nas bzhag pas sras gsum byung zhing ma sangs rgyas so //
translated: She emanated an image of the venerable one and placed it there, and three sons were born to her, and she attained buddhahood.

original: la las dus shes sems can dbang po shes kyi skabs su sbyor ba snang ngo //
analyzed: la las dus shes sems can dbang po shes kyi skabs su sbyor ba snang ngo //
translated: Some apply this to the section on knowing the time and knowing the faculties of sentient beings.

original: 'gro don ji ltar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'gro don ji ltar mdzad ce na /
translated: How does she benefit beings?

original: 'jig rten shes legs nas zhi byed pa zhes pas bstan no //
analyzed: 'jig rten shes legs nas zhi byed pa zhes pas bstan no //
translated: This is shown by knowing the world well up to pacifying.

original: 'khor 'das sgyu ma lta bur zhes pas skyon gang gis nga mi 'jigs /
analyzed: 'khor 'das sgyu ma lta bur zhes pas skyon gang gis nga mi 'jigs /
translated: Since it says samsara and nirvana are like an illusion, what is the fault that I am not afraid of?

original: 'gro ba kun la phan 'dogs shing zad mi shes kyis ma rig pa'i ye shes sgo nga lta bu 'byed de nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la phan 'dogs shing zad mi shes kyis ma rig pa'i ye shes sgo nga lta bu 'byed de nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ngo //
translated: Since it benefits all beings and is inexhaustible, it opens the egg of the ignorance of pristine consciousness and abandons all afflictions.🔽 In this regard, previously the Bhagavat was in the palace called Jewel Lamp of the king called Virtue.

original: 'di la rje btsun sngon rgyal po dge ba zhes bya ba'i pho brang rin chen sgron zhes bya ba na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi @135a * //
analyzed: 'di la rje btsun sngon rgyal po dge ba zhes bya ba'i pho brang rin chen sgron zhes bya ba na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi @135a * //
translated: He was the cakravartin king called the Sound of the Proclamation of the Banner of the Roar of All Dharmas.

original: dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrogs pa'i sgra dbyangs zhes bya ba de la btsun mo stong phrag bcu yod /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrogs pa'i sgra dbyangs zhes bya ba de la btsun mo stong phrag bcu yod /
translated: He had ten thousand queens.

original: sras stong phrag bdun yod /
analyzed: sras stong phrag bdun yod /
translated: He had seven thousand sons.

original: blon po lnga brgya yod /
analyzed: blon po lnga brgya yod /
translated: He had five hundred ministers.

original: kun kyang ma rmos pa'i lo tog za /
analyzed: kun kyang ma rmos pa'i lo tog za /
translated: All of them ate the harvest of the unploughed fields.

original: kun kyang dam pa'i chos spyod pa sha stag go //
analyzed: kun kyang dam pa'i chos spyod pa sha stag go //
translated: All of them practiced the sublime dharma.

original: de'i tshe smad la bskal pa bar ma zad du nye ba na snyigs ma lnga'i dus la bab /
analyzed: de'i tshe smad la bskal pa bar ma zad du nye ba na snyigs ma lnga'i dus la bab /
translated: At that time, when the end of the intermediate eon was near, the time of the five degenerations arrived.

original: mi dge ba bcu byung sems can la nyes pa sna tshogs pa byung /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu byung sems can la nyes pa sna tshogs pa byung /
translated: The ten nonvirtues arose, and sentient beings suffered all kinds of harm.

original: ltogs pa skom pa 'khyags pa gcig la gcig gsod pa byung nas kun 'o dod 'bod cho nges 'debs shing rgyal po'i sar tshogs so //
analyzed: ltogs pa skom pa 'khyags pa gcig la gcig gsod pa byung nas kun 'o dod 'bod cho nges 'debs shing rgyal po'i sar tshogs so //
translated: They became hungry, thirsty, and cold, and they killed one another. They all cried out in distress and went to the king for help.

original: der kun rgyal po chen po bdag la mgon dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen med pas mgon skyabs dang dpung gnyen zhu 'tshal zer ro //
analyzed: der kun rgyal po chen po bdag la mgon dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen med pas mgon skyabs dang dpung gnyen zhu 'tshal zer ro //
translated: They all said, “Great king, we have no protector, refuge, or ally. We ask you to be our protector, refuge, and ally.”

original: rgyal pos pho brang rtse nas gzigs pas shin tu snying rje bar 'dug nas bshums so //
analyzed: rgyal pos pho brang rtse nas gzigs pas shin tu snying rje bar 'dug nas bshums so //
translated: The king looked out from the top of the palace and saw that it was very sad. He wept.

original: der nang du log nas snying rje'i sems bcu bskyed nas phyi sgor phyin nas /
analyzed: der nang du log nas snying rje'i sems bcu bskyed nas phyi sgor phyin nas /
translated: Then he went inside, generated ten thoughts of compassion, and went out to the front gate.

original: rnga bo che bsgrags nas thams cad 'dus shig byas nas ci dang ci 'dod pa la sbyin pa rgya chen po btang ngo //
analyzed: rnga bo che bsgrags nas thams cad 'dus shig byas nas ci dang ci 'dod pa la sbyin pa rgya chen po btang ngo //
translated: He beat the great drum and said, “Everyone, gather!” He gave away vast gifts to all those who had needs.

original: mthar bu dang chung ma dang yul 'khor btang /
analyzed: mthar bu dang chung ma dang yul 'khor btang /
translated: In the end, he gave away his children, wife, and kingdom.

original: de nas mgo dang rkang lag dang / sha khrag la sogs pa kun btang nas mthar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las pha rol phyin no //
analyzed: de nas mgo dang rkang lag dang / sha khrag la sogs pa kun btang nas mthar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las pha rol phyin no //
translated: Then, having given away his head, legs, arms, flesh, blood, and so on, he finally attained complete and perfect enlightenment, and crossed over the swamp of cyclic existence.

original: dbu la ye shes lnga'i rtags rgyal ba rigs lnga'i dbu rgyan byung bas /
analyzed: dbu la ye shes lnga'i rtags rgyal ba rigs lnga'i dbu rgyan byung bas /
translated: On his head appeared the crown of the five buddha families, the sign of the five gnoses.

original: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan can //
analyzed: ye shes dbang bskur cod pan can //
translated: He is the one with the diadem of the gnosis empowerment.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan du thogs //🔽zhes pas so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan du thogs // zhes pas so //
translated: The perfect Buddha is adorned with the crest.

original: 'du byed la sogs sdug bsngal gsum zhi nas de sel ba'i gnyen po 'gog pa'i lam mtha' yas pa'i theg pa gsum thob po //
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs sdug bsngal gsum zhi nas de sel ba'i gnyen po 'gog pa'i lam mtha' yas pa'i theg pa gsum thob po //
translated: Having pacified the three sufferings of conditioned existence and so on, he attained the three vehicles of the limitless path of cessation, the antidote that removes them.

original: des na sgrib pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs nas phyogs ris med pa nam mkha' ltar gnas so //
analyzed: des na sgrib pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs nas phyogs ris med pa nam mkha' ltar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned the afflictions and so on, he abides like space, without partiality.

original: de bas na nyon mongs dri ma kun las 'das nas dus gsum dbyer med du rtogs so //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs dri ma kun las 'das nas dus gsum dbyer med du rtogs so //
translated: Thus, having transcended all the stains of afflictions, he realizes the inseparability of the three times.

original: des na kun gyi nang na gtso bo che ba'i yon tan thams cad kyi nang na che bas yon tan thod do //
analyzed: des na kun gyi nang na gtso bo che ba'i yon tan thams cad kyi nang na che bas yon tan thod do //
translated: Therefore, it is the most important of all, and among all the great qualities, it is the greatest.

original: sku de ni 'gro ba'i rigs gang gis lus las 'das pa ste 'ja' tshon lta bu skye shi med pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sku de ni 'gro ba'i rigs gang gis lus las 'das pa ste 'ja' tshon lta bu skye shi med pa'i sku'o //
translated: This body is beyond the body of any type of migrating being, and is a body of non-birth and non-death, like a rainbow.

original: nam mkha'i lam la rab gnas pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i lam la rab gnas pa //
translated: Abiding in the path of space,

original: zhes pa don dam du chos kun nam mkha' ltar rtogs kyang kun rdzob tu tshong dpon gyi bus 'jam @135b dpal tshol du 'ongs pas /
analyzed: zhes pa don dam du chos kun nam mkha' ltar rtogs kyang kun rdzob tu tshong dpon gyi bus 'jam @135b dpal tshol du 'ongs pas /
translated: Although ultimately all phenomena are realized to be like space, conventionally, the son of the merchant set out to search for Manjushri.

original: nam mkha' la padma'i sdong po mang po'i steng na skyil mo krung bcas nas lha dang lha mo mang pos bskor nas phyag dang mchod pa byed pa mthong nas gdams ngag zhus so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la padma'i sdong po mang po'i steng na skyil mo krung bcas nas lha dang lha mo mang pos bskor nas phyag dang mchod pa byed pa mthong nas gdams ngag zhus so //
translated: He saw him sitting in the lotus posture on many lotus stems in the sky, surrounded by many gods and goddesses, making prostrations and offerings. He requested instructions.

original: yid bzhin nor bu chen pos sems can gyi bsam pa bsgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu chen pos sems can gyi bsam pa bsgrub pa yin la /
translated: The great wish-fulfilling jewel fulfills the wishes of sentient beings.

original: chen po ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: chen po ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mnga' ba'o //
translated: Great refers to mastery of perfect enlightenment.

original: thugs rje la phyogs med pa'i rin po che sna bdun gyi nang na mchog go //
analyzed: thugs rje la phyogs med pa'i rin po che sna bdun gyi nang na mchog go //
translated: Compassion is the supreme one among the seven precious substances, since it is impartial.

original: dpag bsam shing chen rgyas pa ste ni sngon bskal ba gong ma'i dus su mu ge'i bskal pa byung nas kun 'chi la thug pas /
analyzed: dpag bsam shing chen rgyas pa ste ni sngon bskal ba gong ma'i dus su mu ge'i bskal pa byung nas kun 'chi la thug pas /
translated: The great wish-fulfilling tree is extensive: in the past, during a former eon, a famine occurred and all were about to die.

original: rje btsun gyis sa chen po de'i mdor dbag bsam shing chen po rgyas pa gcig tu sprul nas sems can ci 'dod pa la thams cad lo stong du tshim par byas so //
analyzed: rje btsun gyis sa chen po de'i mdor dbag bsam shing chen po rgyas pa gcig tu sprul nas sems can ci 'dod pa la thams cad lo stong du tshim par byas so //
translated: The exalted one emanated a great wish-fulfilling tree in the center of the great earth, and for a thousand years satisfied all beings with whatever they desired.

original: bum pa bzang po kun don byed //
analyzed: bum pa bzang po kun don byed //
translated: The excellent vase performs all purposes.

original: ces pa ni sngon bskal pa gong ma'i dus su sems can la char ming mi grag pa'i dus byung ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni sngon bskal pa gong ma'i dus su sems can la char ming mi grag pa'i dus byung ste /
translated: In the past, during a former eon, a time occurred when it did not rain for beings.

original: des lo tog med nas btung ba'i chu yang med pa'i dus byung /
analyzed: des lo tog med nas btung ba'i chu yang med pa'i dus byung /
translated: Since there were no crops, there was not even water to drink.

original: rje btsun snying rje chen po skyes nas yul de'i phu ru brag cig gi rtsar bum pa'i gzugs cig byung /
analyzed: rje btsun snying rje chen po skyes nas yul de'i phu ru brag cig gi rtsar bum pa'i gzugs cig byung /
translated: The exalted one generated great compassion and in the upper part of that country, on the edge of a rock, there appeared a form like a vase.

original: kun gyis bltas pas je che je che la nam mkha' dang mnyam pa cig tu gyur nas /
analyzed: kun gyis bltas pas je che je che la nam mkha' dang mnyam pa cig tu gyur nas /
translated: Everyone looked on as it grew larger and larger until it was as vast as space.

original: de'i kha dang logs dang zhabs las chu'i phung po byung nas mthar bza' ba dang bgo ba thams cad byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i kha dang logs dang zhabs las chu'i phung po byung nas mthar bza' ba dang bgo ba thams cad byung ngo //
translated: From its mouth, sides, and feet came forth a mass of water, and finally all the food and clothing came forth.

original: des na rje btsun kun la phan 'dogs shing mnyes gshin pa dang / rigs bzang ngan dang 'dul ba'i dus shes shing 'dus pa'i dus shes pa dang ldan /
analyzed: des na rje btsun kun la phan 'dogs shing mnyes gshin pa dang / rigs bzang ngan dang 'dul ba'i dus shes shing 'dus pa'i dus shes pa dang ldan /
translated: Thus the Exalted One, who benefits everyone, is kind, and possesses the knowledge of good and bad families, the knowledge of the time for conversion, and the knowledge of the time for assembly.

original: dus shes sems can dbang po shes pa'o //
analyzed: dus shes sems can dbang po shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the time and the faculties of sentient beings.

original: der ma zad theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba la mkhas te /
analyzed: der ma zad theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba la mkhas te /
translated: Not only that, he is skilled in taming through the three vehicles.

original: ji ltar na sngon dze ta'i tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba'i gnas su /
analyzed: ji ltar na sngon dze ta'i tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba'i gnas su /
translated: How so? In the past, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada,

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mang po tshogs te chos kyi bgro ba mdzad do //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mang po tshogs te chos kyi bgro ba mdzad do //
translated: the buddhas and many bodhisattvas of the three times assembled and held a Dharma discussion.

original: de na 'dug pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis gting ma rtogs /
analyzed: de na 'dug pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis gting ma rtogs /
translated: The śrāvakas present did not fathom the depth of it.

original: dus de'i tshe 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhal med kyi khang pa na bzhugs pa las 'khor lag na rdo rje la sogs pa dpag tu med pa dang lha ma srin sde brgyad la sogs pa dang bcas te /🔽lho phyogs su bzhud pa tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la @136a * //
analyzed: dus de'i tshe 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhal med kyi khang pa na bzhugs pa las 'khor lag na rdo rje la sogs pa dpag tu med pa dang lha ma srin sde brgyad la sogs pa dang bcas te / lho phyogs su bzhud pa tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la @136a * //
translated: At that time, the noble Manjushri was dwelling in a celestial palace, accompanied by an immeasurable retinue of Vajrapani and others, as well as the eight classes of gods and demons.

original: sogs pa nyan thos drug cu tsam gyis mthong nas phyir phyin no //
analyzed: sogs pa nyan thos drug cu tsam gyis mthong nas phyir phyin no //
translated: When Shariputra and the other 60 shravakas saw him departing to the south, they followed after him.

original: der lam du sh'a ri'i bus dge slong rnams la 'jam dpal gyi yon tan mang du bshad pas des kyang sgrib pa srab par gyur to //
analyzed: der lam du sh'a ri'i bus dge slong rnams la 'jam dpal gyi yon tan mang du bshad pas des kyang sgrib pa srab par gyur to //
translated: On the road, Shariputra spoke at length to the bhikshus about Manjushri's qualities, and this caused their obscurations to become thinner.

original: de nas 'ongs pas lam du 'jam dpal dang mjal nas rje btsun la sh'a ri'i bus dge slong 'di rnams ni khyed blta bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: de nas 'ongs pas lam du 'jam dpal dang mjal nas rje btsun la sh'a ri'i bus dge slong 'di rnams ni khyed blta bar 'dod pas /
translated: When they arrived, they met Manjushri on the road. Shariputra said to the venerable one, These bhikshus wish to see you.

original: der rje btsun gyis glang chen lta stangs kyis gzigs pa /
analyzed: der rje btsun gyis glang chen lta stangs kyis gzigs pa /
translated: The venerable one looked at them with the gaze of an elephant.

original: dge slong rnams kyis gdams ngag zhus pas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis gdams ngag zhus pas /
translated: The bhikshus requested his instructions.

original: rje btsun gyis yongs su mi skyo ba'i chos bcu bshad /
analyzed: rje btsun gyis yongs su mi skyo ba'i chos bcu bshad /
translated: The venerable one explained the ten dharmas of non-discouragement.

original: sangs rgyas mchod pa la mi skyo ba dang / chos tshol ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / pha rol phyin bcu dang / ting nge 'dzin sgrub pa dang / thos pa gcig nas gcig tu bya ba dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing spyod ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod pa la mi skyo ba dang / chos tshol ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / pha rol phyin bcu dang / ting nge 'dzin sgrub pa dang / thos pa gcig nas gcig tu bya ba dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing spyod ba dang /
translated: They are not discouraged by making offerings to the buddhas, by seeking the Dharma, by developing bodhichitta, by practicing the ten paramitas, by accomplishing samadhis, by passing on what they have heard from one to another, by practicing in the buddhafields,🔽by bringing sentient beings to maturity, by meditating on the deities, by accomplishing the buddhas’ powers and so on, and by bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: sems can smin pa dang / lha bsgom pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs la sogs pa bsgrub ba la mi skyo ba dang bcu bshad nas dge slong rnams rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod nas /
analyzed: sems can smin pa dang / lha bsgom pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi stobs la sogs pa bsgrub ba la mi skyo ba dang bcu bshad nas dge slong rnams rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod nas /
translated: After explaining these ten things, he established the monks in perfect enlightenment.

original: der skyid pa'i 'byung gnas grong khyer na nags tshal chen po sna tshogs kyis brgyan par mdo sde chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: der skyid pa'i 'byung gnas grong khyer na nags tshal chen po sna tshogs kyis brgyan par mdo sde chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba /
translated: In the city of Sukhapura, which was adorned with various great forests, he taught the sutra called The Appearance of the Dharmadhatu.

original: mdo sde bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu thun mong du bshad /
analyzed: mdo sde bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu thun mong du bshad /
translated: He taught this sutra together with a hundred thousand million trillion other sutras.

original: dus de'i tshe rgya mtsho'i klu rnams kyis chos mnyan pa dang lha dang mi'i lus thob po //
analyzed: dus de'i tshe rgya mtsho'i klu rnams kyis chos mnyan pa dang lha dang mi'i lus thob po //
translated: At that time, the nāgas of the ocean listened to the Dharma and obtained human and divine bodies.

original: dus de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang theg pa gsum gyis 'dul bar snang ngo //
analyzed: dus de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang theg pa gsum gyis 'dul bar snang ngo //
translated: At that time, in all the world systems, the three vehicles were seen to be the discipline.

original: dus de'i tshe skyid pa'i 'byung gnas kyi mi thams cad dang tshong dpon nor bu bzang po la sogs pas rje btsun la phyag dang bskor ba byas nas 'khod pa las /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe skyid pa'i 'byung gnas kyi mi thams cad dang tshong dpon nor bu bzang po la sogs pas rje btsun la phyag dang bskor ba byas nas 'khod pa las /
translated: At that time, all the people of the Land of Bliss, the head merchant Sudhana, and so forth, having made prostrations and circumambulations to the Jetsun, sat down.

original: de la khyad par du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzangs la gzigs nas rje btsun gyis gnyis med kyi ye shes bstan no //
analyzed: de la khyad par du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzangs la gzigs nas rje btsun gyis gnyis med kyi ye shes bstan no //
translated: In particular, looking at the head merchant's son Sudhana, the Jetsun revealed the wisdom of nonduality.

original: de lta bu'i rje btsun de rang gi yon tan ci dang ldan na yon tan shes pas chos shes bkra shis pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rje btsun de rang gi yon tan ci dang ldan na yon tan shes pas chos shes bkra shis pa'o //
translated: If one has such qualities as the Jetsun, what qualities does one possess? By knowing the qualities, one knows the Dharma, which is auspicious.

original: bkra shis kyi rdzas brgyad 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bkra shis kyi rdzas brgyad 'byung ba'o //
translated: The eight auspicious substances arise.

original: bkra shis kun gyi nang na rje btsun bkra shis so //
analyzed: bkra shis kun gyi nang na rje btsun bkra shis so //
translated: Among all auspiciousness, the Jetsun is auspicious.

original: grags pa nas skyabs su 'os zhes pa ni /
analyzed: grags pa nas skyabs su 'os zhes pa ni /
translated: From worthy of refuge up to

original: sngon rje btsun rgyal bu thams cad sgrol zhes bya bar gyur pa'i dus su chu bo chen po'i 'gram na bzhugs pa la srog chags mang po ma thar nas 'dug @136b pas ;
analyzed: sngon rje btsun rgyal bu thams cad sgrol zhes bya bar gyur pa'i dus su chu bo chen po'i 'gram na bzhugs pa la srog chags mang po ma thar nas 'dug @136b pas ;
translated: In a previous life, the Jetsun was a prince called Viśvantara. He was living on the bank of a great river. Many animals were trapped there.

original: rje btsun chu 'gram na 'dug pas rgyal bu de rang 'dra ba du mar sprul nas gcig la gcig 'jus nas zam pa byas nas kun bton te dbugs phyung ngo //
analyzed: rje btsun chu 'gram na 'dug pas rgyal bu de rang 'dra ba du mar sprul nas gcig la gcig 'jus nas zam pa byas nas kun bton te dbugs phyung ngo //
translated: The Jetsun was on the bank of the river. He emanated many bodies like himself. They held on to each other and made a bridge. They all crossed over and were saved.

original: der de na yod pa kun gyis lan ldon pa la /
analyzed: der de na yod pa kun gyis lan ldon pa la /
translated: Everyone there wanted to repay the Jetsun.

original: rje btsun gyis nga la lan glan mi dgos kyi nga'i gdams ngag 'di zung shig gsungs nas chos kyi ston mo mdzad pa'i chos gcig ni byang chub kyi sems mi gtong pa'o //
analyzed: rje btsun gyis nga la lan glan mi dgos kyi nga'i gdams ngag 'di zung shig gsungs nas chos kyi ston mo mdzad pa'i chos gcig ni byang chub kyi sems mi gtong pa'o //
translated: The Jetsun said, “I do not need repayment. Take this instruction of mine.” He gave a Dharma teaching. The first point was not to give up bodhichitta.

original: gnyis pa ni thos pas mi ngoms pa dang / tshul bzhin du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thos pas mi ngoms pa dang / tshul bzhin du bsgom pa'o //
translated: The second was to be insatiable in listening to the dharma and to meditate properly.

analyzed: gsum pa ni sdig pa spong ba dang / dge ba la brtson pa dang / bsngo ba la mkhas pa'o //

original: bzhi pa ni tshul khrims dag pa /

original: / sku'i mtshan nyid dngos gang zhe na /

original: 'di ni gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su bstan te /

original: zab mo'i dbang du ni /

analyzed: thub pa med cing nas sad pa'i bdag ces pas ston te /

analyzed: chos sku de rtog pas mi thub pa la 'di yin pa dpe med /

analyzed: mi rtog pa la mi mngon gsal ba'i rkyen med pas so //
translated: Since it is nonconceptual, it is not manifest without the condition of clarity.

analyzed: skyon med pas mi 'gyur kun la khyab par gnas rtogs par dka' ba'i dri mas ma gos pa /
translated: Since it is faultless, it is unchanging; since it pervades all, it is difficult to realize.

original: nyes pa rdul tsam yang med pas nyan thos rang rgyal byang chub sems dpa' las shin tu sad pas sad pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: nyes pa rdul tsam yang med pas nyan thos rang rgyal byang chub sems dpa' las shin tu sad pas sad pa'i bdag go //
translated: Since it is not tainted by stains, it is the self that is awakened, far more awakened than śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: sku la de nyid bsgre'o //
analyzed: sku la de nyid bsgre'o //
translated: That is applied to the kāya.

original: mkhyen pa'i ye shes kun shes nas //
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i ye shes kun shes nas //
translated: Having understood all-knowing pristine consciousness,

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pas bstan te /
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas las byed pas bstan te /
translated: it is explained that the activity of the buddhas of the three times is performed.

original: kun shes la sogs pa ji snyed dang ji lta ba shes pas gzung 'dzin las 'das pa gnyis su med pas mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i dus gsum sangs rgyas kun gyi las yin pas de mdzad pa'o //

translated: Since the wisdom of knowing all things and so on is nonconceptual due to being beyond subject and object, nondual, and spontaneously present, it is the activity of all buddhas of the three times.

original: de'i chos nyid de'i sems nyid sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: de'i chos nyid de'i sems nyid sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: The dharmatā of that and the mind itself are buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pas bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pas bstan te /
translated: Since that is buddhahood, it is called “tathāgata.”

original: rig pa byang chub sems 'di dang po bar dang tha ma btsal na ma rnyed pa nyid sna tshogs su snang /
analyzed: rig pa byang chub sems 'di dang po bar dang tha ma btsal na ma rnyed pa nyid sna tshogs su snang /
translated: If this vidyā, awakened mind, is searched for in the beginning, middle, and end, it is not found.

original: snang tsam nyid na stong pa las ma g-yos pas /
analyzed: snang tsam nyid na stong pa las ma g-yos pas /
translated: Since it does not move from emptiness in the mere🔽appearance of diversity,

original: chu zla lta bu de ni /
analyzed: chu zla lta bu de ni /
translated: it is like a reflection of the moon in water.

original: ye shes mig gcig dri ma med //
analyzed: ye shes mig gcig dri ma med //
translated: The one eye of pristine consciousness is uncontaminated.

original: @137b ces pa lta bu'i ye shes mig gcig ni bsgom pa'i dus na dri med 'od gsal lta ba'i dus na rig pa 'dus ma byas 'phel 'grib dang bral ba snang stong dbyer med spyod pa'i dus na mnyam gzhag chen po'i spyod pa bya'o //

translated: The single eye of timeless awareness, as just cited, is to be experienced in meditation as uncontaminated utter lucidity; in the postmeditation phase, it is to be experienced as the conduct of supreme evenness, with awareness as the uncompounded state, free of increase or decrease, and with the inseparability of apparent phenomena and emptiness.

original: 'bras bu sku lnga thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu sku lnga thob pa'o //

original: de ltar rtogs pas ye shes lus can de bzhin gshegs pa'o //

original: des chos ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: des chos ji ltar gsungs she na /

original: tshig gi nas tshugs pa med ces pas bstan te /
analyzed: tshig gi nas tshugs pa med ces pas bstan te /
translated: As the source texts state, one teaches with words that are eloquent,

original: rje btsun smra ba'i seng ge ste /
analyzed: rje btsun smra ba'i seng ge ste /
translated: the venerable one, a lion among teachers.

original: 'di yang sngon rje btsun yul ma ga dh'a'i pho brang dgon pa snying po byang chub na bzhugs pa gdan seng ge'i khri padma'i steng na bzhugs nas /

translated: In the past, the venerable one was dwelling in the palace of Magadha, in the forest of Bodhgaya, sitting on a lion throne above a lotus.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brjod du med pa la nges pa don gyi chos ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brjod du med pa la nges pa don gyi chos ston te /
translated: He was teaching the definitive dharma to countless millions of bodhisattvas.

original: kun la bag mi tsha bas na'o //
analyzed: kun la bag mi tsha bas na'o //
translated: He was not at all intimidated by anyone.

original: de lta bu'i rje btsun de thugs rje phyogs med cing sku dang 'od zer khyad par du 'phags pas na kun nas blta na sdug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rje btsun de thugs rje phyogs med cing sku dang 'od zer khyad par du 'phags pas na kun nas blta na sdug ces bya'o //
translated: Since the heart of such a venerable one is impartial compassion and his body and light rays are especially exalted, he is called “pleasing to behold in every way.”

original: 'o na gang nas byung na thugs ka'i dpal gyi be'u nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na gang nas byung na thugs ka'i dpal gyi be'u nas byung ba'o //
translated: Well, where did he come from? He came from the glorious knot of the heart.

original: lag na 'od 'bar snang ba po //
analyzed: lag na 'od 'bar snang ba po //
translated: He is the light-bearing illuminator in the hand.

original: zhes pa rje btsun gyi phyag la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa rje btsun gyi phyag la bya ste /

original: sngon tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzangs kyis chos zhus /
analyzed: sngon tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzangs kyis chos zhus /
translated: In the past, the merchant’s son Sudhana requested teachings.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang pos lung bstan nas mthar byams pa dang 'jam dpal la man ngag zhus nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang pos lung bstan nas mthar byams pa dang 'jam dpal la man ngag zhus nas /
translated: After being prophesied by many spiritual friends, he finally requested instructions from Maitreya and Mañjuśrī.

original: grong khyer yid bde ba mngon du gyur pa na tshong dpon gyi bu yod pa la 'jam dpal gyis dpag tshad brgyad cu'i pha rol nas phyag gser gyi mdog can brkyang nas nor bzangs kyi spyi bor bzhag nas /
analyzed: grong khyer yid bde ba mngon du gyur pa na tshong dpon gyi bu yod pa la 'jam dpal gyis dpag tshad brgyad cu'i pha rol nas phyag gser gyi mdog can brkyang nas nor bzangs kyi spyi bor bzhag nas /
translated: In the city of Manifest Joy, he was a merchant’s son. Mañjuśrī extended a golden hand from a distance of eighty leagues and placed it on the head of Sudhana.

original: de las 'od zer 'phros pas 'gro ba kun bde ba la bkod de gdams ngag byas so //
analyzed: de las 'od zer 'phros pas 'gro ba kun bde ba la bkod de gdams ngag byas so //
translated: Light rays radiated from that and established all beings in bliss. He was instructed.

original: sman pa che mchog gtso bo ste //
analyzed: sman pa che mchog gtso bo ste //
translated: The chief of all great physicians,

original: zhes pa zug rngu 'byin pa bla na med //
analyzed: zhes pa zug rngu 'byin pa bla na med //
translated: The unsurpassed remover of pain.

original: ces pas rje btsun sems can kun gyi nad 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: ces pas rje btsun sems can kun gyi nad 'byin pa ste /
translated: Thus, the Jetsun removes the illness of all sentient beings.

original: sngon grong khyer yangs pa can na nad skya rbab bya ba byung nas kun 'chi ba la thug nas /
analyzed: sngon grong khyer yangs pa can na nad skya rbab bya ba byung nas kun 'chi ba la thug nas /
translated: In the past, in the city of Shravasti, there was an epidemic called the yellow plague. Everyone was about to die,

original: sman pa gang gis kyang phan ma thogs nas rje btsun gyis blon po sman pa bya bar sprul nas nad kun zhi bar byas so //
analyzed: sman pa gang gis kyang phan ma thogs nas rje btsun gyis blon po sman pa bya bar sprul nas nad kun zhi bar byas so //
translated: and no doctor could help. The Jetsun emanated as a doctor minister and healed all the sick.

original: sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing //
analyzed: sman rnams ma lus ljon pa'i shing //
translated: The tree of all medicines,

original: nad do cog gi dgra che ba //
analyzed: nad do cog gi dgra che ba //
translated: The great enemy of all illnesses.

original: zhes pa ni sngon nad kyi bskal pa byung ba'i dus sems can thams cad kha btag pa las /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon nad kyi bskal pa byung ba'i dus sems can thams cad kha btag pa las /
translated: In the past, during the time of the illness kalpa, all sentient beings were afflicted.

original: rje btsun gyis nya ro hi tar sprul @138a * //
analyzed: rje btsun gyis nya ro hi tar sprul @138a * //
translated: The Jetsun emanated as a rohita fish,

original: nas de'i sha su bros pa nad las thar te /
analyzed: nas de'i sha su bros pa nad las thar te /
translated: and those who ate its flesh were freed from illness.

original: don nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad kyi gnyen po rje btsun sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mchog go //
analyzed: don nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad kyi gnyen po rje btsun sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mchog go //
translated: The Jetsun is the antidote to all the illnesses of the afflictions, and is the most handsome in the three worlds.

original: dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can //
analyzed: dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can //
translated: The glorious one with the mandala of stars,

original: zhes pa ni sngon lha dbang phyug chen po 'dul ba'i dus su kho'i 'khor dang nyi 'khor thams cad bran du bcad chos skyong srung mar dam phog pa las /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon lha dbang phyug chen po 'dul ba'i dus su kho'i 'khor dang nyi 'khor thams cad bran du bcad chos skyong srung mar dam phog pa las /
translated: This is the story of when the great god Shiva was subdued. At that time, all of his retinue and planets were bound into servitude and bound under oath as dharma protectors.

original: gza' chen po brgyad dang rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad gros byas te /
analyzed: gza' chen po brgyad dang rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad gros byas te /
translated: The eight great planets and the twenty-eight lunar mansions held a council.

original: gza' khyab 'jug byung nas 'o cag bka' nyan pa 'di mi bya byas pas /
analyzed: gza' khyab 'jug byung nas 'o cag bka' nyan pa 'di mi bya byas pas /
translated: The planet Rahu said, “We should not listen to what he says.”

original: 'o cag yo h'um mdzad la bsngo zer ba la /
analyzed: 'o cag yo h'um mdzad la bsngo zer ba la /
translated: “We should dedicate ourselves to serving him,” said Jupiter.

original: rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad ni bud med yin pas nged kyis cang thub bam zer ba la gza' chen po brgyad ma nyan nas der nam mkha' nas thog dang ser ba phab bas /
analyzed: rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad ni bud med yin pas nged kyis cang thub bam zer ba la gza' chen po brgyad ma nyan nas der nam mkha' nas thog dang ser ba phab bas /
translated: “We are the twenty-eight lunar mansions, and we are women. What can we do?” said the lunar mansions. The eight great planets would not listen to them.🔽Then, from the sky, hail and lightning fell.

original: rje btsun gyis gza' dang rgyu skar gyi steng du dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na rdo rje 'jigs byed bzhugs pa de la gza' brgyad kyis bskor ba /
analyzed: rje btsun gyis gza' dang rgyu skar gyi steng du dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na rdo rje 'jigs byed bzhugs pa de la gza' brgyad kyis bskor ba /
translated: The Jetsun emanated himself as Vajra Bhairava in the center of a mandala, surrounded by the eight planets.

original: khyams la rgyu skar bdun bdun gyis bskor ba lta bas chog mi shes pa de lta bu cig de tsho'i steng du bsgoms nas thog ser btang ba bred de srog gi snying po phul dam bcas dkyil 'khor du bcug ste /
analyzed: khyams la rgyu skar bdun bdun gyis bskor ba lta bas chog mi shes pa de lta bu cig de tsho'i steng du bsgoms nas thog ser btang ba bred de srog gi snying po phul dam bcas dkyil 'khor du bcug ste /
translated: He meditated on the mandala of the seven planets and stars in the courtyard, and when he sent down hail and lightning, they were terrified and offered the essence of their life force. He bound them by oath and made them enter the mandala.

original: des na / dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can //🔽zhes bya'o // der ma zad phyogs bcu nam mkha'i mthar thug pa //
analyzed: des na / dpal ldan rgyu skar dkyil 'khor can // zhes bya'o // der ma zad phyogs bcu nam mkha'i mthar thug pa //
translated: Therefore, he is called “the glorious one with the mandala of the planets and stars.”

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs //
translated: Not only that, he is called “the one who properly plants the victory banner of Dharma in the ten directions to the end of space.”

original: zhes pa ni sngon grong khyer chen po spang ri zhes pa na rje btsun 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor stong phrag bcu dang ldan pa la theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad ston pa'i dus su /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon grong khyer chen po spang ri zhes pa na rje btsun 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor stong phrag bcu dang ldan pa la theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad ston pa'i dus su /
translated: In the past, in a great city called Spangri, the venerable Manjushri was teaching all the Dharma of the Mahayana to an assembly of ten thousand bodhisattvas.

original: zhabs kyi mthil nas 'od zer 'phros nas dmyal ba rnams la chos 'chad /
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil nas 'od zer 'phros nas dmyal ba rnams la chos 'chad /
translated: At that time, light rays radiated from the soles of his feet and taught Dharma to the hell beings.

original: de bzhin du pus mo nas yi dvags /🔽lte ba nas byo la song /
analyzed: de bzhin du pus mo nas yi dvags / lte ba nas byo la song /
translated: In the same way, from his knees to the hungry ghosts.🔽From his navel to the animals.

original: rtsi ba logs nas gshin rje /
analyzed: rtsi ba logs nas gshin rje /
translated: From his ribs to the Lord of Death.

original: phyag mthil nas mi /
analyzed: phyag mthil nas mi /
translated: From the palms of his hands, he emanated humans.

original: smin phrag nas lha ma yin /
analyzed: smin phrag nas lha ma yin /
translated: From his brow, he emanated asuras.

original: rgyab nas nyan thos /
analyzed: rgyab nas nyan thos /
translated: From his back, he emanated shravakas.

original: zhal nas rang rgyal smin mtshams nas byang sems la ;
analyzed: zhal nas rang rgyal smin mtshams nas byang sems la ;
translated: From his mouth, he emanated pratyekabuddhas. From his brow, he emanated bodhisattvas.

original: spyi gtsug nas sangs rgyas la chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs so //
analyzed: spyi gtsug nas sangs rgyas la chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs so //
translated: From his crown, he emanated buddhas.

original: la la dag sprul pa'i 'khor lo sna tshogs 'chang du sbyor ro //
analyzed: la la dag sprul pa'i 'khor lo sna tshogs 'chang du sbyor ro //
translated: Some say that he emanated various wheels.

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs pa ni rje btsun gyi zhabs las byang chub sems dpa' snang ba mdzod kyi snying po sprul @138b nas 'og gi phyogs su chos ston /🔽byin pa las byang chub sems dpa' gsang ba'i mdzod du sprul nas shar gyi phyogs su chos ston /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan legs par 'dzugs pa ni rje btsun gyi zhabs las byang chub sems dpa' snang ba mdzod kyi snying po sprul @138b nas 'og gi phyogs su chos ston / byin pa las byang chub sems dpa' gsang ba'i mdzod du sprul nas shar gyi phyogs su chos ston /
translated: As for “he raised the victory banner of dharma well,” from the feet of the Jetsun, the bodhisattva Illuminating the Essence of the Treasury was emanated and taught dharma in the lower direction.🔽From his thighs, the bodhisattva Secret Treasury was emanated and taught dharma in the east.

original: pus mo las byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi mdzod du sprul nas ston /
analyzed: pus mo las byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi mdzod du sprul nas ston /
translated: From his knees, the bodhisattva Glorious Treasury was emanated and taught dharma in the south.

original: sta zur las byang chub sems dpa' sprin sgra zab mo'i mdzod /
analyzed: sta zur las byang chub sems dpa' sprin sgra zab mo'i mdzod /
translated: From his hips, the bodhisattva Profound Cloud Sound Treasury was emanated and taught dharma in the west.

original: lte ba las byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje mi phyed pa'i gtsug gi mdzod /
analyzed: lte ba las byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje mi phyed pa'i gtsug gi mdzod /
translated: From his navel, the bodhisattva Vajra-Akṣobhya-kośa.

original: thugs ka nas byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chos kyi mdzod /🔽phrag pa las byang sems grags pa 'od kyi mdzod /
analyzed: thugs ka nas byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chos kyi mdzod / phrag pa las byang sems grags pa 'od kyi mdzod /
translated: From his heart, the bodhisattva Tejorāja-kośa.🔽From his shoulders, the bodhisattva Yaśaḥprabhā-kośa.

original: zhal nas byang sems ri rab g-yo ba'i mdzod /
analyzed: zhal nas byang sems ri rab g-yo ba'i mdzod /
translated: From his mouth, the bodhisattva Meru-calana-kośa.

original: smin mtshams nas byang sems kun du lta ba gzi brjid mdzod /
analyzed: smin mtshams nas byang sems kun du lta ba gzi brjid mdzod /
translated: From his brow, the bodhisattva Samanta-darśana-tejorāja.

original: dbu las byang chub sems dpa' thub pa med pa'i mdzod /
analyzed: dbu las byang chub sems dpa' thub pa med pa'i mdzod /
translated: From his head, the bodhisattva Avinivartanīya-kośa.

original: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su ston to //
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su ston to //
translated: He revealed these bodhisattvas to the world systems in the upper direction.

original: des 'gro ba drug la nyi ma bzhin du phyogs ris med pas na 'gro na gdugs gcig yangs pa ste /
analyzed: des 'gro ba drug la nyi ma bzhin du phyogs ris med pas na 'gro na gdugs gcig yangs pa ste /
translated: Since he is impartial toward the six kinds of beings, like the sun, he is the one parasol that covers all beings.

original: byams dang snying rja'i dkyil 'khor can tshad med bas gang ba'o //
analyzed: byams dang snying rja'i dkyil 'khor can tshad med bas gang ba'o //
translated: He is filled with the immeasurable maṇḍala of love and compassion.

original: zhi bas mi 'dul na padma gar gyi dbang phyug tu 'gro ba 'dul ba kun la gzugs zhal stong phyag stong spyan stong du sprul nas don mdzad pas padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //🔽rin chen dgos 'dod skong ba nyi ma bzhin du snyoms pas na khyab bdag chen po rin chen gdugs so //
analyzed: zhi bas mi 'dul na padma gar gyi dbang phyug tu 'gro ba 'dul ba kun la gzugs zhal stong phyag stong spyan stong du sprul nas don mdzad pas padma gar gyi dbang phyug go // rin chen dgos 'dod skong ba nyi ma bzhin du snyoms pas na khyab bdag chen po rin chen gdugs so //
translated: The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid che ste sprul pa spro ba'o //🔽sangs rgyas sku 'chang ba ni gnyis med ye shes la kun skyes pas so //🔽rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid che ste sprul pa spro ba'o // sangs rgyas sku 'chang ba ni gnyis med ye shes la kun skyes pas so // rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.

original: kun gyi bstan pa gcig ni yul gcig pa'o //🔽rdo rje rigs nas thugs brtse ba ni rje btsun de yab lnga yum lnga'i rang bzhin du bstan no //
analyzed: kun gyi bstan pa gcig ni yul gcig pa'o // rdo rje rigs nas thugs brtse ba ni rje btsun de yab lnga yum lnga'i rang bzhin du bstan no //
translated: The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.

original: rje btsun don dam par sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs kho na'o //
analyzed: rje btsun don dam par sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs kho na'o //
translated: The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels.🔽The great lord Ratna Chatra is the sun that fulfills the needs and desires of beings with jewels

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas kun gyi sku bas lhag pas na sku che ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas kun gyi sku bas lhag pas na sku che ba'o //
translated: Since it is superior to the body of all buddhas of the three times, it is the great body.

original: kun gyi smra ba rnams kyi seng ger gyur pas na gsung yang dag pa yin no //
analyzed: kun gyi smra ba rnams kyi seng ger gyur pas na gsung yang dag pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the lion among all speech, it is the pure speech.

original: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che ni dper na nyi ma 'char ba ri mtho mtho nas rim pas 'char yang nyi ma la mtho dman med do //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che ni dper na nyi ma 'char ba ri mtho mtho nas rim pas 'char yang nyi ma la mtho dman med do //
translated: The great light of the vajra sun: for example, when the sun rises, it rises gradually from the highest mountains, but the sun has no high or low.

original: de bzhin du rje btsun gyi thugs rje snang lugs kyi snod rim pa bzang ngan du snang yang rje btsun nyid la rtog pa med do //🔽rdo rje zla ba @139a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rje btsun gyi thugs rje snang lugs kyi snod rim pa bzang ngan du snang yang rje btsun nyid la rtog pa med do // rdo rje zla ba @139a * //
translated: In the same way, the way the compassion of the Jetsun appears is that the vessel appears in stages as good or bad, but the Jetsun himself has no concepts.🔽The vajra moon

original: dri med 'od //
analyzed: dri med 'od //
translated: is the light of the stainless.

original: ces pa dper na zla ba la chos bzhi yod de /
analyzed: ces pa dper na zla ba la chos bzhi yod de /
translated: For example, the moon has four qualities:

original: skar ma zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'phel 'grib ston ba dang / chu dangs pa'i nang du 'char ba dang / kun la mngon sum du snang yang zla ba la rtog pa med do //
analyzed: skar ma zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'phel 'grib ston ba dang / chu dangs pa'i nang du 'char ba dang / kun la mngon sum du snang yang zla ba la rtog pa med do //
translated: it outshines the stars, it shows the waxing and waning, it rises in the center of clear water, and it appears in actuality to all, but the moon has no concepts.

original: de bzhin du rje btsun gyi sku zla ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rje btsun gyi sku zla ba lta bu ste /
translated: In the same way, the body of the Jetsun is like the moon.

original: slob pa man chad zil gyis gnon pa dang / gdul bya la sku tshe ring thung gis ston pa dang / 'phel 'grib ston pa dang / mos pa la gzugs brnyan snang ba dang / so sor mos pa byas nas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa man chad zil gyis gnon pa dang / gdul bya la sku tshe ring thung gis ston pa dang / 'phel 'grib ston pa dang / mos pa la gzugs brnyan snang ba dang / so sor mos pa byas nas bsgom pa'o //
translated: He surpasses all those who are still learning, and he teaches disciples by means of his long life. He teaches by means of increase and decrease, and he appears as a reflection to those who are devoted. He meditates after having made individual devotion.

original: rje btsun la de'i rtog pa med do //
analyzed: rje btsun la de'i rtog pa med do //
translated: The Lord does not have such conceptual thoughts.

original: chags bral la sogs chags pa che ni gdul bya thams cad bsdus na chags bral dang chags bcas de kho na nyid kyi gang zag go //
analyzed: chags bral la sogs chags pa che ni gdul bya thams cad bsdus na chags bral dang chags bcas de kho na nyid kyi gang zag go //
translated: The great passion of those who are free from passion and so on is the reality of those who are free from passion and those who are full of passion, when all disciples are included.

original: rje btsun gyi sku kha dog sna tshogs spros pas chos kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzugs pa'o //
analyzed: rje btsun gyi sku kha dog sna tshogs spros pas chos kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzugs pa'o //
translated: The Lord's body emits various colors, and he raises the banner of the Dharma.

original: rje btsun byang chub shing drung na bzhugs pa'i dus su 'od sna tshogs spro ba dang / rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas 'gro ba ris drug la chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: rje btsun byang chub shing drung na bzhugs pa'i dus su 'od sna tshogs spro ba dang / rdo rje skyil krung bcas nas 'gro ba ris drug la chos ston pa'o //
translated: When the Lord was sitting under the Bodhi tree, he emitted various lights, and he went to the six realms of beings, sitting in the vajra posture and teaching the Dharma.

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas padma skyes //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas padma skyes //
translated: The glorious Buddha was born from a lotus.

original: zhes pa ni sngon rgyal po'i pho brang rin chen sgron ma zhes bya ba na rgyal po dpal gyi gtsug phud bya bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po padma'i sdong po las rdzus te byung ba mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa de la btsun mo phrag bcu
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon rgyal po'i pho brang rin chen sgron ma zhes bya ba na rgyal po dpal gyi gtsug phud bya bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po padma'i sdong po las rdzus te byung ba mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa de la btsun mo phrag bcu
translated: Long ago, in the palace of the king called Glorious Topknot, in the palace called Jewel Lamp, there was a king called Glorious Topknot. He was born miraculously from the stem of a lotus flower, and was adorned with the major and minor marks. He had ten thousand queens,

original: / bu stong /
analyzed: / bu stong /
translated: a thousand sons,

original: blon po phrag bcu yod pa kun dang ldan pa dkar po'i chos la spyod pa sha stag go //
analyzed: blon po phrag bcu yod pa kun dang ldan pa dkar po'i chos la spyod pa sha stag go //
translated: and ten thousand ministers. All of them were endowed with the white dharmas of practice.

original: dus de tsam na sems can gdul dka' ba de dag 'dul ba'i dus la bab pa las /
analyzed: dus de tsam na sems can gdul dka' ba de dag 'dul ba'i dus la bab pa las /
