translated: At that time, the time had come to tame those difficult to tame.

original: dus der rje btsun gyis cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgo nas skad cig re re la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bsgrags pa zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi mdzod bshad do //
analyzed: dus der rje btsun gyis cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgo nas skad cig re re la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bsgrags pa zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi mdzod bshad do //
translated: At that time, the Jetsun, through the inconceivable door of miracles, explained the treasury of wisdom called The Proclamation of the Wheel of Dharma of All Buddhas in each moment.

original: kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //
translated: Holder of the treasury of omniscient wisdom,

original: zhes pa tshong dpon gyi bus phyin tsam na khyad par du 'phags pa'i khang pa rim khang bcu'i dang po na bza' btung gis kun tshim par byed pa mthong /
analyzed: zhes pa tshong dpon gyi bus phyin tsam na khyad par du 'phags pa'i khang pa rim khang bcu'i dang po na bza' btung gis kun tshim par byed pa mthong /
translated: When the merchant’s son arrived, he saw a particularly exalted house with ten stories. On the first floor he saw that everyone was satisfied with food and drink.

original: gnyis pa na gos sna tshogs kyis thams cad tshim par byed pa mthong /
analyzed: gnyis pa na gos sna tshogs kyis thams cad tshim par byed pa mthong /
translated: On the second floor he saw that everyone was satisfied with various clothes.

original: gsum pa na rgyan dang lhab lhub kyis /
analyzed: gsum pa na rgyan dang lhab lhub kyis /
translated: On the third floor he saw that everyone was satisfied with ornaments and jewelry.

original: bzhi pa na btsun mo rin po ches tshogs kyi yo byad shom /
analyzed: bzhi pa na btsun mo rin po ches tshogs kyi yo byad shom /
translated: On the fourth floor the precious queen was preparing the feast.

original: lnga pa nas la gnas pa'i byang sems kyis 'gro ba la phan 'dogs /
analyzed: lnga pa nas la gnas pa'i byang sems kyis 'gro ba la phan 'dogs /
translated: On the fifth floor bodhisattvas who lived on the mountain were benefiting beings.

original: drug @139b pa na byang chub sems dpa' rnams bka' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas phan 'dogs /
analyzed: drug @139b pa na byang chub sems dpa' rnams bka' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas phan 'dogs /
translated: On the sixth floor bodhisattvas were benefiting beings with the perfection of wisdom.

original: bdun pa na byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad sgra brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa bsgom pa mthong /
analyzed: bdun pa na byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad sgra brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa bsgom pa mthong /
translated: On the seventh floor he saw bodhisattvas meditating on the patience that all phenomena are like echoes.

original: brgyad pa na byang chub sems dpa' 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha lugs kyis sngags 'chad pa mthong /
analyzed: brgyad pa na byang chub sems dpa' 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha lugs kyis sngags 'chad pa mthong /
translated: On the eighth floor he saw bodhisattvas teaching the tantras in the guise of chakravartins.

original: dgu pa na byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa mthong /
analyzed: dgu pa na byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa mthong /
translated: On the ninth level, they see bodhisattvas who are impeded by only one more birth and are engaged in benefiting beings.

original: rim khang bcu pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyis don mdzad pa mthong nas /
analyzed: rim khang bcu pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyis don mdzad pa mthong nas /
translated: On the tenth level, they see completely perfect buddhas engaged in benefiting beings through the twelve aspects of their activity.

original: de nyid kyi tshe mthong lam skyes pas /🔽kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe mthong lam skyes pas / kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //
translated: At that point, the path of seeing is born in them.

original: zhes pas so //
analyzed: zhes pas so //
translated: As it is said:🔽Holder of the treasury of omniscient timeless awareness.

original: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang //🔽zhes pa nas rdo rje chos zhes pas sngon byang chub sems dpa' rgyal bar dka' bas 'phags pa 'jam dpal la gdams ngag zhur 'ongs pas pho brang gcig na ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs nas lus bsrangs te /
analyzed: rgyal po sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang // zhes pa nas rdo rje chos zhes pas sngon byang chub sems dpa' rgyal bar dka' bas 'phags pa 'jam dpal la gdams ngag zhur 'ongs pas pho brang gcig na ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs nas lus bsrangs te /
translated: King of magical display, wielder of myriad emanations.

original: dbugs rgyu ba med par sgom pa mdzad pa'i dus su /
analyzed: dbugs rgyu ba med par sgom pa mdzad pa'i dus su /
translated: In the past, when the bodhisattva Difficult to Conquer came to request spiritual advice from noble Manjushri, the latter was seated in a palace, absorbed in meditative absorption, his body straight, his meditation focused without any movement of breath.

original: de'i ba spu'i spu re re las kha dog bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dpag tu med pa mang po bkye ste /
analyzed: de'i ba spu'i spu re re las kha dog bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dpag tu med pa mang po bkye ste /
translated: At that point, from each and every pore of his skin, he emanated countless magical displays of inconceivable colors.

original: zhabs kyi mthil nas tshong dpon la sogs pa spros nas bza' ba rnam pa mang pos kun tshim par byas so //
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil nas tshong dpon la sogs pa spros nas bza' ba rnam pa mang pos kun tshim par byas so //
translated: From the soles of his feet he emanated many merchants and so forth, and they satisfied everyone with many kinds of food.

original: pus mo gnyis nas rgyal rigs la sogs pa spro /
analyzed: pus mo gnyis nas rgyal rigs la sogs pa spro /
translated: From his two knees he emanated many kṣatriyas and so forth.

original: lte ba nas drang srong dang bram ze gtsug phud la sogs pa mang po spro /
analyzed: lte ba nas drang srong dang bram ze gtsug phud la sogs pa mang po spro /
translated: From his navel he emanated many sages, brahmins, and śramaṇas.

original: rtsi ba logs nas klu la sogs pa mang po spro /
analyzed: rtsi ba logs nas klu la sogs pa mang po spro /
translated: From his ribs he emanated many nāgas and so forth.

original: thugs ka nas lha dang lha ma yin mang po spro /
analyzed: thugs ka nas lha dang lha ma yin mang po spro /
translated: From his heart he emanated many gods and asuras.

original: rgyab nas nyan thos dang rang rgyal mang po spro /🔽phrag ba nas gnod sbyin mang po spro /
analyzed: rgyab nas nyan thos dang rang rgyal mang po spro / phrag ba nas gnod sbyin mang po spro /
translated: From his back he emanated many śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽From his shoulders he emanated many yakṣas.

original: dpral ba nas mi'am ci mang po spro /
analyzed: dpral ba nas mi'am ci mang po spro /
translated: From his forehead he emanated many kinnaras.

original: zhal nas 'khor los sgyur ba mang po spro /
analyzed: zhal nas 'khor los sgyur ba mang po spro /
translated: From his mouth he emanated many cakravartins.

original: mig nas nyi zla mang po spro /🔽dpral ba nas tshangs pa'i tshogs spro /
analyzed: mig nas nyi zla mang po spro / dpral ba nas tshangs pa'i tshogs spro /
translated: From his eyes he emanated many suns and moons.🔽From his forehead he emanated many Brahmā assemblies.

original: spyi gtsug nas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas mang po spro /
analyzed: spyi gtsug nas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas mang po spro /
translated: From the crown of his head he emanated many buddhas of the three times.

original: de'i tshe ba spu las kyang de snyed spro ba mthong nas de nyid du mthong ba'i lam skyes so //
analyzed: de'i tshe ba spu las kyang de snyed spro ba mthong nas de nyid du mthong ba'i lam skyes so //
translated: At that time, seeing that many emanations were also emanating from his pores, the path of seeing arose for him right there.

original: des na che ba'i gsang sngags dang rig sngags 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: des na che ba'i gsang sngags dang rig sngags 'chang ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the great holder of secret mantras and knowledge mantras.

original: phyag mtshan rdo rje rnon po dang ral gri la sogs pa'i rnam pa'am rtags bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyag mtshan rdo rje rnon po dang ral gri la sogs pa'i rnam pa'am rtags bstan pa'o //
translated: He displays the hand implements such as the sharp vajra and sword, and so on, or the signs.

original: thugs kyi mkhyen pa gnyis med ni dzin dzik go //
analyzed: thugs kyi mkhyen pa gnyis med ni dzin dzik go //
translated: The nondual knowledge of his mind is Jinajik.

original: rdo rje blo gros gnyis med ye shes rig @140a * //
analyzed: rdo rje blo gros gnyis med ye shes rig @140a * //
translated: Vajra wisdom is the knowledge of nondual pristine consciousness.

original: pa pha rol phyin pa bcu sa bcu rdzogs /
analyzed: pa pha rol phyin pa bcu sa bcu rdzogs /
translated: The perfection of the ten perfections and the completion of the ten stages

original: don ni rnam dag bdag med pa'i ye shes thugs kyi me long ngo //
analyzed: don ni rnam dag bdag med pa'i ye shes thugs kyi me long ngo //
translated: are the meaning of the pure selflessness of pristine consciousness, the mirror of the mind.

original: rgyud kyi mtshan nyid ni brtson chen sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste /
analyzed: rgyud kyi mtshan nyid ni brtson chen sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of the tantra is the great diligence of the net of illusions.

original: rgyud kun gyi ni theg pa kun gyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud kun gyi ni theg pa kun gyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: It is the root of all vehicles of all tantras.

original: rdo rje gdan ni ma lus ldan ni rigs lnga'i gdan yin pa dang / sna tshogs rdo rje la zer ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gdan ni ma lus ldan ni rigs lnga'i gdan yin pa dang / sna tshogs rdo rje la zer ro //
translated: The vajra seat is the seat of the five families and is called the vajra cross.

original: 'di la sngon rje btsun gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na bzhugs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnam par 'phrul pa mdzad pa la rje btsun gyi spyi gtsug nas rnal 'byor chen po'i dkyil 'khor spro /
analyzed: 'di la sngon rje btsun gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na bzhugs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnam par 'phrul pa mdzad pa la rje btsun gyi spyi gtsug nas rnal 'byor chen po'i dkyil 'khor spro /
translated: In this regard, when the venerable one was dwelling in the abode of the lord of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods, he emanated the maṇḍala of the great yoga from the crown of his head,

original: smin mtshams nas rnal 'byor rgyud kyi lha tshogs spro /
analyzed: smin mtshams nas rnal 'byor rgyud kyi lha tshogs spro /
translated: and emanated the assembly of deities of the yoga tantra from his brow.

original: zhal dang lte ba nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs mang po spro /
analyzed: zhal dang lte ba nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs mang po spro /
translated: He emanated many assemblies of deities of the maṇḍala from his face and navel,

original: gsang ba nas nyan thos la sogs spro ba mdzad nas so //
analyzed: gsang ba nas nyan thos la sogs spro ba mdzad nas so //
translated: and emanated the śrāvakas and so forth from his secret place.

original: don dam par stong pa nyid kyi mchog la de nyid kyi snang ba 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par stong pa nyid kyi mchog la de nyid kyi snang ba 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate, he is the bearer of the supreme emptiness, apprehending the appearance of that itself.

original: des na skye ba de nyid sna tshogs su skye bar rtog pas na rje btsun chos sku 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: des na skye ba de nyid sna tshogs su skye bar rtog pas na rje btsun chos sku 'chang ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the venerable one who bears the dharmakāya, since he conceives of that very birth as various births.

original: ji ltar 'chang na chos thams cad shes rab chen por skyu ru ra lag tu bzhag pa dang 'dra bar mthong spang sgom spang gi nyon mongs pa spangs nas 'byung ba sel lo //
analyzed: ji ltar 'chang na chos thams cad shes rab chen por skyu ru ra lag tu bzhag pa dang 'dra bar mthong spang sgom spang gi nyon mongs pa spangs nas 'byung ba sel lo //
translated: How is it held? It is held as the great wisdom of all phenomena, like a myrobalan fruit held in the hand, and it arises by eliminating the afflictions to be abandoned during the path of seeing and the afflictions to be abandoned during the path of meditation.

original: dus de nas rtog pa gang gis kyang mi g-yo la gsal ba rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mngon sum du rtogs te zhing khams thams cad du rang rig pa mngon sum du rtogs pas ye shes chen po rab tu rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: dus de nas rtog pa gang gis kyang mi g-yo la gsal ba rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mngon sum du rtogs te zhing khams thams cad du rang rig pa mngon sum du rtogs pas ye shes chen po rab tu rgyas pa'o //
translated: From that time on, it is not moved by any concepts, and it realizes perfect enlightenment. Since it realizes reflexive awareness in all buddhafields, great wisdom expands.

original: 'jam dpal rnon po'i yon tan bstan pa'o /
analyzed: 'jam dpal rnon po'i yon tan bstan pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the qualities of sharp Mañjuśrī.

original: // / da ni mnyam nyid kyi ye shes de nyid gdul bya ser sna can gdul ba'i phyir 'jam dpal ngag gi dbang phyug gi skur bstan pa ni /
analyzed: // / da ni mnyam nyid kyi ye shes de nyid gdul bya ser sna can gdul ba'i phyir 'jam dpal ngag gi dbang phyug gi skur bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to tame stingy beings, that very wisdom of equality is taught as the body of Mañjuśrī, the Lord of Speech.

original: 'dod pa'i don grub nas nor bu rin chen tog ces pa 'dis sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don grub nas nor bu rin chen tog ces pa 'dis sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las bstan pa'o //
translated: Having accomplished the desired purpose, this is the precious jewel crest.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo gang zhe na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of the wisdom of equality?

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: It accomplishes the desired aims of all sentient beings.

original: ngan song nas dregs pas 'joms zhes pas ni phrin las bstan te /
analyzed: ngan song nas dregs pas 'joms zhes pas ni phrin las bstan te /
translated: “Subjugating the haughty from the lower realms” teaches the activity.

original: 'di la sngon rgyal bu legs sbyin bskyod ces bya bas mtshams med pa lnga byas pa'i rnam smin gyis mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal bar skyes so //
analyzed: 'di la sngon rgyal bu legs sbyin bskyod ces bya bas mtshams med pa lnga byas pa'i rnam smin gyis mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal bar skyes so //
translated: In the past, a prince named Supriya committed the five acts of immediate retribution. As a result, he was born in the Avīci Hell.

original: de la rje btsun 'jam dpal gyis byang chub sems dpa' legs sbyin du sprul nas ngan song sbyong ba'i @140b dkyil 'khor sprul nas rigs drug nas bton nas mthar sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de la rje btsun 'jam dpal gyis byang chub sems dpa' legs sbyin du sprul nas ngan song sbyong ba'i @140b dkyil 'khor sprul nas rigs drug nas bton nas mthar sangs rgyas so //
translated: The venerable Mañjuśrī emanated as the bodhisattva Supriya. He emanated the maṇḍala for purifying the lower realms and extracted [Supriya] from the six realms. In the end, [Supriya] became a buddha.

original: blo ldan nas rtse nas gnon zhes pas ni dregs pa can gdul ba'i phrin las ston te /
analyzed: blo ldan nas rtse nas gnon zhes pas ni dregs pa can gdul ba'i phrin las ston te /
translated: “The wise one suppresses the haughty from the peak” teaches the activity of subduing the haughty.

original: 'di la lha dang lha ma yin 'thab pa'i dus su lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan 'dzin bya ba lus dpag tshad khri phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad yod pa de'i lus phyed rgya mtsho'i nang du 'dug nas rked pa yan chad kyis gzhan 'phrul dbang byed🔽la mgo reg pa /
analyzed: 'di la lha dang lha ma yin 'thab pa'i dus su lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan 'dzin bya ba lus dpag tshad khri phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad yod pa de'i lus phyed rgya mtsho'i nang du 'dug nas rked pa yan chad kyis gzhan 'phrul dbang byed la mgo reg pa /
translated: Half of his body was in the ocean, and the upper half of his body🔽was touching the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations.

original: ri rab klad la bskor ba rgya mtsho hub kyis 'thung ba cig yod pa des lha kun pham par byas nas zhe sdang tshad du phyin pa de gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ri rab klad la bskor ba rgya mtsho hub kyis 'thung ba cig yod pa des lha kun pham par byas nas zhe sdang tshad du phyin pa de gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: He had defeated all the gods. In order to subdue him, who had reached the limit of hatred,

original: rje btsun gyis gzhung bzhin du sku bstan pas btul lo //
analyzed: rje btsun gyis gzhung bzhin du sku bstan pas btul lo //
translated: the venerable one displayed his body according to the scriptures and subdued him.

original: 'o na de ltar dngos po la gnas sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar dngos po la gnas sam zhe na /
translated: Well then, does he abide in things in that way?

original: don dam du gcig ste gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi don to //
analyzed: don dam du gcig ste gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi don to //
translated: In the ultimate, there is one, the meaning of the nondual Dharma.

original: de ltar rtogs na gang la yang bag mi tsha bas 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs na gang la yang bag mi tsha bas 'jigs pa med do //
translated: If one realizes it in that way, one is fearless because one is not anxious about anything.

original: rje btsun gnyis su med pa'i tshogs ye shes lngar gyur pas na rnam rig nas rgyud dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rje btsun gnyis su med pa'i tshogs ye shes lngar gyur pas na rnam rig nas rgyud dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since the assembly of the two exalted ones becomes the five pristine consciousnesses, they possess the tantra of awareness.

original: rje btsun snang stong gnyis la dgyes pa na /
analyzed: rje btsun snang stong gnyis la dgyes pa na /
translated: When the exalted ones delight in the two, appearance and emptiness,

original: dngos don nas chos kyi blo zhes pas bstan to //
analyzed: dngos don nas chos kyi blo zhes pas bstan to //
translated: the actual topic is indicated by “the mind of dharma” and so on.

original: 'o na mi dgos sam zhe na srid pa nas chen po pa zhes pas so //
analyzed: 'o na mi dgos sam zhe na srid pa nas chen po pa zhes pas so //
translated: If it is asked if that is not necessary, “existence” and so on are indicated.

original: sku dngos gang zhe na /
analyzed: sku dngos gang zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what is the actual body,

original: sprin dkar nas rgyan dang ldan pas bstan te /
analyzed: sprin dkar nas rgyan dang ldan pas bstan te /
translated: “ornamented” and so on indicate that.

original: 'di la sngon rgyal po'i khab na ston pas 'khor dpag tu med pa la chos ston pa'i dus su /
analyzed: 'di la sngon rgyal po'i khab na ston pas 'khor dpag tu med pa la chos ston pa'i dus su /
translated: Previously, when the Teacher was teaching dharma to an immeasurable retinue in Rājagṛha,

original: smad 'tshong ma'i bu mo gser mchog 'od dpag med bya ba yon tan mtha' dag dang ldan pa cig yod /
analyzed: smad 'tshong ma'i bu mo gser mchog 'od dpag med bya ba yon tan mtha' dag dang ldan pa cig yod /
translated: there was a prostitute’s daughter named Suvarṇaprabhā, who possessed all good qualities.

original: mo gang du phyin par mi kun 'du ba cig yod do //
analyzed: mo gang du phyin par mi kun 'du ba cig yod do //
translated: Wherever she went, everyone gathered.

original: bu mo des tshong dpon gyi bu 'jigs byin bya ba grogs su btsal te 'khor mang po dang skyed mos tshal du phyin pas /
analyzed: bu mo des tshong dpon gyi bu 'jigs byin bya ba grogs su btsal te 'khor mang po dang skyed mos tshal du phyin pas /
translated: That girl sought out a friend, the son of a merchant named Bhīma, and they went to a pleasure grove with a large retinue.

original: dus de'i tshe 'jam dpal nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas phyir byon pas bu mo'i mtshan ma gzigs nas /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe 'jam dpal nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas phyir byon pas bu mo'i mtshan ma gzigs nas /
translated: At that time, Manjushri arose from his meditative absorption and went outside. He saw the signs of the girl and

original: de 'dul ba'i dus la bab par mkhyen nas sprin dkar la sogs pa'i sku bstan nas /
analyzed: de 'dul ba'i dus la bab par mkhyen nas sprin dkar la sogs pa'i sku bstan nas /
translated: knew that the time had come to tame her. He displayed his body, such as with a white cloud,

original: sku'i 'od kyis nyi zla yang mog mog bor byas nas bu mo'i mdun du sku bstan pas tshong dpon bu dang bu mo rang yang mog mog por song bas der rang re'i lus la yi mug go //
analyzed: sku'i 'od kyis nyi zla yang mog mog bor byas nas bu mo'i mdun du sku bstan pas tshong dpon bu dang bu mo rang yang mog mog por song bas der rang re'i lus la yi mug go //
translated: and the light from his body obscured even the sun and moon. He displayed his body in front of the girl. The merchant and his son and daughter themselves became obscured. There, they were disgusted with their own bodies.

original: bu mos bsams pa tshong dpon gyi bus ci bya /🔽bdag nyid shing rta las bab la khyad par @141a * //
analyzed: bu mos bsams pa tshong dpon gyi bus ci bya / bdag nyid shing rta las bab la khyad par @141a * //
translated: The girl thought, “What is the merchant’s son doing?

original: du gyur pa'i mi 'di la gos kyang bslang khyo yang bya snyam mo //
analyzed: du gyur pa'i mi 'di la gos kyang bslang khyo yang bya snyam mo //
translated: I will get down from the chariot and ask for clothes from this extraordinary man. I will make him my husband.”

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa ngan pa skyes pa'i dus der rgyal po chen po bzhi mi'i lus su sprul nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa ngan pa skyes pa'i dus der rgyal po chen po bzhi mi'i lus su sprul nas /
translated: When such an evil thought arose, the four great kings emanated in human bodies

original: bu mo khyod de lta bu bsam ngan ma skyed cig / skyes bu 'di ni 'dod pa don du gnyer ba ma yin /
analyzed: bu mo khyod de lta bu bsam ngan ma skyed cig / skyes bu 'di ni 'dod pa don du gnyer ba ma yin /
translated: and said, “Girl, do not give rise to such an evil thought! This man is not seeking sensual pleasure.

original: bu mo na re su yin ji skad bya ba yin byas pas /
analyzed: bu mo na re su yin ji skad bya ba yin byas pas /
translated: The girl asked, Who is he? What is his name?

original: 'di ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal bya ba yin byas pas /
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal bya ba yin byas pas /
translated: The man replied, He is called the noble Manjushri.

original: bu mo na re 'jam dpal bya ba'i don ci yin byas pas /
analyzed: bu mo na re 'jam dpal bya ba'i don ci yin byas pas /
translated: The girl asked, What is the meaning of Manjushri?

original: 'di gang su la yang nyes pa'i zug rdu bral bas 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: 'di gang su la yang nyes pa'i zug rdu bral bas 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The man replied, He is called Manjushri because he is free of the pain of faults toward anyone.

original: bu mos bsams pa'o na gos 'di bslang yang slar ster bsam mo //
analyzed: bu mos bsams pa'o na gos 'di bslang yang slar ster bsam mo //
translated: The girl thought, If I ask for this garment, he will give it back to me.

original: der bslangs pas bu mo khyod yang dag pa'i byang chub la 'jug nus na ngas sbyin gsungs pas bu mo na re byang chub kyi don ji lta bu yin zhus pas /
analyzed: der bslangs pas bu mo khyod yang dag pa'i byang chub la 'jug nus na ngas sbyin gsungs pas bu mo na re byang chub kyi don ji lta bu yin zhus pas /
translated: When she asked for it, the man said, Girl, if you can enter into perfect enlightenment, I will give it to you. The girl asked, What is the meaning of enlightenment?

original: lan du gnyis su med pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba yin gsungs pas bu mos drod thob po //
analyzed: lan du gnyis su med pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba yin gsungs pas bu mos drod thob po //
translated: In reply, he said, It is nondual wisdom, emptiness free from all elaborations. The girl attained warmth.

original: de nas bu mos shing rta las babs nas rje btsun la bstod pa dang phyag dang skor ba byas nas rab tu byung bar zhu ba phul bas /
analyzed: de nas bu mos shing rta las babs nas rje btsun la bstod pa dang phyag dang skor ba byas nas rab tu byung bar zhu ba phul bas /
translated: Then the girl got down from the chariot and made praises, prostrations, and circumambulations to the venerable one. She offered a request to go forth.

original: bu mo rab tu ma byung bar shing rta la zhon la nags stug por song la /
analyzed: bu mo rab tu ma byung bar shing rta la zhon la nags stug por song la /
translated: The girl was not yet a nun. She was to ride in a chariot and go to a dense forest.

original: mi 'jigs sbyin gyi gam du song la lus sbyin par gyis gsungs nas /
analyzed: mi 'jigs sbyin gyi gam du song la lus sbyin par gyis gsungs nas /
translated: Go to Abhayadana and give your body to him.

original: der bu mos skyed mos tshal du shing rta la zhon nas phyin nas tshong dpon gyi bu dang dga' ba'i rtsed mo mang du byas so //
analyzed: der bu mos skyed mos tshal du shing rta la zhon nas phyin nas tshong dpon gyi bu dang dga' ba'i rtsed mo mang du byas so //
translated: There, the girl went to the pleasure garden, riding in a chariot, and had many delightful games with the merchant's son.

original: dus de'i tshe 'jam dpal gyis 'khor dpag tu med pa la dam pa'i chos kyis tshim par byas so //
analyzed: dus de'i tshe 'jam dpal gyis 'khor dpag tu med pa la dam pa'i chos kyis tshim par byas so //
translated: At that time, Manjushri satisfied an immeasurable retinue with the holy Dharma.

original: der bu mo des na ba'i tshul bstan nas tshong dpon gyi bu'i phang par mgo bor ro /
analyzed: der bu mo des na ba'i tshul bstan nas tshong dpon gyi bu'i phang par mgo bor ro /
translated: There, the girl displayed the manner of being sick and placed her head on the lap of the merchant's son.

original: der lus kun rnyings /
analyzed: der lus kun rnyings /
translated: There, her whole body became old,

original: rul mnam / bam nas tshong dpon gyi bus mya ngan chen po byas /
analyzed: rul mnam / bam nas tshong dpon gyi bus mya ngan chen po byas /
translated: stinking, and rotten. The merchant's son was greatly saddened.

original: der tshong dpon bu skra gnas bzhag la 'bros snyam pas rgyal po ma skyes dgras chad pa gcod du 'ong snyam nas 'khor kun dang 'o dod 'bod pa las /
analyzed: der tshong dpon bu skra gnas bzhag la 'bros snyam pas rgyal po ma skyes dgras chad pa gcod du 'ong snyam nas 'khor kun dang 'o dod 'bod pa las /
translated: There, the merchant's son, with his hair disheveled, thought to flee, and thinking that King Ajatashatru would come to punish him, he cried out in distress to all his retinue.

original: de nas rje btsun gyi byin gyis brlabs pa las shing gi lha mos bskul nas tshigs bcad 'di byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas rje btsun gyi byin gyis brlabs pa las shing gi lha mos bskul nas tshigs bcad 'di byung ngo //
translated: Then, by the blessing of the Jetsun, the tree goddess, being urged, spoke this verse:

original: 'jig rten thams cad yang dag min //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad yang dag min //
translated: All worlds are not real,

original: ji ltar mthong ba sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: As seen, they are like illusions.

original: khye'u ji ltar mthong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: khye'u ji ltar mthong 'gyur ba //
translated: How can a child see?

original: chos rnams de yi rang bzhin las //
analyzed: chos rnams de yi rang bzhin las //
translated: All dharmas are like that.

original: 'di ni mi rtag mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag mtshan nyid yin //
translated: This is the characteristic of impermanence.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra byung bas tshong @141b dpon gyi bus chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur go nas /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra byung bas tshong @141b dpon gyi bus chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur go nas /
translated: Thus, the sound of these words and so forth arose. The son of the merchant understood that all dharmas are like illusions.

original: ro de bor nas nags su sgom du 'ong ba rje btsun dang mjal nas gdams ngag byin nas der bu des dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: ro de bor nas nags su sgom du 'ong ba rje btsun dang mjal nas gdams ngag byin nas der bu des dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: Having thrown away the corpse, he came to meditate in the forest. Meeting the Jetsun, he was given instructions and there the son attained the fruit of an arhat.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa ni rje btsun nyid 'gro don mdzad pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa ni rje btsun nyid 'gro don mdzad pas /
translated: “ Shaking a hundred world systems” is the Jetsun himself working for the benefit of beings.

original: sa dang po nas bcu pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa dang po nas bcu pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied from the first bhumi up to the tenth.

original: der ma zad rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dran pa bcu bzhi dang / yan lag bdun dang / ma 'dres ba bzhi bcu dang / 'phags lam brgyad dang / des na yang dag lam rig pa'o //
analyzed: der ma zad rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dran pa bcu bzhi dang / yan lag bdun dang / ma 'dres ba bzhi bcu dang / 'phags lam brgyad dang / des na yang dag lam rig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he is the one who knows the right path, because he is the one who has the four bases of magic power, the fourteen recollections, the seven limbs, the forty unmixed dharmas, and the eightfold noble path.

original: 'gro ba'i don mdzad tshul ni sems can nas 'phrog ces pa ste ;
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don mdzad tshul ni sems can nas 'phrog ces pa ste ;
translated: The way he acts for the welfare of beings is as follows:

original: rje btsun sems can la ji ltar don mdzad na sems can kun la zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rje btsun sems can la ji ltar don mdzad na sems can kun la zhes pa'o //
translated: How does the Lord act for the welfare of beings? He acts for the welfare of all beings.

original: sems can ji ltar chags na sems can yid nas 'phrog pa zhes pas bstan te /
analyzed: sems can ji ltar chags na sems can yid nas 'phrog pa zhes pas bstan te /
translated: How does he act for the welfare of beings? He acts for the welfare of beings by taking them to his heart.

original: sngon dri med kyi bskal pa la rgyal po glog sbyin la bu mo khyad par du gyur pa cig yod de /
analyzed: sngon dri med kyi bskal pa la rgyal po glog sbyin la bu mo khyad par du gyur pa cig yod de /
translated: In the past, in a stainless eon, there was a king named Vidyuddatta who had a very special daughter.

original: bu mo g-yog dang khang steng du nyal tsam na nam mkha' la skar ma lta zhing yod pa la snang ngor rje btsun la 'khor rdo rje 'dzin pa stong gis bskor nas song ba ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bu mo g-yog dang khang steng du nyal tsam na nam mkha' la skar ma lta zhing yod pa la snang ngor rje btsun la 'khor rdo rje 'dzin pa stong gis bskor nas song ba ma mthong ngo //
translated: When the girl was sleeping with her attendants on the roof of the house, she saw in the sky the Lord surrounded by a retinue of a thousand vajra holders.

original: 'od zer gyis nam mkha' gang bar mthong nas bu mo la 'od phog pas bde ba thob bo //
analyzed: 'od zer gyis nam mkha' gang bar mthong nas bu mo la 'od phog pas bde ba thob bo //
translated: The girl saw the light filling the sky and was happy to be touched by it.

original: der bu mos langs nas thal mo sbyar phyag btsal gsol ba btab pas rje btsun mdun gyi nam mkha' la byon nas bu mo la chos bshad do //
analyzed: der bu mos langs nas thal mo sbyar phyag btsal gsol ba btab pas rje btsun mdun gyi nam mkha' la byon nas bu mo la chos bshad do //
translated: She stood up, put her palms together, bowed, and made a request. The Jetsun came to the sky in front of her and taught the dharma to the girl.

original: dus der srog chags khri phrag drug cu 'dus pas la las sku mthong bas grol /
analyzed: dus der srog chags khri phrag drug cu 'dus pas la las sku mthong bas grol /
translated: At that time, sixty thousand living beings gathered. Some were liberated by seeing the Jetsun’s body.

original: la las gsung thos pas /🔽la las reg pas /🔽la las 'od zer gyis /
analyzed: la las gsung thos pas / la las reg pas / la las 'od zer gyis /
translated: Some were liberated by hearing his speech.🔽Some were liberated by touching him.

original: la las 'o byas pas /🔽la las mthong bas /
analyzed: la las 'o byas pas / la las mthong bas /
translated: Some were liberated by the light rays.🔽Some were liberated by kissing him.🔽Some were liberated by seeing him.

original: la las bzhad pas /🔽la la la thugs kyi dgongs pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob /
analyzed: la las bzhad pas / la la la thugs kyi dgongs pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob /
translated: Some were liberated by his laughter.🔽Some were liberated by the intention of his mind.

original: la la grol bar gyur to //
analyzed: la la grol bar gyur to //
translated: Some were liberated by the sound of his speech.

original: des na ma lus yid 'phrog pa'o //🔽phung po lnga yang sgyu mar shes //
analyzed: des na ma lus yid 'phrog pa'o // phung po lnga yang sgyu mar shes //
translated: Thus, he captivated everyone without exception.🔽He knew the five aggregates to be illusory.

original: rnam dag lnga 'chang bas mthar thug la gnas shing de mkhas pas na de kun ston pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam dag lnga 'chang bas mthar thug la gnas shing de mkhas pas na de kun ston pa'o ;
translated: He was skilled in the five pure aspects, and thus he was the teacher of all.

original: / rten 'brel bcu gnyis spangs pa'i dag pa bcu gnyis yod pa /
analyzed: / rten 'brel bcu gnyis spangs pa'i dag pa bcu gnyis yod pa /
translated: There are twelve purities, which are the abandonment of the twelve links of dependent origination.🔽

original: bden pa bzhi dang bcu gnyis dang bcu drug dang stong pa nyid nyi shu dang ldan pas kun rig mchog go //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi dang bcu gnyis dang bcu drug dang stong pa nyid nyi shu dang ldan pas kun rig mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme knower of all because he possesses the twelve pure aspects that abandon the twelve links of dependent origination, the four truths, the twelve, the sixteen, and the twenty emptinesses.

original: sprul sku mang po mkhyen cing sems can gyi rtog pa kun rdzob tu theg pa gsum la don dam du theg pa @142a * //
analyzed: sprul sku mang po mkhyen cing sems can gyi rtog pa kun rdzob tu theg pa gsum la don dam du theg pa @142a * //
translated: He is the supreme knower of all because he knows the many nirmāṇakāyas and realizes that the concepts of sentient beings are the three vehicles on the relative level and the one vehicle on the ultimate level.

original: gcig tu rtogs pas na dri ma mtha' dag zad pas ni nyon mongs nas gtan spangs pa'o zhes pas bstan no //
analyzed: gcig tu rtogs pas na dri ma mtha' dag zad pas ni nyon mongs nas gtan spangs pa'o zhes pas bstan no //
translated: He is the supreme knower of all because he has completely exhausted all stains and has abandoned afflictions forever.

original: don mdzad pa'i thabs snying rje dang shes rab gnyis kyis 'gro don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: don mdzad pa'i thabs snying rje dang shes rab gnyis kyis 'gro don mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the supreme knower of all because he benefits beings with both compassion and wisdom, the methods for accomplishing benefit.

original: 'du shes don gzung 'dzin rnam shes don dam zhen pa dang bral bas sangs rgyas dang sems can rtogs pas kun rdzob tu 'dod pa sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: 'du shes don gzung 'dzin rnam shes don dam zhen pa dang bral bas sangs rgyas dang sems can rtogs pas kun rdzob tu 'dod pa sgrub pa ni /
translated: He is the supreme knower of all because he realizes buddhas and sentient beings and accomplishes the relative truth by being free of the ultimate clinging to the meaning of the dualistic consciousness that apprehends objects.

original: yid nas 'khrul pa med ces pas bstan te /
analyzed: yid nas 'khrul pa med ces pas bstan te /
translated: He is the supreme knower of all because he is free of mental confusion.

original: sngon rgyal po gsal stobs la sras blta na sdug pa cig byung ste /
analyzed: sngon rgyal po gsal stobs la sras blta na sdug pa cig byung ste /
translated: In the past, King Prasthabala had a son named Sudarśana.

original: dus tshod cig na skyed mos tshal du 'ongs pas lam na yi dgas mang po 'dug nas bskal par chu'i sgra mi grag par mthong nas der kun slong ba la rgyal bus sprul pa byas te kun gyis ma mthong /
analyzed: dus tshod cig na skyed mos tshal du 'ongs pas lam na yi dgas mang po 'dug nas bskal par chu'i sgra mi grag par mthong nas der kun slong ba la rgyal bus sprul pa byas te kun gyis ma mthong /
translated: At one time, when he came to the garden, he saw many hungry ghosts on the road. For an eon, the sound of water was not heard. When he asked everyone about it, the prince emanated a form that no one could see.

original: der pha ma la nor mang po blangs nas sbyin pa byas pas kun tshim par byas /
analyzed: der pha ma la nor mang po blangs nas sbyin pa byas pas kun tshim par byas /
translated: There, he took much wealth from his parents and gave it as gifts, satisfying everyone.

original: de yid dgas kyis yog tshad zos pas kun gsus pa gas ;
analyzed: de yid dgas kyis yog tshad zos pas kun gsus pa gas ;
translated: Since all the hungry ghosts ate as much as they wanted, their bellies split open.

original: der rgyal bus smon lam btab pas kun sum cu rtsa gsum du skyes so //
analyzed: der rgyal bus smon lam btab pas kun sum cu rtsa gsum du skyes so //
translated: There, the prince made aspirations, and everyone was reborn in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: de nas dbul po cig gi khyim du 'ongs pas kun phyug por gyur nas der sbyin pa mang po gtong du bcug kun tshim par byas /
analyzed: de nas dbul po cig gi khyim du 'ongs pas kun phyug por gyur nas der sbyin pa mang po gtong du bcug kun tshim par byas /
translated: Then, when he came to the house of a poor person, everyone became rich. There, he had them give many gifts, satisfying everyone.

original: der dus tshod cig na rgyal pos chad pa bcad pa'i mi cig la yan lag bcad nas lam na 'dug pa de na re /
analyzed: der dus tshod cig na rgyal pos chad pa bcad pa'i mi cig la yan lag bcad nas lam na 'dug pa de na re /
translated: At one time, a man who had been sentenced by the king was standing on the road with his limbs cut off. He said,

original: khyod la bsod nams dang stobs yin nam zer nas yin byas pas nga la phan thogs zer nas rgyal bu snying rje skyes nas rang gi rkang lag bcad nas de la btags pas 'byar ro //
analyzed: khyod la bsod nams dang stobs yin nam zer nas yin byas pas nga la phan thogs zer nas rgyal bu snying rje skyes nas rang gi rkang lag bcad nas de la btags pas 'byar ro //
translated: When he asked, Do you have merit and power? the man said, I do. Then it will be helpful to me, said the prince. Out of compassion, the prince cut off his own arms and legs and attached them to the man. They stuck.

original: der brgya byin 'ongs nas 'chi ba yin byas pas nga da rung bskal par lus gtong zer nas der brgya byin ya mtshan skyes nas smon lam btab pas lus snga ma ltar gyur to //
analyzed: der brgya byin 'ongs nas 'chi ba yin byas pas nga da rung bskal par lus gtong zer nas der brgya byin ya mtshan skyes nas smon lam btab pas lus snga ma ltar gyur to //
translated: When Indra came and said, You will die, the prince said, I will give up my body for an eon. Indra was amazed and made an aspiration, and the prince's body became as it was before.

original: sems can yid nas 'khrul pa med pas na dus gsum gyi bdag go //
analyzed: sems can yid nas 'khrul pa med pas na dus gsum gyi bdag go //
translated: Since there is no confusion in the mind of a sentient being, it is the self of the three times.

original: phung po'i don skad cig mas sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas na /
analyzed: phung po'i don skad cig mas sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas na /
translated: Since the meaning of the aggregates is realized to be like an illusion through the moment,

original: skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas so //
translated: buddhahood is perfected in a single moment.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin ni gnyis med 'chang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin ni gnyis med 'chang ngo //
translated: The nature of all buddhas is the bearer of nonduality.

original: lus dang lus kyi mchog dang kun tu ston no //
analyzed: lus dang lus kyi mchog dang kun tu ston no //
translated: The body, the supreme body, and the display

original: 'bras bu sku gsum /
analyzed: 'bras bu sku gsum /
translated: The result is the three kāyas.

original: rin chen tog ni kun gyi nang nas 'phags pa tog go //
analyzed: rin chen tog ni kun gyi nang nas 'phags pa tog go //
translated: Ratnaketu is the most exalted of all.

original: rtse mo ste mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rtse mo ste mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The peak is the gnosis of equality.

original: 'jam dpal ngag @142b gi dbang phyug gi yon tan no /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ngag @142b gi dbang phyug gi yon tan no /
translated: The qualities of Mañjuśrī, the lord of speech.

original: // / da ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes de nyid 'gro ba gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes de nyid 'gro ba gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to tame transmigrating beings, that very gnosis of successful activities

original: 'jam dpal ye shes sku can gyi skur bsten pa ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes sku can gyi skur bsten pa ni /
translated: is relied upon as the body of Mañjuśrī, the gnosis body.

original: sangs rgyas nas dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog gis bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nas dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog gis bstan te /
translated: Having become a buddha, the supreme glory is taught.

original: bya ba nan tan gyi ya shes kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: bya ba nan tan gyi ya shes kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the gnosis of successful activities

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rtogs par bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rtogs par bya ba ni /
translated: is the realization of all buddhas.

original: byang chub bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub bla na med pa'o //
translated: That is unsurpassed awakening.

original: de'i sku gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i sku gang zhe na /
translated: What is its body?

original: gsang sngags las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from mantra.

original: 'o na dngos po ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po ci yod ce na /
translated: Well then, what is its entity?

original: yi ge med de brjod pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge med de brjod pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is without syllables, free from expression.

original: kun rdzob tu sku gsung thugs bskyed pa dang / phrin las bzhi'i don bskyed ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sku gsung thugs bskyed pa dang / phrin las bzhi'i don bskyed ba'o //
translated: In the relative, the body, speech, and mind are generated, and the four activities are generated.

original: bcu drug nas /
analyzed: bcu drug nas /
translated: From the sixteenth

original: rgyud rig pa zhes pas /
analyzed: rgyud rig pa zhes pas /
translated: to “one who knows the tantra,”

original: gang zag gsum gyi 'jug lugs bstan te /
analyzed: gang zag gsum gyi 'jug lugs bstan te /
translated: the mode of engagement of the three types of persons is taught.

original: bla ma'i zhal la rag las so //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal la rag las so //
translated: It depends on the guru’s mouth.

original: kun rdzob tu sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las bzhi'i don bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las bzhi'i don bskyed pa'o //
translated: In terms of the relative, the meaning of the four—body, speech, mind, and activity—is generated.

original: don la thig le brjod pa dang bral ba stong pa chen po yi ge lnga mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: don la thig le brjod pa dang bral ba stong pa chen po yi ge lnga mtshon pa'o //
translated: In actuality, the five syllables illustrate the great emptiness free from expression, the bindu.

original: yi ge drug ni yi ge drug tu mtshon ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge drug ni yi ge drug tu mtshon ba'o //
translated: The six syllables illustrate the six syllables.

original: de'i dngos po rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rigs lnga yang man ngag gis rnam par bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rigs lnga yang man ngag gis rnam par bstod pa'o //
translated: The entities of those are the five families, such as Vairocana, and so on, praised by the intimate instructions.

original: de'i thabs gang gis rtogs par bya na /
analyzed: de'i thabs gang gis rtogs par bya na /
translated: If it is asked by what method is that realized,

original: ting nge 'dzin nas dbang phyug po zhes pas sku gnyis dang sprul sku rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nas dbang phyug po zhes pas sku gnyis dang sprul sku rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: “samādhi” and so on explain the two kāyas and the nirmāṇakāya in detail.

original: de lta bu srid pa spangs pa las byung ba na srid ba na sbyin bdag chen po zhes pas bstan te /
analyzed: de lta bu srid pa spangs pa las byung ba na srid ba na sbyin bdag chen po zhes pas bstan te /
translated: If it is asked from what is such a one born, “the great lord of generosity in existence” is explained.

original: 'di la sngon rgyal po mu khyud 'dzin bya ba 'khor los sgyur ba gling bzhi la dbang byed pa kun la mnyam pa nyid du byed pa bde ba la 'god pa cig byung /
analyzed: 'di la sngon rgyal po mu khyud 'dzin bya ba 'khor los sgyur ba gling bzhi la dbang byed pa kun la mnyam pa nyid du byed pa bde ba la 'god pa cig byung /
translated: In the past, there was a cakravartin king called Sūryavaṃśa who ruled the four continents and acted equally toward all, establishing them in happiness.

original: de lta bu de sum cu rtsa gsum nas chos bzangs lha'i 'dun sar spyan drangs nas lha rnams kyi dbang pos stan phyed bshugs pa las ma bsdad de bzhud nas mthar sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de lta bu de sum cu rtsa gsum nas chos bzangs lha'i 'dun sar spyan drangs nas lha rnams kyi dbang pos stan phyed bshugs pa las ma bsdad de bzhud nas mthar sangs rgyas so //
translated: He was invited to the assembly of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, where he was given half of the throne of Indra, but he did not stay. He left and eventually became a buddha.

original: de la sras gnyis yod pa la chos bzangs dang chos shes gnyis 'khrungs nas rgyal srid bzung nas yod pa la ;
analyzed: de la sras gnyis yod pa la chos bzangs dang chos shes gnyis 'khrungs nas rgyal srid bzung nas yod pa la ;
translated: He had two sons. After Dhṛtimān and Dhṛtaśrī were born, they took over the kingdom.

original: chos bzangs kyis 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid la skyo ba skyes nas /
analyzed: chos bzangs kyis 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid la skyo ba skyes nas /
translated: Dhṛtimān became weary of the characteristics of samsara.

original: der sangs rgyas mngon 'phags thos nas /
analyzed: der sangs rgyas mngon 'phags thos nas /
translated: He heard that the Buddha had appeared in the world.

original: nu bo la 'dir shog dang byas pas byung nas /
analyzed: nu bo la 'dir shog dang byas pas byung nas /
translated: He said to his younger brother, “Come here!”

original: nu bo'o cag gnyis bros la chos la 'deng byas pas /
analyzed: nu bo'o cag gnyis bros la chos la 'deng byas pas /
translated: “The two of us should run away and go to the Dharma.”

original: nu bo btsun mo la chags nas 'gro ma nus /
analyzed: nu bo btsun mo la chags nas 'gro ma nus /
translated: His younger brother was attached to his queen and could not go.

original: @143a * // chos bzangs kyis gser srang bye ba khyer nas mkhar las mchongs te /
analyzed: @143a * // chos bzangs kyis gser srang bye ba khyer nas mkhar las mchongs te /
translated: Dhṛtimān took ten million ounces of gold and jumped from the palace.

original: sangs rgyas mngon 'phags la phul nas rab tu byung lo bcu gnyis su chos nyan nas yul du phyin nas bu smad dang 'khor kun la mi rtag ba'i mtshan nyid bshad pas kun thar pa la bkod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mngon 'phags la phul nas rab tu byung lo bcu gnyis su chos nyan nas yul du phyin nas bu smad dang 'khor kun la mi rtag ba'i mtshan nyid bshad pas kun thar pa la bkod do //
translated: He offered them to the Buddha Abhyudgata and became a monk. For twelve years he listened to the Dharma and then returned to his country. He explained the characteristics of impermanence to his wife and children and his retinue, and he established them all in liberation.

original: nu bo chos shes la mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan pas der yid byung nas rab tu byung /
analyzed: nu bo chos shes la mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan pas der yid byung nas rab tu byung /
translated: His younger brother, Dharmasubhūti, was taught the method of meditating on the repulsive. He became disgusted and went forth.

original: der chos bzangs kyis 'gro ba kun la chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pas kun tshim par byas nas phyogs thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: der chos bzangs kyis 'gro ba kun la chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pas kun tshim par byas nas phyogs thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: There, Dharmasubhūti satisfied all beings with the gifts of Dharma and material things and turned the wheel of Dharma in all directions.

original: mthar mngon par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mthar mngon par sangs rgyas so //
translated: In the end, he attained manifest enlightenment.

original: chos shes byang chub sems dpa' rin chen mchog tu gyur nas 'jam dpal la lo stong du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can thams cad la chos kyi sbyin bdag byas so //
analyzed: chos shes byang chub sems dpa' rin chen mchog tu gyur nas 'jam dpal la lo stong du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can thams cad la chos kyi sbyin bdag byas so //
translated: Dharmasubhūti became the bodhisattva Ratnottama. For a thousand years he turned the wheel of Dharma for Mañjuśrī and became the giver of the gift of Dharma to all sentient beings.

original: rje btsun gyi phrin las kyi yon tan ni byams pa'i go cha nas 'jig rten 'dren zhes pas bstan te /
analyzed: rje btsun gyi phrin las kyi yon tan ni byams pa'i go cha nas 'jig rten 'dren zhes pas bstan te /
translated: The good qualities of the Jetsun's activity are shown by the line, The armor of love, the guide of the world.

original: 'di ni rje btsun mig ser na zhugs pa'i dus su byang chub sems dpa' zla mdzes bya ba gdams ngag zhur 'ongs pas /
analyzed: 'di ni rje btsun mig ser na zhugs pa'i dus su byang chub sems dpa' zla mdzes bya ba gdams ngag zhur 'ongs pas /
translated: This refers to the time when the Jetsun was afflicted with jaundice. A bodhisattva named Sumana came to request instructions.

original: yul de na bdud dang mu stegs mang po yod pa gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yul de na bdud dang mu stegs mang po yod pa gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to subdue the many demons and tirthikas in that land,

original: rje btsun gyis rgyal por sprul nas spyod pa mdzad do //🔽de yang btson khang ba mang po'i nang na sems can mig phyung ba dang / yan lag bcad pa mang po bcug / la la lcags thag la brgyus /
analyzed: rje btsun gyis rgyal por sprul nas spyod pa mdzad do // de yang btson khang ba mang po'i nang na sems can mig phyung ba dang / yan lag bcad pa mang po bcug / la la lcags thag la brgyus /
translated: the Jetsun emanated as a king and engaged in conduct.🔽In the prison, he saw many sentient beings with their eyes gouged out and their limbs cut off, some chained with iron shackles,

original: mi la la bsad pa dang / rke bcad pa'i mgo mang po bcer ba mthong /
analyzed: mi la la bsad pa dang / rke bcad pa'i mgo mang po bcer ba mthong /
translated: and many heads of people who had been killed and beheaded.

original: la la 'khun /
analyzed: la la 'khun /
translated: Some were moaning,

original: la la 'o dod 'bod pa mang po thos nas /
analyzed: la la 'o dod 'bod pa mang po thos nas /
translated: and he heard many cries of lamentation.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' des rje btsun tshol du 'ongs pas mi la dris pas grong khyer na spyod pa mdzad zer nas de rnams mthong bas skrag nas phyir log pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' des rje btsun tshol du 'ongs pas mi la dris pas grong khyer na spyod pa mdzad zer nas de rnams mthong bas skrag nas phyir log pas /
translated: When he saw the Jetsun, he was frightened and turned to leave.

original: nam mkha' nas mar lha'i bu rnams na re /
analyzed: nam mkha' nas mar lha'i bu rnams na re /
translated: Then, from the sky, the celestial beings said:

original: skal bar ldan pa'i gang zag khyed //
analyzed: skal bar ldan pa'i gang zag khyed //
translated: You are a fortunate person,

original: zab mo'i gdams ngag khyed 'dod na //
analyzed: zab mo'i gdams ngag khyed 'dod na //
translated: If you want the profound instructions,

original: rje btsun spyod pa mdzad pa yin ;
analyzed: rje btsun spyod pa mdzad pa yin ;
translated: The Jetsun is performing the Action.

original: / the tshom ma za gdams ngag zhus //
analyzed: / the tshom ma za gdams ngag zhus //
translated: Do not doubt, but ask him for instructions.

original: zer nas nang du phyin tsam na rje btsun seng ge'i khri la bzhugs nas ral gri dang mda' gzhu dang po ti bsnams nas bzhugs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: zer nas nang du phyin tsam na rje btsun seng ge'i khri la bzhugs nas ral gri dang mda' gzhu dang po ti bsnams nas bzhugs pa mthong ngo //
translated: When the Bodhisattva returned to the Jetsun, he saw him sitting on a lion-throne, holding a sword, a bow and arrow, and a volume of the Tantras.

original: de'i tshe nyam nga ba'i 'jigs pa de tsho med nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyam nga ba'i 'jigs pa de tsho med nas /
translated: At that moment, the fear and terror of the Bodhisattva disappeared.

original: der chos zhus pas chos thams cad sgyu ma la @143b sogs par bstan pas bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa bred nas thar pa la bkod do //
analyzed: der chos zhus pas chos thams cad sgyu ma la @143b sogs par bstan pas bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa bred nas thar pa la bkod do //
translated: He then received the Dharma from the Jetsun, who taught him the Illusions and other doctrines. The demons, heretics, and others were frightened and converted to the Dharma.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thabs des 'gro ba 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thabs des 'gro ba 'dren pa'o //
translated: The perfect Buddha leads beings by that method.

original: de lta bu rje btsun de mchod pa'i gnas bstod pa dang phyag dang rim gro dang bkur sti'i gnas yin pas na bla ma'o //
analyzed: de lta bu rje btsun de mchod pa'i gnas bstod pa dang phyag dang rim gro dang bkur sti'i gnas yin pas na bla ma'o //
translated: He is the Guru because he is the object of worship, praise, homage, service, and honor of that kind.

original: 'jig rten gsum po rnam par gnon ni sngon gyi dus na lha tshangs pa chen po des khams gsum gyi sems can sprul tsam na kho'i sgo nga las byung bas na kun la dbang byed pa yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po rnam par gnon ni sngon gyi dus na lha tshangs pa chen po des khams gsum gyi sems can sprul tsam na kho'i sgo nga las byung bas na kun la dbang byed pa yod do //
translated: He is the Conqueror of the Three Worlds because in former times, when the great god Brahma emanated the beings of the three worlds, he was born from Brahma's egg, and so he had power over all.

original: de'i dregs pa gdul ba'i phyir rje btsun gyis khams gsum du gom pa gcig gis brkyang nas mnan pa'i skus khams gsum dus gcig tu nam mkha'i khams gang bas mnan pas lha tshangs pa'i dregs pa zhi'o //
analyzed: de'i dregs pa gdul ba'i phyir rje btsun gyis khams gsum du gom pa gcig gis brkyang nas mnan pa'i skus khams gsum dus gcig tu nam mkha'i khams gang bas mnan pas lha tshangs pa'i dregs pa zhi'o //
translated: In order to subdue his pride, the Lord extended his body with one step and pressed down on the three worlds, filling the whole realm of space with his body, and so he subdued the pride of the god Brahma.

original: bram ze'i spyod pa mdzad pas gsum rig go //
analyzed: bram ze'i spyod pa mdzad pas gsum rig go //
translated: He is the Triviṣṭapa because he performed the conduct of a Brahmin.

original: mngon shes drug rjes dran drug dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che'o //
analyzed: mngon shes drug rjes dran drug dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che'o //
translated: He is the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, because he has the six superknowledges and the six recollections.

original: gong ma lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mdzad do //
analyzed: gong ma lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mdzad do //
translated: He performed the above-mentioned miracles.

original: rtogs pa'i ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gnyis med thob bo //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gnyis med thob bo //
translated: He attained the non-dual perfection of wisdom, the wisdom of realization.

original: rang gzhan don gnyis rdzogs pas kun la phan pa dpe las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rang gzhan don gnyis rdzogs pas kun la phan pa dpe las 'das pa'o //
translated: Since he perfected the benefit of self and other, he is beneficial to all, beyond comparison.

original: shes dang shes bya dbyings dang ye shes gnyis ka'i bdag po mchog go //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya dbyings dang ye shes gnyis ka'i bdag po mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme lord of both the knower and the known, the expanse and wisdom.

original: gtso bo chos kyi sbyin bdag nas don ston pa zhes pas sngon bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig 'das pa'i dus na sangs rgyas rnam gzigs kyi bskal pa la sdig pa byed pa'i dge slong drug byung /
analyzed: gtso bo chos kyi sbyin bdag nas don ston pa zhes pas sngon bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig 'das pa'i dus na sangs rgyas rnam gzigs kyi bskal pa la sdig pa byed pa'i dge slong drug byung /
translated: The chief Dharma benefactor, from the time of showing the meaning of the Dharma, in the past, ninety-one eons ago, during the eon of Buddha Vipaśyin, there were six monks who committed misdeeds.

original: shin tu mthong dang / nye lha dang / dga' byed dang / dge byed dang / grags pa dang / me sbyin drug byung /
analyzed: shin tu mthong dang / nye lha dang / dga' byed dang / dge byed dang / grags pa dang / me sbyin drug byung /
translated: They were Sudarśana, Upagupta, Nanda, Upaśānta, Yaśas, and Agni.

original: khong tshos mi khyim lnga brgya log lta la bkod par dam bcas so //
analyzed: khong tshos mi khyim lnga brgya log lta la bkod par dam bcas so //
translated: They vowed to lead five hundred families astray.

original: ma 'khod pa bsad par byas so //
analyzed: ma 'khod pa bsad par byas so //
translated: They decided to kill those who did not join them.

original: de chos rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhi mi rtag pa /
analyzed: de chos rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhi mi rtag pa /
translated: He taught the four seals of the Dharma: impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba /
translated: suffering,

original: stong pa / bdag med pa las log nas /
analyzed: stong pa / bdag med pa las log nas /
translated: They turned away from emptiness, selflessness, and said,

original: rtag pa bde ba /
analyzed: rtag pa bde ba /
translated: Permanence, happiness,

original: yod pa kun la bstan no //
analyzed: yod pa kun la bstan no //
translated: and existence are taught to be all-pervading.

original: sangs rgyas rnam gzigs kyi dge slong gzhan rnams kyis ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam gzigs kyi dge slong gzhan rnams kyis ;
translated: The other monks of Buddha Vipaśyin

original: /'dus byas thams cad mi rtag la //
analyzed: /'dus byas thams cad mi rtag la //
translated: said, All conditioned things are impermanent,

original: chos kun la ni bdag med cing //
analyzed: chos kun la ni bdag med cing //
translated: all phenomena are selfless,

original: bdag med ther zug med do zhes //
analyzed: bdag med ther zug med do zhes //
translated: and the self is neither permanent nor eternal.

original: 'dren pa rnams kyis mngon par bshad //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams kyis mngon par bshad //
translated: This is what the guides have clearly taught.

original: byas shing sgor bsod snyoms byas pas /
analyzed: byas shing sgor bsod snyoms byas pas /
translated: Having made offerings and alms,

original: la las bsad /
analyzed: la las bsad /
translated: some were killed,

original: la las bzung ngo //🔽de'i khyim bdag bde ba bya ba'i chung @144a * //
analyzed: la las bzung ngo // de'i khyim bdag bde ba bya ba'i chung @144a * //
translated: and some were captured.

original: ma 'od 'phro can bya ba la bu mtshan dang ldan pa cig byung /
analyzed: ma 'od 'phro can bya ba la bu mtshan dang ldan pa cig byung /
translated: The householder's wife, named Māyādevī, gave birth to a son with auspicious marks.

original: btsas ma thag tu bdag lta ba log pa can du skyol zer nas /
analyzed: btsas ma thag tu bdag lta ba log pa can du skyol zer nas /
translated: As soon as he was born, he said, I will lead those with wrong views.

original: ma bred nas mngon shes can la bstan snyam pa la /
analyzed: ma bred nas mngon shes can la bstan snyam pa la /
translated: Fearing this, she thought of showing him to those with supernormal knowledge.

original: ma gcig bstan mi dgos lta ba log pa 'di rnams lta ba ma log par bya snyam pa yin /
analyzed: ma gcig bstan mi dgos lta ba log pa 'di rnams lta ba ma log par bya snyam pa yin /
translated: But she thought, There is no need to show him to anyone. I will lead those with wrong views to the correct view.

original: rdzas dang yo byad kun sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs la phul zer nas /
analyzed: rdzas dang yo byad kun sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs la phul zer nas /
translated: He gave all his possessions and belongings to the Buddha Vipaśyin.

original: de ltar byas nas sems can thams cad chos rtags kyi phyag rgya chen po bzhi la bkod do //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas sems can thams cad chos rtags kyi phyag rgya chen po bzhi la bkod do //
translated: Having done so, he established all sentient beings in the four great seals of the signs of the Dharma.

original: dge slong drug po shi nas dmyal bar skyes so //
analyzed: dge slong drug po shi nas dmyal bar skyes so //
translated: The six monks died and were reborn in hell.

original: dmyal ba de yang lus nya mgo tsam /
analyzed: dmyal ba de yang lus nya mgo tsam /
translated: That hell had a body the size of a fish head,

original: lce dpag tshad tsam du gyur nas rmon dor lnga brgya lnga brgyas rmo ba /
analyzed: lce dpag tshad tsam du gyur nas rmon dor lnga brgya lnga brgyas rmo ba /
translated: with a tongue the size of a league, plowed by five hundred plows five hundred times,

original: lus de la mdung thung stong gis brdeg pa /
analyzed: lus de la mdung thung stong gis brdeg pa /
translated: and that body was struck by a thousand spears.

original: kha na mar lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba za bar gyur to //
analyzed: kha na mar lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba za bar gyur to //
translated: In his mouth he ate burning iron balls.

original: des na gtso bo chos kyi sbyin bdag ste /
analyzed: des na gtso bo chos kyi sbyin bdag ste /
translated: Therefore, the foremost is the lord of the gift of Dharma,

original: phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston /
translated: teaching the meaning of the four seals.

original: de ltar bstan nas kun thar pa la bkod pas 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: de ltar bstan nas kun thar pa la bkod pas 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: Having taught like that, he established everyone in liberation, so he is the supreme object of service of beings.

original: gong du bstan pa'i yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pas nges 'byung nas rnam dag dpal lo //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pas nges 'byung nas rnam dag dpal lo //
translated: Having such qualities as taught above, he is the pure glory of renunciation.

original: de lta bu'i rje btsun 'jam dpal 'di dpal /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rje btsun 'jam dpal 'di dpal /
translated: This venerable Mañjuśrī is glorious.

original: gang zag ji lta bu'i lag tu 'ong zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag ji lta bu'i lag tu 'ong zhe na /
translated: In whose hands does it appear?

original: 'jig rten na skal ba bzang po'i lag tu 'ong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na skal ba bzang po'i lag tu 'ong ngo //
translated: It appears in the hands of those who are fortunate in the world.

original: 'di dang su phrad pa la dpal ldan 'dis 'byor pa kun ster bas na /
analyzed: 'di dang su phrad pa la dpal ldan 'dis 'byor pa kun ster bas na /
translated: Since it bestows all good fortune to whoever encounters it,

original: 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog go //
translated: it is the glorious supreme good fortune of Manjusri.

original: rje btsun ye shes sku can gyi yon tan bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rje btsun ye shes sku can gyi yon tan bstan pa'o //
translated: The qualities of the exalted wisdom body are shown.

original: // da ni ye shes sems dpa' drug po la ye shes lnga'i sgo nas bstod pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: // da ni ye shes sems dpa' drug po la ye shes lnga'i sgo nas bstod pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, the praise of the six wisdom beings by way of the five exalted wisdoms is shown.

original: mchog sbyin la sogs pa me long lta bu'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mchog sbyin la sogs pa me long lta bu'i sgo nas so //
translated: The supreme gift and so forth are by way of the mirror-like exalted wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas chags pa la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chags pa la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi sgo nas so //
translated: The Buddha's passion and so forth are by way of the exalted wisdom of the sphere of reality.

original: sangs rgyas 'dzum pa la sogs pas so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dzum pa la sogs pas so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: The Buddha's smile and so forth are by way of the exalted wisdom of discernment.

original: med pa las byung la sogs pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: med pa las byung la sogs pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: The arisen from non-existence and so forth are by way of the exalted wisdom of equality.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pas bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod do //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pas bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod do //
translated: The Net of Illusory Emanations and so forth praise from the perspective of the wisdom of purposeful activity.

original: 'dud nyi shus bstod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud nyi shus bstod pa'o //
translated: There are twenty bows of praise.

original: da ni phan yon gyi rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: da ni phan yon gyi rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Now, the benefits are presented.

original: rje btsun 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i mtshan brjod pas yon tan gzhung nas 'byung ba bzhin rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi @144b bu mo rjes su 'jug pa rnams la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rje btsun 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i mtshan brjod pas yon tan gzhung nas 'byung ba bzhin rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi @144b bu mo rjes su 'jug pa rnams la 'byung ngo //
translated: By reciting the names of the venerable Bodhisattva Mañjuśrī, the qualities that arise for the sons and daughters of good family who follow are as they appear in the treatise.

original: rje btsun gyi phan yon gyi yon tan bstan pa'o /
analyzed: rje btsun gyi phan yon gyi yon tan bstan pa'o /
translated: The qualities of the benefits of the venerable one are shown.

original: // / sngags kyi don ni gsum ste /
analyzed: // / sngags kyi don ni gsum ste /
translated: The meaning of the mantra is threefold:

original: rtsa ba'i sngags dang / dam bca' ba'i sngags dang / phreng ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags dang / dam bca' ba'i sngags dang / phreng ba'i sngags so //
translated: the root mantra, the vow mantra, and the garland mantra.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags ni aom nas aa yis bstan no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags ni aom nas aa yis bstan no //
translated: The root mantra is from Oṃ to A.

original: don ni chos thams cad 'byung ba'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: don ni chos thams cad 'byung ba'i rang bzhin /
translated: The meaning is the nature of the arising of all phenomena,

original: rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: the nature of purity,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhis rgyas btab pa nas rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhis rgyas btab pa nas rtsa ba'o //
translated: sealed with the four doors of liberation, and so on.

original: dam bca' ba ni pra kri nas ya te'i bar te /
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni pra kri nas ya te'i bar te /
translated: The vow is from Prakṛti to yate.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa /
translated: All spontaneously present phenomena are completely pure.

original: phung po la sogs pa thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa khas blangs pa'o //
translated: All the aggregates and so forth are the nature of the dharmadhatu of all tathagatas.🔽The mantra garland is taught by the letters from a to ra and bha to aḥ.

original: phreng sngags ni aa a'a nas rarbha aa:'i bar gyis bstan pa ni don dam par skye med kyi ye shes spros bral lo //
analyzed: phreng sngags ni aa a'a nas rarbha aa:'i bar gyis bstan pa ni don dam par skye med kyi ye shes spros bral lo //
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is the wisdom of non-arising, free from conceptual elaborations.

original: kun rdzob tu ngag gi dbang phyug la sogs pa sku'i rnam par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ngag gi dbang phyug la sogs pa sku'i rnam par bstan pa'o //
translated: In the relative sense, it is the display of the body of Mañjughoṣa and so forth.

original: sngags kyi yon tan bstan pa'o /
analyzed: sngags kyi yon tan bstan pa'o /
translated: It is the teaching on the qualities of the mantra.
